loans.name: Sadaina

texts.en:
Sadaina lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married, with four children, two of whom go to school. She has additional family members. 

Sadaina sells used clothes on both a retail and a wholesale basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for two years. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 (Ugandan shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy a bale of used clothes. 

Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to make her business prosper. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 35-year-old lady who is married and blessed with three children between 13 and 8 years old. She runs a mobile money transfer business as an agent. This is a business she has done for the past two years with good profits.

She has applied for her first loan, which she plans to use to add more float to the Mpesa business. She plans to use the profits to expand her business. 

In the future, she hopes to grow her business and expand to other businesses.

loans.use: to add business float to process more money transfers for her customers

loans.name: Annidah

texts.en:
Annidah is a 34-year-old lady who is married and blessed with four children between the ages of two and thirteen. She sells different types of fabric to clients in her area of residence. She makes a monthly profit of 20,000 Kenya shillings which, when added to her husband's income, is able to fulfill the family's basic needs.

Annidah has applied for her first loan after becoming a member of VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the funds to buy more fabric for resale to her clients. Her anticipated profits will be used to buy sheep for her family.

In the future, she would like to own a boutique, as well as educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for resale

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y vive en Palpa junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación en la vida son sus hijos, es por eso que desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder apoyar con los gastos del hogar y poder brindar un futuro mejor a su familia.
Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de frutas en el Mercado principal de la Ciudad donde vive, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, innovadora y siempre es muy atenta y amable con los clientes.
Alejandrina está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio y así pueda obtener mayores ganancias. Con esto ella podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando como siempre lo ha hecho para poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener un negocio propio en su domicilio". Gracias Kiva
texts.en:
Alejandrina is an enterprising woman. She is 47 years old, married, and lives with her family in Palpa. 

Her greatest motivation in life is her children and that is why she has worked from a young age to be able to help with the household expenses and provide a better future for her family.

For more than three years she has been selling fruit at the main market of the city where she lives. It is going very well because she is a very responsible and hard-working person, always very attentive and friendly with her customers.

Alejandrina is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have offered her she will be able to buy merchandise for stocking her business and in this way can obtain greater earnings. With this she will be able to improve her family's quality of life and continue striving as she has always done, to fulfill her greatest dream: "To have my own business in my home." Thank you Kiva.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business selling fruit.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 28-year-old married lady blessed with two children. She has run a salon  for  3 years and earns a monthly profit of  25,000 KES. 

She has applied for her third loan and will buy some solar lamps for use in her home. She hopes her business does well so that she can repay her loan and save towards the education of her children.

In future she would like to grow her salon business.

loans.use: to buy some solar lamps.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu  lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with four children; all attend school. She has no  additional family members. 

She operates a restaurant and works five  days a week.  She has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from selling chapatti and cassava chips.

She requested 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, bunches of green bananas, and beans. Her major challenge includes seasonal foods. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy food warmers. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to running water. Her monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy beans, cooking oil, flour, and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase fish and wood

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen would like to take another loan to buy better quality animal feed for her cows. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Yen hopes that another loan will increase the size of her business further. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality animal feed for her cows.

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.en:
Hortencia is 43 years old and lives in her parents house with her two daughters, sister and nieces. Her parents have owned the house for 40 years.

Hortencia started a home-based clothing  business 10 years ago and she sells to a distribution company that has big clients. She has many employees and she produces approximately 500 items per month. 

She asks for a loan to buy manufacturing equipment such as a power generator and ironing board. Hortencia says that her biggest accomplishment is having a profitable business and being able to provide a solid education for her children.

loans.use: to buy equipment for clothes manufacturing,

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao would like to take another loan to buy a cow and pay her children's school fees. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Thao hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy another cow and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven emprendedor, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica solo.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace más de 5 años trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola, le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable y siempre se esmera por realizar trabajos de calidad.
Jorge está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar herramientas de trabajo como horcas, machetes, palas, picos, rastrillos, entre otros para poder mejorar sus trabajos y así pueda más adelante obtener un ascenso. De esta manera  seguirá esforzándose para seguir mejorando su trabajo y más adelante poder cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: "Tener un negocio propio".
texts.en:
Jorge, 33, is an enterprising young man.  He's single and lives alone in Ica.

He's a person with a great desire to get ahead.  He has worked as an agricultural laborer on a farm for more than five years.  It's going very well for him because he's very hardworking and responsible, and he always takes pains to do quality work.

Jorge's grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he'll be able to buy pitchforks, machetes, spades, picks, rakes, and other work tools so he can improve his performance and later get a raise.

That way he'll keep on working hard to improve his work and later be able to achieve one of his biggest goals: to have his own business.

loans.use: to buy tools for work (picks, rakes, spades, and machetes)

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong would like to take a new loan to buy animal feed and pay her children's school fees. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Phuong hopes that the new loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that she can improve both her income and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Fernando Miguel

texts.en:
Fernando Miguel is 59-year-old man and has been a taxi driver in Mexico city for 25 years. He is a widower and has his son, a daughter-in-law and one grandson. 

Fernado describes himself as a hard working, responsible, amicable, and happy person. He drives his taxi every day from 6 AM to 2 PM and form 5 PM to 11PM. He says that one of his biggest skills is his knowledge of Mexico City. 

Fernando asks for a loan to repair his car and to renew his taxi´s license plates.  His biggest accomplishment is being able to save and buy three taxis and a house.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and renew the license plate.

loans.name: Tram's Group

texts.en:
Tram is 57 years old and lives with her three children and husband. Her husband is a laborer in a local company. 

For the past 5 years, Tram has run a food stall from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. Tram is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is second from the right  and wears a grey jacket. Each of the other group members request loans to fund income-generating activities.

Tram requests a loan to purchase better quality food to sell from her stall.  She also wants to buy new furniture to attract more customers to her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. 

She also hopes that she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality food and new furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Benkadi C Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame AMINATA YOUSSOUF débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI C. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 4 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 4 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi C group are married women who on average are 37 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Zerlaba, a village in the Sikasso circle, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Aminata Youssouf, who is standing in the middle of the photo of this Benkadi C group of women.

She will use her loan to buy four 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, four containers of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain one hectare (about 2.47 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 140,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

texts.fr:

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 37, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a local company.

Loan has runs a general store in front of her house for eleven years. She requests a loan to expand her business and buy a variety of different products such as food and beverages to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes that her business continues to run smoothly and will generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions.  She wishes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different products such as food and beverages to sell from her store.

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en:
Xuyen is 48 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She has run a food stall to earn a living. Her husband is a driver.

Xuyen started her business ten years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business and buy a variety of different food to make meals for her customers. 

She hopes that her business continues to run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different food to make meals to serve her customers.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan, 50, is married and has one child. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a food stall in front of their house. 

She started this business fifteen years ago. She sells bread and ice to people in her community. She requests a loan to expand her business and buy equipment and ingredients to make bread to sell and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes that her business continues to run smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment and ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 44 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a factory in the local community. She  earns income from a general store. 

She started her business five years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of food products such as sugar, milk and instant noodles.  She wants to increase her inventory and sell to her customers. 

She hopes that her business continues to run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, and noodles to sell from her store.

loans.name: Djensabatile A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe DJENSABATILE A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à DIASSADIE un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame SALIMATA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme DJENSABATILE A. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  97 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djensabatile A group are married women who on average are 51 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Diassadie, a village in the Loulouni commune, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Salimata, who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Djensabatile A group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two containers of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 97,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her on the one hand to pay off her loan and its interest, and on the other to help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Tho is 46 years old and married with three daughters. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns income through selling clothing. Her husband is a mason.

Tho started her business three years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying clothing in bulk at wholesale prices to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell to her customers from her store

loans.name: Star Group

texts.en:
Njuke, a businesswoman and mother of two school-aged girls, is 40 years old. 

She has run a beauty salon for six years. Njuke depends on this business to generate income for her family. She is not married and lives with her children. She has the responsibility of meeting her children's needs. 

In order to manage her family and business needs, she joined STAR group to request a loan. She wants to  improve her business.  Njuke works from morning till night everyday and is able to make a good profit monthly.

She requests a loan to be shared among Star's three-member group. The members will hold each other accountable to repay the loan. Njuke will use her portion to buy salon hair products to service more people. 

She dreams of improving her business and building a house for her family. 

Njuke is so thankful to everyone who will be willing to support her group.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products to service more people.

loans.name: Benkadi F Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI F sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZERLABA un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Men is a 61-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her child. 

For the past 10 years, Men has run a soft drink and noodle stall to earn an income to support her family. Men is the Group Leader of a 5-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is standing on the right, wearing a purple shirt. Each of the other group members request loans to fund income-generating activities.

Men requests a loan to purchase a better quality of noodles and a greater variety of beverages to sell from her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality of noodles and greater variety of beverages to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Mawenzi Group

texts.en:
Hamida has two daughters, one is school-aged and the youngest is a baby. She is married and lives with her husband. 

The family desires to make their life better. In order to meet her dream for the family, she decided to provide support and start  a batiki (fabrics) business.  She has been in this business for three years. She works really hard from 8 am to 5 pm selling items door-to-door.  She is able to make a good profit each month. 

Hamida requests this first loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She will invest  in her business and replenish her inventory with new batiki. 

She desire to expand her business to earn more income. 

Hamida will share this loan with her loan group "MAWENZI" which consist of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with new batiki.

loans.name: Djensabatile B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe DJENSABATILE B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à DIASSADIE un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame DIALIA débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme DJENSABATILE B.

Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  97 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djensabatile B group are married women who on average are 35 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Diassadie, a village in the Loulouni commune, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Dialia, who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Djensabatile B group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two containers of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 97,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her on the one hand to pay off her loan and its interest, and on the other to help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Saraphina is 40 years old and has managed a poultry and clothing business. She raises broilers chicken to sell.  She has had this business since 1992. She is not married and doesn't have children. She works from  9am to 4pm and is able to make a fair monthly income. 

Saraphina has been a good customer of Tujijenge for two years.  She has good business relationships. She repaid her previous loans and improved poultry production and stared a clothing business. She made a profit which she used to cover welfare costs. In the coming years, she would like to manage a good poultry firm. 

Saraphina will use this loan to buy chicken feed to improve production. She will share this loan with her loan group "Jitegemee" which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed to improve production.

loans.name: Faalogoae

texts.en:
Faalogoae is a 58-year-old widow with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages and tomatoes to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 8 years. 

Faalogoae needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Faalogoae will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an over sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Biako Ye Group

texts.en:
Biako Ye is a group consisting of two members, both of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. They are selling provisions and wax prints. 

One of the members is Gifty, who was selected as the featured borrower of this group. Gifty is a 33-year-old lady living with her husband and her children, who are attending school. She runs a wax prints shop to help her husband financially. She sells wax prints in her shop at the market. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the city. Gifty has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase items like assorted wax prints and sell to customers.

loans.use: To purchase items like assorted wax-prints and sell to customers.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is from Peru. She owns a cleaning business, A&A cleaning services LLC, which has been her main line of business. Her long time dream was to have a hair salon, which is a trade she knows well. She has been saving cash for a long time to cover the start-up costs and finally she found a space in Reisterstown, MD, which is appropriate for the hair salon.
 
Her plan is to hire somebody to carry on the cleaning business while she splits her time between the hair salon and managing the cleaning business. To fulfill her long-time dream, Adela is looking for $8,000 in order to remodel the space and to purchase equipment for the hair salon.

loans.use: to remodel the space and to purchase equipment for the hair salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She has a food stall where she sells baked breadfruit and bananas in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Stella needs a loan to buy a large outdoor stove, firewood, wrapping foil, breadfruit, bananas, plastic bags and a small table. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Stella has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a large outdoor stove, firewood, wrapping foil, breadfruit, bananas, plastic bags and a small table

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 34-year-old single mother of two children. She runs a small taxi business to earn income. She has four years of experience with this business. Tina needs a loan to buy new tires, a taxi sign indicator, new seat covers, new windshield wipers and a new battery. She will use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Tina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a taxi sign indicator, new seat covers, new windshield wipers and a new battery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables and to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Upuia

texts.en: Upuia is 36 years old and divorced with one child. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbage to sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Upuia needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Upuia will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Nofo

texts.en: Nofo is a 44-year-old single mother of five children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Nofo needs a loan to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Nofo joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing canoe, a large cooler, a chest freezer, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Alaifue

texts.en: Alaifue is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. To earn a living, she runs a small canteen in her community and has six years of experience with this business. Alaifue needs a loan to buy sandwiches, doughnuts, pies, scones, snacks, soft drinks and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Alaifue has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, doughnuts, pies, scones, snacks, soft drinks and paper plates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Djensabatile C Group

texts.fr:
Les 2 membres du groupe DJENSABATILE C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à DIASSADIE un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame  FATOUMATA YACOUBA  débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme DJENSABATILE C. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  35 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The two members of the Djensabatile C group are married women who on average are 25 years old with two children, living for the most part in traditional families in Diassadie, a village in the Loulouni commune, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Fatoumata Yacouba, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Djensabatile C group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.25 hectares (about 0.62 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 35,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her on the one hand to pay off her loan and its interest, and on the other to help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to sell in a flea market.

loans.name: Rosa Dinora

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 41 años de edad,  se dedica a los oficios domesticos, esta acompañada su pareja trabaja de jornal tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos estan acompañados y tienen sus hogares y los otros dos estudian, nadie mas vive con ella solamente tres dependen de ella.

Ella es empleada domestica tiene dos años de desempeñar este tipo de trabajo, decidio trabajar para tener un ingreso economico para sus hijos tambien realiza limpieza en una inglesia por la cual tambien recibe un salario, la distancia a sus lugares de trabajao esta como a 1 km.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto, mejorara mucho ya que tendra ganando y por lo tanto tendra mejor calidad de vida.  Sus sueños son que sus hios estudien y se preparen academicamente y a la vez espera trabajar de la mejor manera con el ganado, ya que le ayduara mucho tanto en lo economico como para enseñarles a los hijos el trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old and is a housewife. She lives with her partner who works as a day laborer. They have four children of whom two are married and have their own homes, and the other two attend school. No one else lives with her; only three are dependent on her.

She is a housekeeper and has been doing this type of work for two years. She decided to work so that she could have income for her children. She also does cleaning at a church, for which she also receives a salary. The distance from her workplaces is about 1 km.

The loan she is requesting is to buy cattle for grazing. This will be a great improvement as she will have cattle and therefore will have a better quality of life. Her dream is for her children to study and prepare themselves academically. At the same time she hopes to work in the best way with her cattle, as it will help her a great deal, both financially as well is in teaching her children the work.

loans.use: To buy cattle for grazing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a tok tok.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his grandson's school expenses.

loans.name: Jekafo A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  JEKAFO A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame  NAKAN débout au millieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JEKAFO A. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  85 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jekafo A group are married women who on average are 31 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in the Loulouni commune, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Nakan, who is standing in the middle of the photo of this Jekafo A group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her on the one hand to pay off her loan and its interest, and on the other to help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Santos Estanislao

texts.es:
Santos de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios.

 Él actualmente está soltero y vive junto con su mamá, y ella es la que depende de él.

Santos tiene 5 años de trabajar de corralero, es decir se dedica al cuido de ganado lechero, comienza esta labor desde las 5 de la mañana ya que a esa hora comienza con el ordeño y finaliza a las 5 de la tarde; aprendió este trabajo gracias a un tío que se lo enseño cuando él estaba pequeño, y decidió dedicarse a este trabajo ya que es una manera muy sana de ganarse la vida. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 5 sacos de fertilizante, 2 bolsas de  semilla de maíz. De esta manera, pretende obtener buenos rendimientos de su cosecha de maíz.  

A futuro desea tener alimentación para su familia, durante un año,  ya que sus padres ya están mayores y no pueden trabajar muy fuerte así que él desea darles los insumos necesarios para que puedan tener la alimentación que necesitan.
texts.en:
Santos is 40 years old, and studied through the fourth grade; he was unable to continue his studies due to limited financial resources. He is currently single and lives with his mom, who he supports.
 
Santos has worked for 5 years as a ranch hand, taking care of dairy cattle. He begins work at 5am, when the milking begins, and ends at 5pm. He learned this work from an uncle who taught him when he was little, and he decided to pursue it as a career, as it is a very healthy way of living. 

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase 5 bags of fertilizer, and 2 bags of corn seed. With this, he aims to obtain a large output of his corn crop. 

In the future he wants to have enough food to feed his family, because his parents are getting old and can not work hard, so he wants to be able provide the food to sustain them.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of fertilizer and 2 bags of corn seed, which he will use to obtain a large output of his corn crop.

loans.name: Turdubu

texts.ru: Турдубу 65 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей. Более 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес начала с покупки 10 овец. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Турдубу, а также сплоченности, ее семья достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль от реализации козьего и коровьего молока. В хозяйстве имеется 3 дойные коровы, 3 лошади, 50 овец, а также 1,20 ГА поливной земли, где Турдубу выращивает фасоль и картофель. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турдубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку пяти бычков и селитры. Доходы от кредита Турдубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве, а также в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Turdubu is 65 years old, married, and the mother of six children. For more than twenty years she has worked raising livestock and farming. She started her business with ten sheep. Because of Turdubu's extremely hard work along with her family's unity, they have made great strides in developing the farm, and they began to receive a monthly income from selling goat and cow milk. The farm has three dairy cows, three horses, fifty sheep, and 1.20 hectares of irrigated land where Turdubu grows beans and potatoes. In order to further develop her farm, Turdubu approached the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 150,000 KGS to buy five bulls and nitrate. Turdubu plans to invest profit from the loan into further increasing her livestock on the farms, and in the future, she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: buy bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's college tuition.

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул всегда упорно трудится, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и прокормить своих 6 детей. Ее муж водитель. Сама Нозигул занимается бизнесом. Она продает одежду на местном рынке. Она продает как женские одежды, так и мужские одежды. Нозигул этим бизнесом занимается более 6 лет. Она торгует на местном рынке и ее дочь помогает ей введению бизнеса. Нозигул постепенно год за годом развевает свой бизнес. Она каждый сезон обновляет ассортимент товара, так как конкуренция на местном рынке большая. Нозигул является повторной клиенткой ИМОН. Она имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Нозигул честная женщина. Она использовала предыдущие займы для развития бизнеса. Данное время она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки одежды для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nozigul always works hard to make money and feed her six children. Her husband is a driver. Nozigul is in business. She sells clothes at the local market. She sells women's and men's clothing. Nozigul has been doing this for more than six years. She sells in the local market, and her daughter helps her run her business. Gradually, Nozigul is expanding her business. Every season she updates her inventory since there is a great deal of competition in the local market. Nozigul is a repeat client of IMON. She has a good credit record. Nozigul is an honest woman. She used previous loans for business development. This time she is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy clothes to increase her working capital. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: buy clothes to increase working capital

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.ru: Махсуда заботливая мать 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Она всегда старается для их благополучия. Муж Махсуды мастер по ремонту дома. Сама Махсуда торгует на местном рынке. Она продает сухофрукты. Махсуда покупает оптом и реализует в розницу. Она продает разнообразные виды сухофруктов как изюм, миндаль, фисташки, фундук, курага и т.п. Махсуда данным бизнесом занимается уже более 3 лет. Она данное время нуждается финансовой поддержке, так как она должна купить сухофрукты для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahsuda is the caring mother of three young children. She always strives to do what is best for their welfare. Her husband, Masood, is a specialist in home repair. Mahsuda sells in the local market. She sells dried fruit. Mahsuda buys wholesale and sells retail. She sells various kinds of dried fruit like raisins, almonds, pistachios, hazelnuts, dried apricots, etc. Mahsuda has been doing this for more than three years. She is currently in need of financial support, since she must buy dried fruit to increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to buy dried fruit. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: buy dried fruit.

loans.name: Hatun Rumiyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia Victoria pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Victoria continua con su negocio de elaboración de tortas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia elabora las tortas para los distintos compromisos que solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio e cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesania, venta de cosmeticos,produccion de zapatos, periodista, contadora.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Hatun Rumiyoc” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. She continues her business of making cakes. Victoria is a responsible and industrious person who makes cakes that are requested for various events. She has been in business for quite some time and it has brought her both personal and financial satisfaction. Being in business has allowed her to help her family move forward.

Victoria is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and other items. She is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

The members who appear in the attached photos requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of their work. The other group members sell handicrafts, sell cosmetics, produces shoes, while one member works as a writer, and another as an accountant.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en: Alberto finished paying his first loan and now is asking for a new loan. He will use the money to continue investing in his car shop. He will buy some additional tools and buy some auto parts. Alberto has been fixing cars for more than 30 years. He says that he has a lot of experience and a lot of returning clients. He is happily married to Guadalupe and has two beautiful daughters, Diana Guadalupe who is 15 and Paola who is 9.

loans.use: To condition and refurbish the repair shop in his house.

loans.name: David Joel

texts.es:
David tiene 23 años de edad, esta acompañdo, estudio hasta noveno grado de educación básica esta acompañado su pareja se dedica a los oficios domesticos tiene una hija que vive con él pero aun no estudia.

David trabaja con ganado de repasto lo ha hecho por 4 años y lo aprendio de su papá y decidio dedicarse a este negocio para tener un ingreso economico mejor, tambien se dedica a la agricultura y a trabajar de jornal antes solo era empleado jornal.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto.  Sueña con poder trabajar mas fuerte con ganado y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
David is 23 years old and in a relationship.  He finished his ninth grade basic education.  His partner works in the home, and he has a daughter who lives with him, and is not yet in school.   David has worked at fattening cattle for the past four years, having leaned this from his father. He decided to earn a living at this work to have a better income.  David also works at farming and at day labor; in the past he just worked as a day laborer. 

David is asking for a loan to buy cattle to fatten.  He dreams of being able to work harder with cattle and be able to offer his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Sajida's Group loan of $3,000 helped a member to buy a fitness machine and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Katherine Milagros

texts.es:
Katherine es una joven emprendedora, tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Quilmana junto a su familia.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante sola para poder brindarle todo lo mejor a su hijo. Pese a las circunstancias desfavorables por las que atravesaba pudo sobresalir por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo. Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como Obrera de campo en un Fundo Agrícola, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y siempre dedicada a su labor.
Katherine está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes de su domicilio y arreglar las ventanas, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Katherine is an enterprising young woman. She is 18 years old, single, and lives with her family in Quilmana.

Being a single mother, Katherine has had to look for ways to move forward on her own so that she can provide all the best of her child. Despite having gone through unfavorable circumstances, she has been able to overcome them and press forward for the welfare of her young child. For more than one year, she has been working as a field laborer on a farming estate. She is doing very well because she is a responsible and hardworking individual who is always dedicated to her job.

Katherine is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have given. She will be able to remodel house by whitewashing the walls and repairing the windows, which will improve her quality of life. Katherine continues to strive forward until she finishes the construction of her house.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of the Zainab Group's $3,000 loan helps a member to buy an air-cooler and an iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Each member of Abeer's Group loan of $3,000 intends to buy an air-cooler and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Azhar's $3,000 Group loan is to buy an air-conditioner and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 49 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children who are now of adult age. Angelita earns a living from fishing activity. She earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional fishing nets and other fishing accessories. She has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, Angelita hopes to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing accessories.

loans.name: Welita

texts.en:
Welita is 59 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. A widowed mother of five adult-aged children, she has a fish and snack vending business, earning approximately PHP 2,000.00 each month. 

A member of PMPC for almost 12 years, Welita has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repair and renovation. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase construction materials for house repair and renovation

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel moved to the United States from Cuba three years ago. She took a couple of jobs to sustain herself. After working as a pool caretaker, she saw an opportunity to start a business and sustain her family. 

“I saw a small family business where each member of the family could contribute their own skills,” envisioned Mabel. 

Using her income from a part-time job, Mabel began NEXPRO, a full-service pool and garden maintenance company. A natural entrepreneur, Mabel is proud to execute her idea to the fullest. NEXPRO provides various services that allow clients to visit a “one-stop” solution for all their outdoor needs. The business has grown to six clients and word continues to spread.

However, in order to add more pools to her existing route, she needs capital to service these routes. Help Mabel grow her business and provide jobs to the other members of her family!

loans.use: to have working capital to service more pools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's college expenses and buy her a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education and buy a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a water basin

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina is 67 years old and lives in Baga, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with six children who are now at their adult age.  Divina earns a living from her business, buying and selling copra and nuts. She earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional coconuts and sacks of copra for resale. Divina has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Divina hopes to expand her copra and nuts buy and sell business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and sacks of copra to sell.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 42 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now of school age. 

Matilde is engaged in a business dealing with real estate and is presently working as sales manager at one of the country’s real estate companies. She is earning approximately 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in paying the tuition fees of her children who are presently studying in Cebu City. Matilde has become a member of PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative) just this year. In the future, Matilde hopes to engage in other forms of business.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 46 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are school age. Amelita has been engaged in managing a sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumable products for two years.  She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods for retail. Amelita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Amelita hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years; she earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 65 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Rosalina has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Rosalina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Mauro Alberto

texts.es:
Mauro de 40 años de edad, estudio primer grado, debido a la falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar sus estudios, esta acompañado y tiene 5 hijos de 21, 19, 17, 14 y 4 años de edad de los cuales solo depende de él uno que es el que esta estudiando. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también le ayuda a Mauro en la siembra de maíz (agricultura), en el cuido de animales y en una granja de cerdos donde también lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos, desde hace 25 años este oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres. Para llegar al lugar donde él trabaja tiene que caminar un kilometro, el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM luego tiene que ayudar a otros oficios de la casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando Mauro en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras y para el cultivo de 14,000  metros cuadrados de maíz, comprara semilla, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas; manifiesta que con el crédito obtenido en la institución mejorara su situación de vida, esto ayudara a llevar mejor ingreso a su grupo familiar.
Mauro sueña en poder construir una casa de ladrillo, ya en la que actualmente vive es de bahareque y esta en mal estado.
texts.en:
Mauro is 40 years old. He studied until the first grade, but due to a lack of economic resources, he was unable to continue his studies. He is married and has 5 children who are 21, 19, 17, 14 and 4 years old and who depend on him. One is currently in school. His wife manages the household chores and she also helps Mauro to sow the corn (agriculture), care for the animals and with a pig farm where his children also help out. It has been 25 years since he learned this type of work from his parents. 

To arrive at the place where he works, he has to walk a kilometer. His work schedule is 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM. Afterward, he has to help with other housework. The loan that Mauro is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy two milk cows and for the cultivation of 14,000 square meters of corn. He will buy seeds, manure, pesticides and herbicides. It is clear that with the loan obtained from this institution he will improve his situation in life. This will help him earn a higher income for his family. Mauro dreams of building a brick house, since the one he currently lives in is made from mud and is in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows and for the cultivation of 14,000 square meters of corn. He will buy seeds, manure, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Raida

texts.en:
Raida is 35 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Raida has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from selling food.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma, 22 years old and single, and has been engaged in a hog raising business. She raises one sow and six piglets. Lerma also manages a vegetable backyard. She decided to run all these businesses to help her parents in generating income to be able to sustain her family's basic needs. 

In order to maintain her source of income, she is asking loan of PHP 5,000, allowing her to buy a stock of hog feed and essential vitamins, and some amount will be use for her farming business.

She hopes and pray that they will grant the amount of loan she requested, to continue produce healthier hogs which will enable her to obtain greater income someday.

loans.use: to buy a stock of hog feed and essential vitamins, and some amount will be used for her farming business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 32 years old, is married and lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Mary Ann operates her own sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP for additional capital to buy more basic commodities for store retail.

Mary Ann is a new member of PMPC (Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative). In the future, Mary Ann hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more basic commodities for store retail.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 25 years old, and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, eggs, milk, chips, etc.

Mariam has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years, and also earns an income from buy and sell root crops.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soft drinks, eggs, milk, chips, etc

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza is 40 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, charcoal, shampoo, bread, groceries, etc. 

Meliza has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from a pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, charcoal, shampoo, bread, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Isabel to improve her business. She is married and has five children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy everyday. She will buy some additional supplies such as fish, canes, beer, oils, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels comfortable running her business, because she can earn money everyday.

Running a business has made Isabel independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  She is happy with this loan because it is offered for poor people, and can improve her living conditions in the future. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fish, canes, beer, oils, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 29 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $50.00. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes, jackets, and long sleeve and short sleeve shirts. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. 

She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes, jackets, and long sleeve and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Gs El Aguacatal Group

texts.es:
La señora Sebastiana de 48  años de edad es casada  tiene dos hijos  que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad El Aguacatal langue, Valle  al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 25  años  al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, ella cultiva el grano con la ayuda de su familia y también contrata para sembrar y limpiar a varios empleados. Ella es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación ya que a su edad realiza este trabajo.
Ella es la líder del grupo solidario El Aguacatal y está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la  siembra de maíz y frijoles, con el  apoyo del crédito ella pretende mejorar su cosecha y obtener buenos resultados en sus granos ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvias.
la señora Cristina y Dalva ambas se dedican a la agricultura al igual que Doña Sebastiana. El sueño de Doña Sebastiana es tener una buena cosecha y que el precio del grano este bueno para la venta.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is 48 years old, married and has two children who depend on her. She lives in the community El Aguacatal Langue, Valle in southern Honduras. She has her own house and has worked for 25 years cultivating corn and beans. She cultivates the grain with the help of her family and also contracts out to several employees to sow the seeds and clear the land. 

She is an exemplar of hard work and dedication since she is able to do this work at her age. She is the leader of the solidarity group El Aguacatal and is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and fertilizers to to plant corn and beans. With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her harvest and have better quality grain since the rainy season is approaching. Cristina and Dalva both work in agriculture like Sebastiana. Sebastiana's dream is to have a good harvest and that the price of the grain is good in the market.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2014

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant her crops.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her business. Rosalie has been in this business for five years. She also earns more income from a general store. Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Reymonda

texts.en: Reymonda is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Reymonda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Reymonda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Reymonda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blocks, iron, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
La Sra Maria De La Cruz es profesora de un centro escolar publico donde imparte clases a ninos de entre 10 A 14 anos en una comunidad del municipio de Leon desde hace 28 anos, iniciando su jornada laboral a las 7:30 am terminando a las 12:30 de lunes a viernes. 
La Sra Maria De La Cruz esta solicitando este credito para mejorar su casa de habitacion remodelando el area de su cocina y prepararse para la entrada de la temporada del invierno y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María de La Cruz is a professor of a public school where she has been giving classes to children from 10 to 14 years of age for the past 28 years in a community of the municipality of Leon. She starts her daily work at 7:30 AM, finishing at 12:30 from Monday to Friday.

María de La Cruz is applying for this loan to improve her house by remodeling her kitchen and to prepare herself for the start of the winter season and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron.

loans.name: Gs El Chorro # 2 Group

texts.es:
1.-La Señora  Mercys  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  su esposo y sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es pulpería desde hace más de 5 años.
El préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de churros,  refrescos,  pan, café,  azúcar, maíz,  frijoles, etc. Con el crédito  ella espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan,  y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años ella espera con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona, y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.
2.-Telma  su negocio es   pulperia  desde hace 6 años 
3.-Danialiceth su negocio es la  venta  de  cerdos desde hace 5 años.
3.-Evelin su negocio es la  compra  venta  de cerdos desde hace 2 años.

Choluteca, Honduras –  Junio   del 2013
texts.en:
1. Mercys is a very enterprising person who lives with her husband and children in a community in southern Honduras. For over 5 years, her business has been a grocery store. The loan she needs is to purchase churros, sodas, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, etc. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales due to the new capital and her offerings for the clients who visit her. This will allow her to cover her expenses. In this way, she hopes to improve the economic situation of her home and hopes this will be reflected in this investment. In a few years, she hopes that her business will be positioned as the largest and most well-known in the zone. She hopes to continue supporting her family so that they may become good members of the society and have better opportunities.

2. Telma - Her business is a grocery store, established 6 years ago.

3. Danialiceth - Her business is in pig sales, established 5 years ago.

4. Evelyn - Her business is buying and selling pigs, established 2 years ago.

Choluteca, Honduras - June 2013

loans.use: to buy churros, sodas, bread, coffee, sugar, corn, beans, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es: El señor Silvio habita en el municipio de La Concepción, casado padre de dos hijos quienes están en edades escolares, su esposa labora como docente en un centro educativo del municipio, el tiene una panadería delas cuales le genera ganancias para mantener el hogar, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de Materiales como cemento, arena, ventanas, etc. para terminar de completar si vivienda, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva en conjunto a Afodenic le están brindando con este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mr. Silvio lives in the town of La Concepción, a married father of two school-aged children. His wife works as a teacher in a school in town. Silvio has a bakery that generates income to maintain the household. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials like cement, sand, windows, etc. to finish building his house. He appreciates the support Kiva and Afodenic provide with this funding.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Isamar Escobar

texts.es: Isamar tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 meses y 5 años de edad. El esposo de Isamar se dedica a la pesca y ella se encarga a la venta del pescado. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y visionaria quien desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra  lámina galvanizada, madera, arena, cemento, grava, etc. Para cambiar las láminas de la vivienda y para encementar el piso de la misma y dar a su familia condiciones más saludables.
texts.en:
Isamar is 23 years old and lives in her own home, together with her life partner and two children, who are aged seven months and five years. Her husband works as a fisherman, and Isamar is in charge of selling the fish. In this way they make their living and provide sustenance for their household.

Isamar is a very hard-working woman with a strong vision, who wishes to improve conditions in her home. This has led her to seek this loan from FUSAI, in order to invest in buying galvanized sheet metal, wood, sand, cement, gravel, etc.  She will use these to replace her roofing and lay cement on the floor, to give her family healthier living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to replace the roof of her home and lay a cement floor.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Don Roberto de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de focos, regletas, y antenas para TV desde hace un año su negocio lo tiene ubicado en lugar muy estratégico para la venta y muy transitado por personas por lo cual posee una gran demanda, es un hombre responsable, honesto y muy trabajador con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia, Roberto está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más mercadería por mayor y así obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Roberto, 52, lives in his own home with his wife.  He sells lights, multiple socket outlets and TV antennae.  He has had this business for a year.  It is located in a very strategic place in a busy area where there is a lot of demand, which helps sales.  

He is a responsible, honest and hard-working man who strives to take care of his family.  

He is asking for a loan to buy more material wholesale, so that he can improve his profits and raise the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 28 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rowena has been pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rowena is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional bananas to sell at her banana business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Ruth is borrowing 25,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now, she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to make dried fish. Sarah has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Florimina

texts.en:
Florimina is 35 years old and married with two children.

Florimina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional stocks like candies, cooking oil, beers, soft-drinks, coffee, snack foods, dried fish, etc. to sell.

Florimina has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling food.

Florimina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like candies, cooking oil, beers, soft-drinks, coffee, snack foods, dried fish, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 61 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional items to sell like rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, soap, sugar, groceries, etc.

Tessie has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, eggs, charcoal, shampoo, soap, sugar, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off debt and to invest in a pupusa business.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro de 50 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de ingeniería civil en la universidad nacional de Nicaragua, lugar de origen de su madre, su padre es de origen salvadoreño, su familia estaba formada de cinco hermanos quienes trabajaban fuertemente en las algodoneras y la agricultura (siembre de maíz y frijoles), él se vino junto a su padre hace más de cuarenta años a vivir a El Salvador.
