La  esposa de Ramiro se dedica a la venta de ropa para todas las edades en la comunidad, ellos son padres de dos hijos de 14 y 13 años.
Ramiro aprendió a trabajar en la albañilería hace treinta años cuando unos amigos y su tío le enseñaron, ya él desde joven trabajaba de ayudante de albañil junto con su padre y sus familiares, hoy en día él trabaja de lunes a sábado de maestro de obra en diferentes proyectos de construcción. Antes trabajaba en la ganadería de ayudante con su padre.
El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar mercadería (ropa para todas las edades) y necesita $500.00 para terminar de ajustar el dinero para comprar 437.50 metros cuadrados de tierra que le venden en la comunidad.
Con la mercadería de ropa, podrá aumentar con su esposa las ventas pues ella apoya al hogar con las ganancias económicas para el sostén de la familia y con su pequeño lote de tierra podrá tener donde construir su propio hogar, ya que actualmente está alquilando con su esposa, ya teniendo su casa propia en el futuro podrá darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 
Uno de los sueños más importantes para Ramiro es construir poco a poco su vivienda donde estar descansando y darles un hogar seguro a sus hijos. Además, pretende seguir trabajando en los diferentes proyectos de construcción, quiere seguir apoyando a su esposa con el negocio de la ropa, ya que les es rentable pues sale a vender a las comunidades aledañas a la zona.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 50 years old, studied civil engineering for three years in the national university of Nicaragua, his mother's birth country.  His father is from El Salvador.  Ramiro's family was one of five brothers who worked hard at cotton production and farming (planting corn and beans).  More than forty years ago, he and his father came to El Salvador to live.   Ramiro's wife works at selling clothes for all ages in the community; they are parents of two children, ages 13 and 14.  
Ramiro learned to work at construction thirty years ago, taught by his uncle and some friends.  Since he was a young man, he worked as a mason's assistant along with his father and relatives.  Today he works from Monday through Saturday as a master craftsman on various construction projects.  He used to work helping his father raise cattle. 
He is seeking a loan from CREDICAMPO to buy merchandise (clothes for all ages) and needs $500 to be able to afford to buy 437.50 square meters of land for sale in his community.
With the clothing sales, he will along with his wife increase sales since she also supports the household with the profits to support the family. His small piece of land will be a place to build his own home, since now he is renting along with his wife.  Owning his own home in the future will permit him to give the children a better quality of life.
One of the dreams that matters most to Ramiro is to build his home little by little, a place to rest and give a secure home to his children.  Besides this he wants to continue with various construction projects, and to continue supporting his wife in her clothing sales.  Since this business has been profitable for them, he goes out to sell at nearby communities.

loans.use: .to buy merchandise (clothes for all ages) and to have enough money ($500) to afford to buy 437.5 square meters of land

loans.name: Moisesa

texts.en:
Moisesa is 44 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Moisesa is borrowing 9,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Moisesa has been involved in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 62 years old, married, and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Virginia requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming rice for nine years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Alonso

texts.es: Carlos tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Carlos se dedica a la venta de productos básicos en una pequeña tienda, también la esposa le aporta con su trabajo y juntos mantienen la economía del hogar. El actualmente tiene en su vivienda 2 cuartos en construcción pero por falta de fondos no los ha logrado terminar, es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena y grava para terminar de construir los cuartos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 56 years old and lives in his own home with his spouse. He works selling basic products at a small store. His spouse works with him and together they maintain the household.
Carlos currently has two rooms under construction at his home but he has been unable to finish them due to a lack of funds. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase cement, sand and gravel so that he can finish the construction of these rooms.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel to finish construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair the roof and floor of her home.

loans.name: Jekafo B Group

texts.fr:
Les 9 membres du groupe JEKAFO B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOKOUNA un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec madame MAMINATA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JEKAFO B. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Group Jekafo B’s nine members are married women. They are on average 29 years old with two children, and most live in traditional families in Kokouna, a village in the township of Loulouni, Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They are collaborating with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to conduct their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their seventh rural loan with Soro Yiriwaso; previous loans were paid back without issues.

Mrs. Maminata, who is standing in the middle in group Jekafo B's photo, cultivates ground nuts. With her loan, she is planning to purchase one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and to pay the plowing costs for one acre of land. After the harvest, production is sold locally in the village, to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and extends credits.

She is forecasting an average profit of 73,000 XOF per agricultural cycle. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan with interest, and also to help her husband providing for the family’s daily needs.

loans.use: tobuy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Johana Nicolasa

texts.es: Johana Nicolasa, mayor de edad madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial en el ron, azúcar, caña, es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitación una pulperia donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo diario como:sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, huevos, sal, pan, leche, frijoles cosidos, caja de fósforo, cigarros por unidad, arroz, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, gaseosas, jugos, aceite, pastes de baño, pasta dental, papel higiénicos, sopas maggi, sopas marucha, cosméticos, productos congelados, entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras y distribuidores que le dejan el producto en las puertas de su casa, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales y su ventas son al contado, con el ánimo de sacar a sus hijos adelante aprendío esta actividad y hasta la fecha ha sido su fuente de trabajo como también de ingresos ya que ha mejorado sus ingresos de su casa. Lo inicie con fondos propios 8 años atrás y con los prestamos he logrado poco a poco incrementar el inventario así como también el capital de trabajo, Johana es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora en la vida para sacar a sus hijos adelante y darle un futuro mejor, y brindarles las oportunidades que lamentablemente ella no tuvo por falta de recursos económicos, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su casa de habitación para ofrecerles mejores condiciones a sus hijos, ampliar su negocio y ver realizados sus sueños en coronar a sus hijos en todos unos profesionales, El objetivo de este financiamiento es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y en un futuro cercano aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Johana Nicolas is a single mother with two minor children who are still under her care.  She is from one of the Chinandega municipalities that is located in the western part of the country.  The area is known for being commercially productive of rum, sugar, and sugarcane.  She is a small businesswoman who has a grocery store at her house. She sells all types of products that are consumed daily.  She sells things like shampoo packets, tomato sauce packets, eggs, salt, bread, milk, cooked beans, matchboxes, individual cigarettes, rice, sugar, soap, detergent, soft drinks, juice, cooking oil, bath scrubbers, toothpaste, toilet paper, Maggi soups, Marucha soups, cosmetics, and frozen products, among others.  She makes her purchases for cash from distributors who leave the products at the door to her house.  She has fixed and casual customers, and her sales are for cash.

As a single mother, and out of the desire to get her children ahead, she learned this business activity.  So far it has been her source of work and also her source of income.  Her household income has improved.  She started with her own funds eight years ago.  With the loans, she has managed to increase her inventory, as well as the working capital, little by little.

Johana is a hard-working and tenacious woman so that she can get her children ahead and give them a better future.  She wants to give them opportunities, that sadly, she did not have due to lack of financial resources.  One of her dreams is to expand her business and to see her dreams fulfilled by her children becoming professionals.

The objective of this loan is to invest working capital and to stock her grocery store.  She will do this in order to improve her customer service and to increase her income in the near future.

loans.use: to stock her inventory.

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr:
Abdourahmane, est enseignant de profession depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père de trois enfants. Il est actif de 8h à 18heures et de son temps libre, il s’occupe des poussins qu’il élève. Cette activité parallèle lui permet de joindre les deux bouts et de s’occuper de sa famille.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il pourra acheter 150 poussins et l’aliment qui pourra les nourrir jusqu’à ce qu’ils arrivent à terme.
Abdourahmane veut développer son élevage de volaille, augmenter le nombre de sujets et devenir un grand fournisseur de poulets de chair dans les hôtels, les restaurants et les hôpitaux.
texts.en:
Abdourahmane has been a schoolteacher for over ten years. He is married and a father of three. He works from 8am to 6pm; in his free time, he takes care of the chicks that he is raising. This supplementary activity allows him to make ends meet and to take care of his family.

With the money loaned, he will be able to purchase 150 chicks and the feed they will need to fatten.

Abdourahmane wants to grow his chicken-raising business, increase the number of his animals, and become a major provider of meat chicken for hotels, restaurants, and hospitals.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Anita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Anita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, beer, snack foods, cooking oil, noodles, biscuits, and cereals.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tura

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Tura works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs, water buffalo, goats and cows and buying and selling charcoal. Tura is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like sugar, coffee, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Tura has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like sugar, coffee, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Macrina has been in this business for five years now.

Macrina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and married, with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like sugar, eggs, charcoal, rice, shampoo, oil, and groceries.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from fish-vending and pig-fattening.

Yolanda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like sugar, eggs, charcoal, rice, shampoo, oil, and groceries.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en: Rosenda is a 38-year-old, married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosenda has a buy and sell fashion accessories business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of fashion accessories to sell. Rosenda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fashion accessories to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 35 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, cooking oil, noodles, detergent soap, and candies. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ana Cleotilde

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y con sus tres hijos,ella se dedica a la crianza de gallina ponedoras desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, Ana solicita un crédito para la compra de concentrado para las gallinas y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, lives with her life partner and her three children.

She has earned a living raising laying hens for several years.  She sells her products in the various markets near her house.  She manages to pay for some of her household necessities with what she earns from her sales.

Ana's requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed for the hens so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Maira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Maira es una mujer emprendedora que está luchando por mantener su negocio en el cual lleva 3 años consecutivos de tener su negocio , la socia se dedica a vender sopas los fines de semanas y ademas tiene un pequeño taller de carpinteria donde fabrica  mesitas y sillas de madera. Con ese negocio doña Maira se ayuda para mantener a sus tres hijos de 4, 7 y 3 años, la socia cuenta con el apoyo  de su esposo que se encarga de fabricar  las sillas y mesas. Con el prestamo  quiere invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como  de yuca, achote, hierba buena, carne de res, hueso, ayote, chayote, ayote, etc. Con los créditos que ha obtenido ha logrado hacerles mejoras a la casa y también mantener el negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Maira is an entrepreneurial woman who is fighting to maintain the business she has had for three consecutive years. She works selling soaps during the weekend and also has a small carpentry workshop where she makes little tables and chairs. With this business, Doña Maira helps to support her three children who are four, seven and three years old. Maira counts on the help of her spouse, who is in charge of making the chairs and tables. 

Maira would like to invest this loan in the purchase of raw material like yucca, achote, mint, beef, bone, and squash.  With the loans she has had so far, she has managed to improve her home and maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy products like achote, mint and yucca.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodproducts (rice, corn, beans).

loans.name: Mary Christ

texts.en:
Mary Christ is studying at Medina College. She was determined and wants to finish her studies, to have a bright future of her own. She has a part-time job watching over her little cousin and she earns an extra income from this. 

She had her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) for her uniform, books, and other necessary costs. Recently, she took a new loan to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.  

Mary Christ hopes to become successful and be able to have a nice job, gained from her untiring efforts.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 53 years old and has a live-in partner with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like eggs, bread, biscuits, juice, milk, soft-drinks, canned goods, etc. 

Dorothy has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 45 years and also earns additional income from a bakery. Dorothy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like eggs, bread, biscuits, juice, milk, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 31 years old and married, with two children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Alicia has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from fish-vending.

Alicia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Midelyn

texts.en:
Midelyn is 35 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Midelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stock like canned goods, toothpaste, detergent soap, beer, soft drinks, and juice to sell.

Midelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, toothpaste, detergent soap, beer, soft drinks, and juice. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, toothpaste, detergent soap, beer, soft drinks, and juice to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Julieta is borrowing PHP 17,500 through NWTF to purchase bamboo to weave for her bamboo weaving business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo to weave.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is 59 years old and married with ten children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Irenea has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice. Irenea aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Amanda Esperanza

texts.es:
Amanda de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta tercer  grado por falta de motivación y otras razones económicas no pudo seguir la escuela, está casada su pareja se dedica a trabajar en una mototaxi propia, trabaja todo los días y con esto contribuye en gran parte a los ingresos de la familia. Tienen  2 hijos un varón de 11 años y una niña de 6, la niña estudia parvulario y el niño sexto grado.

Ella es comerciante,  una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día se esfuerza para darles a su familia lo necesario. Amanda posee un negocio en el mercado de la ciudad en el que vende productos de primera necesidad, entre ellos están guacales, vasos, platos, cucharas etc. Tiene 4 años de tener negocio propio pero antes le apoyaba a su mamá en el negocio de ella. Ahí fue donde tomo la iniciativa de poner su propio negocio. Su horario es de 7 de la mañana a 1 de la tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  guacales, vasos, platos, cucharas etc. La necesidad satisfecha será el comprar por mayor más producto,  esto le genera un ahorro en sus compras y  una mejor ganancia.

Desea tener primero lo más necesario para ella y sus hijos, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad de generar más ventas y tener más clientela, las ganancias serán destinadas una parte al gasto de la casa, al pago de la cuota y en seguir invirtiendo.
texts.en:
Amanda is 34 years old. She went to school up to the third grade, and for lack of motivation and other economic reasons she couldn't continue her education. She is married and her husband works as an independent motorcycle taxi driver; he works every day and with this contributes a large part of the family's income. They have 2 children, an 11-year-old boy and a girl who is 6. The girl is in kindergarten and the boy is in sixth grade.

She is a merchant, a hard-working woman who day by day works to provide her family with the necessities. Amanda has a business in the city market where she sells basic goods, including crates, glasses, plates, spoons, etc. She has had her own business for 4 years, but before this she helped her mother in her business. That is where she took the initiative to have her own business. Her work schedule is from 7 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. 

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase crates, glasses, plates, spoons, etc. It will satisfy the need to purchase more products in bulk. This will generate a savings in her purchases, and more profit. 

She wants to first have what is most necessary for herself and her children, for which she hopes to always work while God grants her health and life. The loan will help in satisfying the need to generate more sales and have more customers. The earnings will be designated part to the household expenses, part to paying off her debt, and part to continue investing.

loans.use: to purchase crates, glasses, plates, spoons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a cement toilet, sheet metal, purlins, cement, sand, bricks and pay for labor to build a composting toilet.

loans.name: Dilia De Jesús

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dilia, tiene 58 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tienen ocho hijos, siete mayores de edad  y una chica de 17 años que estudia en universidad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Dilia para sacar adelante a sus hijos  se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de víveres además de  legumbres, verduras y frutas,  además de ciertas cosas de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayuda en su trabajo cuando ellos pueden, ella también los fines de semana prepara y vende salchichas,, cueritos y carne asada, lleva más de 20 años con su negocio con el cual saca adelante a sus hijos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear para surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 17  años y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth) meets every 15 days in the April 15th neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. Manta is also a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Sra. Dilia lives in this place. She is 58 years old, divorced, and has eight children. Seven of them are grown and her 17-year-old daughter is studying at a university. Two of her children still live at home.

Doña Dilia has worked in retail in order to help her children get ahead. She has a store in her home where she sells all type of provisions such as legumes, vegetables, and fruit. Dilia also offers certain bazaar and stationery items. She works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M., and sometimes much later. Her children help with the work whenever they can. On the weekends, she also prepares and sells sausages, pork skins, and roasted meat. She has been in business for more than 20 years, which has allowed her to help her children get ahead.

This loan will be used to restock her store with more products, so she will buy provisions. Dilia has been with her Communal Bank for 17 years and enjoys being a member because she has made many friends within her group. Her goals are to continue with her business and to grow her store each day.

loans.use: to buy provisions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, corn, and condiments.

loans.name: Ingabo Group

texts.fr:
Agathe fait partie du groupe  Ingabo et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 48 ans et est mariée à Jean, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants   âgés de 7 à 20 ans, tous  étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge sa nièce qui étudie.

Elle fait le commerce de peinture  depuis 15 ans.  

Elle est à son sixième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle augmenter son capital et   acheter une grande quantité de peinture   à revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle pour construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Agathe is part of the group Ingabo and lives in Bujumbura. She is 48 years old and married to Jean, a merchant. Together they have five children, from 7 to 20 years old, who are all students.

Agathe has been doing commerce in paints for thirteen years.

She is on her sixth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of paint to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a plot of land for building a house and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of paint to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net and an icebox for her fishing business. She has been in this business for six years now. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net and an icebox for her fishing business.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para mantener funcionando su negocio, comprará discos, fajas, grasa y pagara la reparación del molino nixtamal, con esta inversión optimizará el equipo de trabajo con lo que brindara un mejor servicio y seguirá teniendo ingresos para costear los diferentes gastos que tiene.
Con el capital anterior ha logrado mejorar su negocio, atraer nuevos clientes, tener mejores ingresos y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Carlos decided to request a new loan to keep his business functioning. He will buy discs, belts, grease, and will pay for the repair of the mill. With this investment he will optimize the work equipment with which he will provide better service and will keep earning income to pay for the different expenses that he has.

With the previous loan he has improved his business, attracted new customers, had greater earnings, and paid off his debts.

loans.use: to buy discs, belts, grease, and to pay for the repair of the mill.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda, who is married and has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 30 years, works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

In the future, Alfreda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Yu Tangni Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 5 mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, que desde hace aproximadamente un mes se integraron, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento, para comprar inventario para sus negocios. Nombraron al grupo YU TANGNI, que en vocablo miskito significa flor que ilumina, porque para ellas al acceder a financiamiento, es una luz, esperanza para sus familias, ya que les permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida

Serbanda: Es una mujer sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 52 años de edad, casada, tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad,  es la coordinadora del grupo solidario. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años estableció su pequeña pulpería.  Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Gaseosas, chiverías, harina, granos básicos entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un pequeño prospero.
texts.en:
This cooperative is made up of 5 tough, enterprising women who came together about a month ago to win financing to supply their businesses. They named the group Yu Tangni, which means 'glowing flower' in the Miskito language, because for these women, accessing finance is a beacon of hope for their families, since it will allow them to improve their income and quality of life.

Serbanda, originally from Puerto Cabezas, is a friendly woman, and the group's coordinator. She is 52 years old, and is married with 7 grown-up children. With the aim of having her own source of income, 2 years ago, she set up a small grocery shop. She is looking for a loan to help her buy merchandise; soft drinks, dairy products, flour, basic grains and other products. Her dream is to have a small, prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: soft drinks, dairy products, flour, basic grains and other products.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David de 69 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero el papá le enseño un poco a leer y a escribir.

David está casado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  en esta relación han procreado  12 hijos los cuales uno de ellos está en la escuela los demás hijos ya están en hogares apartes.

David se dedica  a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad,  lo comenzó a llevar al papá al campo a que aprendiera muy bien el trabajo en este trabajo de la agricultura le ayudan dos hijos a cultivar la tierra en un horario de las 6:00 am a las 12:00 pm pero también David se dedica a vender productos de la canasta básica y también vende pastillas, él vende en dos cantones vecindarios de donde él sale todas las tardes en su motocicleta con una canasta que le ha puesto a la motocicleta y ahí pone cereales,  frijoles,  arroz,  azúcar y en un bolsón su medicinas que tiene en el negocio esto lo aprendió solo viendo la necesidad de tener un ingreso para su familia  esto lo hace en un horario de la 2:00 pm a las 6:00 pm que regresa a su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una ternera, ya que él tiene dos vacas que de eso le genera el alimento a la familia y también quiere comprar esa ternera, ya que un amigo se la vende bastante cómoda y es de muy buena raza lechera esto le ayudara mucho porque con la ayuda del crédito la podrá comprar.
texts.en:
David, of 69 years of age, didn’t have the opportunity to study, but his father taught him little by little how to read and write.

David is married. His wife takes care of the domestic tasks. They have had 12 children in their relation. One of them is still in school; the others live in different homes.

David has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old. His father started taking him to the field, so he could learn how to do the job. He counts with the help of two of his children to do the agricultural work. They help him from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm.

David also sells products of the basic food basket, and tablets. He sells in two neighborhoods nears his place of residence. Every afternoon he goes out on his motorcycle with a basket, where he carries cereals, beans, rice, sugar, and in a bag he puts the medicines that he sells.  He learned this activity from the necessity of having another income for his family. He performs this job from 2:00 pm to 6:00 pm. After that he goes back home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a calf. He already has two cows, which provide food for his family. He thinks this is a good opportunity to buy the calf since one friend of him is offering it for a good price. Also, the calf is from a good dairy breed. The loan will really help him in the acquisition of the calf.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es casado y tiene dos hijos que estudian en la universidad, viven en una  casa alquilada, se encuentra ubicada  en La Paz
Actualmente trabaja por mas de ocho horas al día como empleado en una empresa privada,ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación, alquiler y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.

El crédito lo necesita para mantenimiento y arreglos de su vivivenda Carlos es el único que solventa a toda su familia.
El sueño de Carlos es tener casa propia ya que desea brindar mas comodidad y seguridad a su familia, mas que todo darles estabilidad ya que le resulta muy difícil el tener que trasladarse.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and has two children who attend college. They live in a rental house located in La Paz. In the present, he is working over eight hours a day as an employee for a private company. He has to cover food and educational expenses, rent, and he has to pay for the basic services for his family.

He needs the loan to maintain and repair his house. Carlos is the only one supporting the family. 

Carlos’s dream is to have his own house because he wants to offer a more comfortable and safe life to his family. He wants them to have some stability because it will be difficult to have to move.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase yams, beans, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and cosmetic products

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with five children. She is 42 years old and has four children who are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Corazon has a general store business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan amount through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Corazon has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shania Group

texts.es:
MARLENE: Es una mujer amable, coordinadora del grupo solidario shania, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos menores de edad, su esposo es albañil. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace más de un año instaló su pequeño negocio de venta de chivería, granos básicos entre otros. Solicita su segundo crédito para comprar productos: chivería, jabón, granos básicos y refrescos, frutas, azucar y bolsas plasticas para elaborar helados. Su sueño es segur creciendo en su negocio y con el tiempo vender ropa de paca.

NINSKA: Solicita financiamiento para comprar prendas de plata. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y construir su propia vivienda, ya que en la que reside actualmente es de una tía.


MARISOL: Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, huevos, chiverías, gaseosas, sopas instantáneas, jabón de lavar ropa. Su sueño es mejora su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene is a friendly woman and the coordinator for the solidarity group called “Shania”.  She is 36 years old, married, and has five young children.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  With the intention of having her own source of income, Marlene established a small business more than a year ago where she sells yogurt, ice cream, basic grains, and other products.  She is requesting her second loan in order to buy more supplies like   yogurt, soap, basic grains, soft drinks, fruit, sugar, and plastic bags to make ice cream. Her dream is to keep growing her business and eventually sell bales of clothing.  

Ninska: She is requesting a loan in order to increase and diversify her products.  Her dream is to grow her business and build a house of her own.  She currently lives with an aunt.  

Marisol: She is requesting a loan in order to purchase the merchandise of her business, which includes basic grains, eggs, yogurt, sodas, instant soups, laundry soap, and other products.  Her dream is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products to make ice cream like  yogurt, basic grains and soft drinks, fruit, sugar, plastic bags, and soap

loans.name: Santos Basilia

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado, ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para que continuara estudiando. Está soltera tiene un hijo de 16 años y estudia, y solo vive junto a su hijo.

Santos ha trabajado toda su vida, primero ayudaba a sus padres en la siembra de maíz y frijol. Hoy en día tiene 15 años de trabajar como ama de casa. Viaja todos los días 4 km el recorrido lo realiza en bus. 


El préstamo será utilizado para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa, ya que actualmente no posee, y sabe que es un servicio muy importante el que ella necesita.


Lo que más desea es que su hijo estudie y logre prepararse,  ya que así tendrá más oportunidades de encontrar un buen empleo. También desea un negocio propio como una tienda. Así tendría otra fuente de ingreso para su casa.
texts.en:
Santos is a 47 year old woman.  She attended school until 6th grade because her parents did not have the financial resources for her to continue studying.  She is single and has a 16 year old son who is in school.  She lives alone with her son.  Santos has worked her whole life.  She first worked helping her parents plant corn and beans.  Now, she has 15 years of working as a housekeeper.  She travels 4km by bus every day.

The loan she is seeking will be used to install electricity in her home since currently she does not have electricity and she knows it is a very important utility.  What she wishes for most is for her son to go to school and be able to prepare himself and have more opportunities to find a good job.  She also hopes to have her own business like a store so that she can have another source of income for her household.

loans.use: install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Gs Crisma 2 Group

texts.es:
Jose es una personas emprendedora y dedicado a su negocio, venta de  repuestos para motocicletas, de igual manera las repara ya que tiene un pequeño taller, esta actividad la realiza, desde hace 27 años, sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su comunidad de Villa Santa, y aldeas vecinas a la misma esto en el valle de Jamastran, de igual manera el aprovecha para reparar si es necesario la motocicleta y así el cliente no tiene que ir hasta la ciudad de Danli, el crédito anterior que le otorgo Prisma lo utilizo para comprar repuestos para motocicletas, de igual manera los prestamos que se le han otrogado el los ha invertido en su negocio, esto le ha ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos y su nivel de vida familiar, Ahora don Jose está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para comprar repuestos para motocicletas ya que de estos existe una gran variedad que son de consumo popular por desgaste de las piezas y por su uso el desea comprar llantas, rines, barras, cables, bujías, focos, espejos, cadenas, fricciones, amortiguadores, sellos, cilindros, empaques, casquillos y otros repuestos que necesita en su tienda, con esto podrá obtener mejores ganancias, para seguir dándoles el estudio a sus hijos.
El solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas, María se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio venta de nacatamales y donas, actividad que realiza desde hace 13 años.
José Humberto se dedica al comercio sus ingresos los obtiene de su negocio, taller de carpintería donde elabora, puertas, ventanas, sillas, chineros, actividad que realiza desde hace 12 años.
todos ellos no cuentan con el capital suficiente para abastecer sus respectivos negocios.

Danlí, Honduras – Junio  2014
texts.en:
José's an enterprising person who is dedicated to his business selling motorcycle parts.  He also repairs motorcycles because he has a small shop.  He has done this work for 27 years.  His main customers are people who live in the community of Villa Santa and nearby towns in the Jamastran Valley.  He also makes the most of repairing a motorcycle if necessary so a customer doesn't have to go to the city of Danlí.

He used his previous loan from Prisma to buy motorcycle parts.  He has invested his loans in his business, which has helped him improve his income and his family's standard of living.

Now José's requesting another loan to buy spare motorcycle parts, many of which are commonly used because the parts wear out with use.  He wants to buy tires, rims, rods, cables, spark plugs, light bulbs, mirrors, chains, brakes, shock absorbers, seals, cylinders, gaskets, bearings, and other parts he needs in his store.   He'll be able to earn more profits so he can keep on paying for his children's education.

José is requesting the loan in a group with the following people who don't have sufficient capital to stock their respective businesses. María works as a merchant and earns her income from her business selling nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales] and doughnuts, work she has done for 13 years.  José Humberto works as a merchant and earns his income from his woodworking shop where he makes doors, windows, chairs, and cupboards, a business he has had for 12 years.

Danlí, Honduras, June 2014

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 47 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Sonia works very hard to provide for them.

Sonia runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Sonia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Sonia would like to save money to buy her own farm.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is 42 years old and married. Teodula works very hard to provide for her family.

Teodula runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase more stocks, like canned goods, coffee, sugar, salt, soft drinks, beers, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Teodula has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, salt, soft drinks, beers, shampoo, etc. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks, like canned goods, coffee, sugar, salt, soft drinks, beers, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 43-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Jocelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a display case and an assortment of basic goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens, concentrates and an artificial heater.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Josie has been in this business for three years. Josie earns more income from food-vending.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 40-years-old and married with three children who are in school.  Connie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of charcoal for her business.

Connie has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as retail. 

In the future, Connie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an assortment of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, dos hijos y una sobrina. María tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la venta de pollos y minutas(postre a base de hielo raspado y jarabe de frutas). La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como se gana el sustento diario y mantiene a su familia. María desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina, madera, cemento, arena y hierro y así poder mejorar las paredes y el piso de la misma y dar a su familia condiciones más saludables.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, two children, and a niece. For 15 years she has earned her living selling chickens and minutas (desserts made from shaved ice and fruit syrups). She sells these as a street vendor, and so earns her daily bread and supports her family. 

María wishes to improve conditions in her home, and so is seeking this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in buying sheeting, wood, cement, sand and steel supports. With these she will be able to improve the walls and ceiling of her house and give her family healthier living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve the walls and ceiling of her home.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
La socia Adriana pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” del distrito de Cusco de la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco.
La socia Adriana tiene 36 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platós para vender a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de gelatinas, fotocopiadoras, imprenta, multiservicios, restaurante.
texts.en:
Adriana is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Huanca” which in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco. She is 36 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. Adriana divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling food. She prepares different types of dishes and sells them to her customers who request them. Adriana sells food as a street vendor. She has been in business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. Adriana wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as oil, rice, and other items. Adriana is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

The other members sell gelatins, provide photocopy services, provide printing services, manage a multi-service center, and manage a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and other supplies.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina works hard to support her family. Josephina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Josephina requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Josephina has been in this business for 28 years now.

In the future, Josephina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 50-years-old and married with twelve children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Fatima is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Fatima has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 42 years old and married with two children.

Merlinda earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mary Gold

texts.en:
Mary Gold is 38-years-old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming fruits in the Philippines. Mary Gold is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Gold has been farming fruits for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of dry goods to sell for her business buying and selling dry goods.

Vivian has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from a welding shop.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 56 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Leticia is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business. She has been raising chickens for 24 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Leticia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Ma. Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bamboo in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell for her business buying and selling bamboo.

Ma. Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support one child. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Gina requested a 7,500 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of an emergency. 

Gina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntos 2 Group

texts.es:
LEYLA desde siempre ha vivido en Rocafuerte. Tiene 47 años vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos- uno de ellos con capacidades especiales.
Vive en una pequeña casa que el gobierno dono por tener un familiar con discapacidad. Todos sus hijos estudian incluyendo el niño con discapacidad- quien tiene que ir hasta la ciudad más cercana para poder asistir a clases. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca y en su tiempo libre se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos.
Aprovechando la ubicación de su casa, ella vende refrigerios nutritivos a los alumnos de la escuela que queda frente de su casa.
Con el crédito anterior pudo comprar varias vitrinas y ponerse un bazar con muchas variedades de productos. A demás LEYLA elabora bisutería con material autóctono.
Con este nuevo crédito. Ella desea surtir su local con ropita de niños, interiores, refrigerios para estudiantes con alto valor nutritivo.
LEYLA desea en un lapso de 3 a 5 años tener un local donde poner su negocio y no continuar en su casa porque es demasiado pequeña. 
Opina que FODEMI es una buena ayuda para las personas que necesitan de un capital económico para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus vecinos y su comunidad a través de el fortalecimiento de sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en: Leyla has always lived in Rocafuerte.  She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and her three children, one of whom has special needs.  She lives in a small house that the government donated to her family for having a chid with a handicap.  All of her children are studying including her son who is disabled and has to go to the nearest city in order to be able to attend classes.  Her husband works in fishing and in his free time, works on appliance repairs.  Taking advantage of the location of their house, she sells nutritious snacks to students of the school that is in front of her home.  With the past loan, she was able to buy several windows and purchase a bazaar with a large product variety.  Also, Leyla makes jewelry with native materials.  With this new loan, she hopes to fill her home with children's clothes, interior items, and nutritional snacks for students.  In a span of 3-5 years, Leyla wants to have a place to hold her business and not continue in her home because it is too small.  She feels that FODEMI is a great help for the people that need financial capital to improve the quality of life of their neighbors and their community, by strengthening small businesses.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, interior items, snacks for students with high nutritional value

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his marketing efforts, putting emphasis on his company’s online presence, as well as to fulfill a few large contracts he is working on.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, juices and waters in bulk.

loans.name: Elsy Noemi

texts.es:
Elsy de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta  9° grado, ella es madre soltera.

Elsy se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace 4 años, lo aprendió de su mamá, ella decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque es una buena fuente de ingreso en el negocio solo la hermana le ayuda.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar unos repuestos del vehículo en donde trasporta la mercadería al lugar donde tiene el negocio, también para comprar mas pan y aumentar sus ingresos.

Para su negocio sueña que a un futuro sea más grande y que me dé mejores ingresos y que sus hijos estudien para ser unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Elsy is 25 years old. She is educated up to 9th grade, and she is a single mother. Four the last four years she has earned her living selling bread. She learned this from her mother, and decided to pursue this line of work as it is a good source of income. In her business she only has her sister to help her out.

She needs the loan in order to buy parts for the vehicle she uses to transport her merchandise to her place of business, and also to buy more bread and so increase her income. 

Elsy's dream for her business is that one day it will be larger and give her a better income, and that her children will study for professional careers.

loans.use: to buy parts for the vehicle she uses to transport merchandise to her place of business, and to buy more bread for sale to improve her income.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre trabajador, tiene 29 años de edad, y vive en Vista alegre junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 6 años se dedica a la agricultura, siendo el frijol el principal producto cultivado en sus tierras. Le va muy bien porque es una persona emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable y sobre todo porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad a un precio competitivo.
Miguel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos para abonar sus cultivos, así como pago por realización del control fitosanitario, pago de riegos y gastos de cosecha. De esta manera podrá obtener mejores productos y así mayores ingresos y poco a poco seguirá esforzándose para poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Comprar un terreno y construir su casa".
texts.en:
Miguel is a hardworking man. He is 29 years old and lives with his family in Vista Alegre.

Miguel has been farming for more than six years. Beans are the main product that he cultivates on his land. He is doing very well because he an enterprising, hardworking, and responsible individual. Above all else, he always offers quality products at a competitive price.

Miguel is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have provided. He will be able to buy supplies for fertilizing his crops. Miguel will also pay for disease control measures, irrigation, and harvesting expenses. As a result, he will be able to obtain better products and more income. Miguel gradually continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of buying a plot of land and building a house.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and pay for disease control measures, irrigation, and harvesting expenses.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, con lo que ella vende logra solventar las necesidades que tiene su hogar, Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, queso, chicharrón, etc. Para tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old, and lives with her life partner and their children. She earns her living making and selling papusas (a popular Salvadoran food). Her business is located in a very busy area, and she has a lot of customers thanks to her friendliness and good prices. With what she sells she is able to provide the basic needs of her household.

María is seeking a loan in order to buy maize, beans, cheese, pork rind, etc. for her business, and so achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, cheese, pork rind, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Doña Paula con su primer financiamiento compro la semilla de papa certificada, los diferentes abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas entre otros con los cuales dio la asistencia apropiada a 4 tareas que sembró de papa obteniendo una cosecha beneficiosa y satisfactoria de 40 quintales de papa de primera calidad y 20 quintales de papa de segunda obteniendo una ganancia apropiada y esperada con la cual logro cancelar su compromiso de pago a tiempo. Gracias al apoyo financiero que fue brindado por los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL su meta y propósito fueron posibles pues sin este apoyo ella no hubiese podido llevar a cabo sus planes. Actualmente ella solicita ser apoyada nuevamente para comprar más semilla de papa y siempre los insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a que su trabajo no se vea afectado ni perjudicado por plagas como la paratrioza u otras que dañen su producto evitando obtener excelentes resultados para el beneficio de su familia y el crecimiento como pequeña productora
texts.en:
With her first loan Paula bought certified seed potatoes, various manures, fertilizers, herbicides and other products with which she properly maintained four hectares planted with potatoes, obtaining a satisfactory and beneficial harvest of 40 quintals (a quintal is approximately 100 lb) of first quality potatoes and 20 quintals of second quality potatoes, obtaining the appropriate earnings she hoped for. 

With this she managed to pay off her payment commitment on time. Thanks to the financial support she has been offered by the various Kiva investors in alliance with the Comixmul cooperative, her goal and objective were possible, as without this support she would not have been able to carry out her plans. 

Now she is applying to be supported again in order to buy more seed potatoes and also the agricultural supplies that will help ensure her crop is not affected or harmed by pests such as paratrioza (potato psyllid) or others that can damage her crop and prevent her from obtaining excellent results for the benefit of her family and her growth as a small producer.

loans.use: To buy certified seed potatoes, as well as agricultural supplies for planting and protecting her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire construction materials for laying down a concrete floor and to buy replacement doors and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee and buy more books for studying

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has an electronic shop business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her electronic shop business.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Estrella Angela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio 15 De Abril en la ciudad de Manta, ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Estrella, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 18 y 12 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido es pescador. 
Doña Estrella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, edredones, zapatos, entre otras cosas que vende). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella realiza sus recorridos  cuatro días por semana vendiendo y cobrando ya que  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo extra por el bien familiar.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, sabanas, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la ayuda de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Jesús de Nazaret” (Jesus of Nazareth) meets every 15 days in the April 15th neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. Manta is also a city of unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Sra. Estrella lives in this place. She is 43 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 18 and 12). One child is studying at a university and the other is in high school. Her husband is a fisherman.

Sra. Estrella is a housewife who generates her own income and helps her husband with the household expenses. She sells clothing, bed sheets, bedspreads, shoes, and other items. Estrella conducts her sales by going door-to-door. She makes her sales runs four days a week and collects payments from her credit sales on a weekly basis. Estrella has been in this business for more than four years and it has enabled her to earn some extra income for her family’s welfare.

This loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, bed sheets, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. She has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys having the help of the loans. Her dreams are to continue moving forward and seeing her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, bed sheets, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro is a young and ambitions woman. She is 19 years old. Zuhro is not married and lives with her parents. She has been busy selling milk products for more than two years. Her store is located in a local market. Zuhro sells milk, kefir, sour cream and other milk products. She manages her business alone. Zuhro’s working day usually begins early in the morning. She works hard to earn a living because her parents are poor people and they have a small income. She is going to repair her store and in this way, make better business conditions. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials to repair the store. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her store

loans.name: G.s El Obraje Group

texts.es:
El Joven  Ángel de 30 años de edad vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación donde cuenta con una hacienda en donde produce leche y la vende a sus clientes quienes visitan su hacienda y compran la leche.
Ángel también elabora queso el cual también vende as sus vecinos y amigos es conocido por ser un joven luchador ya que con su corta edad cuenta con bastante ganado y terreno, vive en aldea la cuesta al sur de Honduras. 
Ángel está solicitando el préstamo para la compra  de toros pequeños, lechuga, cebollas, tomates, etc. con las ganancias  espera mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia gracias a la inversión que realice en su negocio.
Doña Reina tiene un negocio de venta verduras.
Don  Pastor quien tiene una descremadora.
Su sueño es crecer más en sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014
texts.en:
Ángel, of the G.s El Obraje Group, is a young man of 30 years old. He lives with his wife in their home, which has a farm where he produces milk. He sells this to his customers, who visit the farm to buy their milk. He makes cheese too, which he also sells to his friends and neighbours. He is known as a determined young man, who despite his young age already has a good amount of livestock and land. He lives in a village on the south coast of Honduras.

Ángel is seeking this loan in order to buy young bulls, and lettuce, onions, tomatoes etc. With the profit from these he hopes to improve his and his family's standard of living a little, thanks to the investment he will be making in his business. His dream is to grow his business even further and improve his income.

Of the other two members of the group, Reyna has a business selling vegetables, and (Ángel) Pastor has a business skimming milk.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, June 2014

loans.use: to buy young bulls, and lettuce, onions, tomatoes etc., for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dairy products and baked goods for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Lourdes has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from her general store and from raising pigs.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Fritzesa

texts.en:
Fritzesa is 55 years old and married with nine children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Fritzesa has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Fritzesa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: José Dimas

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad, no pudo asistir a una escuela pero aprendió a leer y escribir, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos que viven con ellos y el mayor estudia 9º, el menor aun no ingresa a la escuela, solamente los cuatro viven en casa.
José toda su vida se ha dedicado  a la agricultura y aprendió por su padre actualmente piensa sembrar maíz 10,500 metros cuadrados. El  terreno está a unos 15 minutos de su casa y se va caminando, le ayuda su hijo en todas las labores que el cultivo requiere.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y fertilizantes;  mejorara su calidad de vida, ya que con el cultivo generara ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Espera sacar buena cosecha, obtener ganancias para que su familia no le falte lo necesario, asimismo pretende brindarle el estudio a su hijo, y además espera pagar el crédito sin ninguna dificultad.
texts.en:
José, age 67, did not attend school but he learned to read and write. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household chores. They have two children who live with them. The older child is in the ninth grade and the younger one is not enrolled in school. Only the four of them live at home.

José has devoted his entire life to agriculture. He learned the trade from his father and now intends to plant 10,500 square meters of corn. His land is located approximately 15 minutes from his house, so he has to walk. His son helps with all of the work that is required of the crops.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost and fertilizers. His quality of life will improve since the crops will generate income for supporting his family. José hopes to achieve a good harvest so that he will have income for his family. As a result, they will not be lacking in need. He also intends to provide an education for his child and hopes to repay this loan without any difficulties.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Licilda

texts.en:
Licilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. 

Licilda has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Licilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 56 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like rice, feed, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Carmelita has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

Carmelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like rice, feed, shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. 

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old and married with 10 children.  With four of her children in school, Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Gloria has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Gloria has taken a PHP 7,228.50 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Gloria is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
Zenia is 39 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Zenia has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Zenia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Irene
