texts.en: Irene has been in her transportation-service-based business for many years, and she earns well from this in addition to her income from farming. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for maintenance and licenses. To improve the service and ensure safety, she took out a new loan recently to buy new tires.  Irene hopes to earn an even better living for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Neljane

texts.en:
Neljane is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Neljane has a business selling fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years. 

Neljane requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall. In the future, Neljane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en: Sabohat is 21 years old. She is a young and smart woman. Sabohat is not married and lives with her parents in a rural area. She is a student in the first course at Medical University in the capital of Tajikistan. Sabohat studies well. Sabohat’s father is a migrant in Russia. Her mother is a teacher. Her mother is also busy with animal husbandry. Sabohat helps her mother feed the cattle. She must pay for her tuition, and that’s why she is asking for a loan of $700 US. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 58 años de edad, vive  en casa de un familiar con su nieto quien  estudia y la ayuda en el negocio, ella tiene una venta de bolsas y papales para regalos, chongas, plástico, etc. su negocio lo tiene en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar,  Ángela está solicitando un crédito para comprar mas mercadería por mayor y asi continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y poder tener junto con su nieto un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Angela is 58 years old and lives in a relative's house with her grandson, who studies and helps her with her business. She sells gift bags, wrapping paper, lace, plastic, etc. Her business is located at home. With what she obtains from her sales, she is able to pay for some of her household's needs. Angela is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk to continue working, as this is her only source of income. She wants to have a better quality of life with her grandson.

loans.use: to buy gift bags, wrapping paper, plastic, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is married with one child. He runs a motorcycle rental business while his wife earns from teaching. He joined Gata Daku MPC and has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used to purchase new tires and accessories for better service. Recently, he took a new loan to cover motor maintenance costs. He was determined to improve his business to ensure better income for the family.

He plans to use the generated income to build his own house for a better life for his family.

loans.use: to cover motor maintenance costs

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Amalia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending.  Amalia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sangimo

texts.en: Sangimo lives with her family in Tajikistan. Her husband is a pensioner, and they have five adult children. Sangimo is an entrepreneur. She sells fruits and vegetables in a local market. Currently, she sells melons, watermelons, paprika, etc. She tries to offer high quality fruits and vegetables to her customers. Sangimo’s son helps her manage the business. She is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 4500 somoni to buy melons and watermelons. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy melons and watermelons for her business

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Alejandra works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. 

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 49 years old and married. Evangeline works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Evangeline has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, beer, shampoo, canned goods, biscuits, etc. Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien tiene taller de zapatos y sus dos  hijos, el mayor de ellos trabaja y ayuda en el hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo con lo que logran sostener su hogar, Berta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ropa por mayor para dama y caballeros, y así poder seguir con su trabajo para poder obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Berta, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her husband, who runs a shoe repair shop, and with their two children. The eldest son works and helps out at home. 

For several years, Berta has been working selling clothes, and between the profits and help from her husband, they manage to sustain their household. 

Berta is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale clothing for ladies and gentlemen, so she can continue her line of work, earn a higher income and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing in wholesale for men and women

loans.name: Aloida

texts.en:
Aloida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell cashew nut business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional cashew nuts to sell.

Aloida has been in this business for 7 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Marc Jayson

texts.en:
Marc Jayson is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a major in Operations Management at La Salle University. He lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. His father is a farmer who earns just enough to provide for their daily living. 

Being financially unstable has never stopped Marc Jayson from dreaming. He joined GDMPC and gained access to micro-finance services, specifically an education loan that supports students who are qualified and want to continue their studies.

He used his previous loans for his school expenses and is now taking his new loan amount to pay the school tuition fee for this semester. He dreams of finishing his studies and being able to work for a bright future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for this semester.

loans.name: Liem's Group

texts.en:
Liem is 74 years old and lives with his four sons and wife. His wife is now retired. For the past 30 years to earn an income to support his family, Liem has been working for pig farms transporting pigs from the farm to the market by small truck. Liem is the Group Leader of a 8-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture above, he is in the center wearing a green shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Liem is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle for his family so they will be able to more efficiently travel shorter distances and carry light cargo. He hopes that through his loan, he will be able to help his family increase their income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos. José se dedica a la venta de variedad de bolsas de plástico. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 12 años. Actualmente, en la vivienda de josé no se cuenta con energía eléctrica por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de energía eléctrica y poder así dar a sus familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 41 years old and lives in his own house along with his two children. Jose makes a living selling a variety of plastic bags. For 12 years, he has sold the bags as a street vendor. Currently, Jose’s home does not have electric energy, that is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of the electric energy service, and that way be able to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in the installation of electric energy services in the home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Señor De Qoyllority De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
La socia Benedicta pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA,el banco es ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 45 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio  de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, gaseosa entre otros, la socia lleva  buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican al reciclaje, venta de leña, brindado el servicio de taxi, venta de emolientes, crianza de gallinas.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Qoyllority de Chimpahuaylla” which is located in the Department of Cusco. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. Benedicta divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery business. She sells different types of products such as rice, sugar, milk, sodas, and other items. Benedicta has been in business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. She wants to keep working so that she can continue to support her family.

Benedicta is requesting a loan in order to buy sodas and other products. She is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

The other members work in recycling, sell firewood, provide taxi services, sell emollients, and raise chickens. The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of her work.

loans.use: to buy sodas and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish hatchlings to raise for later resale.

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: Sandra de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella tiene una pequeña tienda  ubicada en su lugar de residencia  posee mucha clientela que la prefieren por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Sandra  solicita un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, refrescos, sopas, golosinas, café, azúcar, etc. y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their two daughters. She has a small store located in her home. Sandra has many customers who prefer to do business with her because of the quality of her products and the good prices. With what she earns from her sales, Sandra is able to help her husband with some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy basic grains, soft drinks, soups, snack foods, coffee, sugar, and other products. As a result, she and her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, soups, snack foods, coffee, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: Julia tiene 51 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas desayuno lonches hace 26 años. Ella tiene como clientes fijos a sus amistades  conocidos y clientes de afuera. El credito lo invertira en la compra de sillas y mesas nuevas. Ella cumple la funcion de presidenta en el grupo “LAS HORMIGUITAS”. El grupo agradece a los inversionsitas KIVA por el credito brindado. julia es la primera persona parada del lado derecho y de la misma manera se encuentra adjunta la foto de Juana en la parte superior izquierda que no pudo estar presente en la reunion por estar atendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julia is 51 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She has been selling food, such as breakfasts and lunches, for 26 years. Julia has regular customers that include friends, acquaintances, as well as people who live outside the area. Her loan will be invested in new chairs and tables.

Julia serves as the president of the group “Las Hormiguitas”. The members are grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan that has been granted. In the photo, Julia is the first person standing on the right side. The member shown in the photo in the upper left-hand corner was not able to attend the meeting because she was busy attending to her customers.

loans.use: to buy new chairs and tables for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Gloria Luz

texts.es: Gloria de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos,  ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos, Gloria solicita un crédito para la compra de azúcar, gaseosas, huevos, queso, etc. y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Gloria is 42 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She has a shop in her home, and with what she earns from her sales she is able to pay some of the family's expenses. Gloria is seeking a loan in order to buy sugar, sodas, eggs, cheese, and other products for her business, and so hopes to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, sodas, eggs, cheese, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es: Blanca tiene 60 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y un hijo de 20 años de edad. Blanca es una mujer muy luchadora quien se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina, madera y clavos para invertir en la construcción de un corredor en la vivienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and 20-year-old son. She is a very determined woman, and earns her living as a domestic worker. Together, she and her partner are able to meet their household expenses.

Blanca is seeking this loan via FUSAI in order to invest it in buying sheeting, wood, and nails, which she will use to build a hallway for her home.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, wood and nails to build a hallway for her home.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is 43 years old and married with five children. With two of her children currently in school, Gabriela works very hard to provide for them.

Gabriela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, canned goods, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

Gabriela has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Gabriela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, canned goods, fabric conditioner, detergent soap, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 45 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Analyn has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from raising cows.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Omar Humberto

texts.es: Omar tiene 20 años de edad y habita  junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de tres años de edad. Omar trabaja como ayudante de albañil desde hace cuatro años lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Omar desea terminar su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda y poder dar a su familia condicione más saludables.
texts.en:
Omar, 20, lives with his common-law wife and three-year-old daughter.  He has worked as a bricklayer's assistant for four years in order to earn an income for the household.  

Omar wants to finish his house and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to put down a cement floor in his house to make the family living conditions healthier.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel to put down a cement floor in his house.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new coffee and soft drink products to restock her cafe. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and her sales. She also hopes that it will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new coffee and soft drink products

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Luzviminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena de 51 años de edad, vive con sus hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 14 años al negocio de venta de Rosquillas,  sus clientes son personas de la zona y también tiene muchos clientes de las comunidades cercanas.
Doña María Elena vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, leña, cuajada y manteca, para poder seguir elaborando sus rosquillas porque sus clientes le compran bastante ya que son de muy buena calidad, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende comprar los productos por mayor y conseguir mejores precios, al mismo tiempo espera mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientes y poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a sus hijos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio de 2014
texts.en:
María Elena, 51, lives with her children in her own house.  For 14 years she has been selling doughnuts to customers in her area.  She also has many customers in neighboring communities.

María Elena lives in a village in southern Honduras.  She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead, struggling daily to improve her lifestyle.

The loan being requested by María is to buy products such as corn, firewood, curd and lard to continue making her doughnuts which are in high demand by customers because of their quality.  With the help of the loan she wants to buy products wholesale at better prices.  She also wants to improve her income and quality of life.  She is a new client to Prisma and has a desire to work.

Her dream is to expand her business and attract new customers in order to improve her and her children's quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2014

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, curd and lard for her business.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to sell to satisfy her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increasing sales and helping her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María Mercedes de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos   en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de venta de Ropa americana, sus clientes son personas de la zona y también tiene muchos clientes en las comunidades desde varios años.
Doña María Mercedes vive en una  aldea que pertenece al municipio de Pespire al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña María Mercedes está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: pantalones, camisas, vestidos, chores, braseares, faldas, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito él pretende comprar los productos por mayor y conseguir mejores precios, al mismo tiempo espera mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientes y poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su esposo e hijos. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio de 2014
texts.en:
María Mercedes, 45, lives with her husband and children in her own home.  For 20 years she has been selling American clothing to customers in the area where she lives.  She also has many customers in other communities where she has worked several years.

María Mercedes lives in a village which belongs to the municipality of Pespire in southern Honduras.  She is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead and struggle daily to improve her lifestyle.

The loan being requested by María Mercedes is to buy products such as pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, bras, skirts, etc.  With the support of the loan she will be able to buy products wholesale and get better prices.  She also wants to increase her income and quality of life.  She is a new client to Prisma and has a desire to work.

Her dream is to expand her business and attract more customers in order to improve her and her family's quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2014

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, bras, skirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is requesting a new loan to buy sewing materials for making clothes, and to buy coffee to sell to people in her community.

Tam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials to make clothes, and to buy coffee to sell to people in her community

loans.name: Mario Adalberto

texts.es: Mario de 32 años de edad vive con su esposa y 3 hijos. Desde hace 10 años trabaja como ayudante de albañil en los cantones cercanos a su vivienda, su esposa lo apoya en los gastos del hogar prestando sus servicios domésticos. Él necesita encementar el piso de la vivienda que esta construyendo y también necesita comprar puertas de hierro para darle una mejor seguridad a su familia, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, grava y arena para encementar  y comprar las puertas lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Mario, 32, lives with his wife and three children.  For ten years he has worked as a bricklayer's assistant in cantons near his home.  His wife helps cover household expenses by working as a domestic employee.  

Mario needs to put down a cement floor in the house he is building and also must buy iron doors to improve the family's safety.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, gravel and sand for the cement floor and the doors, as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy cement, gravel and sand to put down a cement floor in his house and to buy doors.

loans.name: Roger Danilo

texts.es:
El señor Roger tiene la edad de 53 años, esta acompañado, tiene 3 hijos y solamente uno de ellos esta bajo su cargo. Vive en el municipio de Chichigalpa, un lugar en el occidente de Nicaragua conocido por su producción de caña y azúcar, además de ser uno de los lugares mas calientes de Nicaragua.

Don Roger cuenta que desde el año 2004 quedo incapacitado para trabajar debido a su enfermedad, momento en el tramito su pension vitalicia, pero aun asi continuo con el mismo animo y alegría que lo caracteriza.
comenta que los créditos le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que le han permitido hacer mejoras en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Roger is 53 years old, is in a relationship, has three children and only one of them is in his care. He lives in the municipality of Chichigalpa, a place in the west of Nicaragua known for its cane and sugar production, as well as being one of the hottest places in Nicaragua.

Roger said that since 2004 he has been unable to work due to illness, at which time he filed for his lifelong pension. Yet, even so, he continued with the same positive spirit and happiness that is characteristic of him. He said that the loans have been a great help as they have allowed him to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as irons, shoes, sandals, kiddie pools, disinfectant, glass sets, backpacks, men's pants, etc.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene la edad de 50 años, esta acompañado y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 esta bajo su cargo. Habita en chichigalpa la ciudad llamada la tierra del ron y el azucar. El es una persona humilde y con espiritu alegre. Nos comento que el laboro en una empresa por muchos años como obrero, pero desde el año 2003 el dejo trabajar por motivos de enfermedad, ya que la labor de campo le hace daño. 
Don Juan tiene como meta realizarle todas las mejoras necesarias a su casa de habitacion y que lo hara poco apoco con los creditos que le sean otorgados.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 50 years old. He is accompanied by four children, of which only one is under his care. He lives in Chichigalpa, the city called "the land of rum and sugar." He is a humble person with a happy spirit. He commented that he worked in a company for many years as a labourer, but as of 2003 he left work for health reasons, since the field work did him harm. 

Don Juan has a goal to carry out the necessary repairs for his home, and he will do it little by little with the loans that are awarded to him.

loans.use: to buy iron to make two doors and a window.

loans.name: Eduardo Javier

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de mecánica de Producción. Actualmente trabaja como chofer en una prestigiosa empresa y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, entusiasta y con muchos deseos de superación. Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Eduardo está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una computadora para su hija para que de esta manera ella pueda realizar sus trabajos sin ningún inconveniente y no gaste dinero yendo a una cabina de internet. Con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is an enterprising man. He is 37 years old, married, and lives with his family in Ica.

Eduardo studied for a degree in Mechanical Production. He currently works as a driver for a prestigious company and is doing very well because he is a responsible, hardworking and enthusiastic individual who has the drive to succeed. His greatest motivation in life is his family. For this reason, he strives day after day to provide them a better future.

Eduardo is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the assistance they have offered. He will be able to buy a computer for his daughter so that she can do her work without any problems and not have to spend money at an Internet café. This will improve her quality of life. Eduardo keeps striving so that his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his daughter.

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en:
Andresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell live shrimp business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of live shrimps to sell. She has been in this business for 6 years, and also earns more income from pig fattening and ice vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of live shrimps to sell

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam would like to take a further loan to buy materials and tools for baking bread to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and boosting sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for baking bread to sell

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Melodina is 37 years old and married with one child. With her child currently in school, Melodina works very hard to provide for her family.

Melodina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like coffee, sugar, cereals, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as the above.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like coffee, sugar, cereals, diapers, sanitary pads, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marvie Jane

texts.en:
Marvie Jane works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a PHP 5,250 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Marvie Jane will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Mirabel has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mirabel has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La constancia y la tenacidad son las cualidades principales de Ana Lucia, una mujer que junto a su esposo ha buscado como salir adelante. Orgullosa cuenta que al no encontrar trabajo estable, no se deprimió y decidió aprender a preparar concentrados de chile para comercializarlo, su compañero de vida fue su maestro. Es así como ha logrado estabilidad económica familiar. Ya son dos años y espera seguir prosperando. Tiene 35 años de edad y dos hijos, quienes también la apoyan en su ardua lucha para lograr mejores condiciones de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar chile, cebollas, zanahorias y envases para empacar el producto. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que es una mujer con grades sueños y metas, anhela hacer más grande el negocio, ganar más clientela y al mismo tiempo aumentar sus ingresos. Una de sus metas es lograr comprar una empacadora y materia prima para envasar sus productos, de manera que pueda seguir creciendo en el negocio. Entre sus planes futuros está ampliar el local donde comercializa, para una mayor capacidad de producción.
texts.en:
Perseverance and tenacity are the main qualities of Ana Lucia, a woman who has looked for ways to get ahead along with her husband. Proud of not being able to find a stable job, Ana Lucia never got depressed and decided to learn how to prepare chili pepper concentrate for sale. Her life companion was her teacher. As a result, she was able to achieve financial stability for her family. She has been in business for two years and hopes to keep prospering. Ana Lucia is 35 years old and has two children, who rely on her hard work so that they can have better living conditions.

She is requesting a loan in order to increase her production capital. Ana Lucia needs to buy chili peppers, onions, carrots, and containers for packaging her product. She places her trust in this loan since she is a woman with huge dreams and goals. Ana Lucia wishes to expand her business, gain more customers, and also increase her earnings. One of her goals is to buy a packaging machine and materials for packaging her products. This would help her business continue to grow. Among her future plans is to expand the shop where she conduct sales, which will also increase her production capacity.

loans.use: to buy chili peppers, onions, carrots, and containers for packaging her product.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.en: Gavhar was born in 1965. She is married. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Her children are adults. Gavhar feeds two cows. She gets a small income from this activity, so she is going to start a new business. She is going to begin a business growing and selling vegetables and crops. With this aim, Gavhar  took part in a course from a women's organization called "To Get Ahead". She got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for organizing a new business

loans.name: Felipa Adela Aida

texts.es: Felipa tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hija de 13 años y su hijo de 11 años de edad. Felipa tiene siete años de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas. La venta la realiza en su hogar de habitación lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su  hogar. Ella desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Felipa is 37 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion, her 13-year-old daughter, and her 11-year-old son. She has been selling tortillas for seven years. Felipa conducts her sales from her home in order to sustain her household.

She wants to replace the roof of her house, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails in order to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is studying Associate in Computer Technology at a university and wants to improve her family's living conditions in the future. Her father earns an income from his services as a driver and it is spent on the family's daily expenditures. It is not easy to send the children to school as they have a big family of 3 siblings. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC was used for her school expenses. She is very happy to be with GDMPC and for their help to students like her. She has taken out a new loan recently to pay her first semester tuition fees.

She wants to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay her first semester tuition fees.

loans.name: Rhomileen

texts.en:
Rhomileen is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Rhomileen and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Rhomileen is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rhomileen has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Rhomileen can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 61 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Yolanda's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Yolanda is taking out a PHP 9,871 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Yolanda has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Karen Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora  Karen de 32 años de edad es casada vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una casa que rentan, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en su negocio ubicado en la comunidad San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Karen en su negocio vende todo lo relacionado a la canasta familiar, es una mujer trabajadora y muy emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Karen está solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, jugos, churros, frescos, carnes, pollo, aceite, leches, queso, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y surtir más su negocio y por ende tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaren a salir adelante con su familia y a cumplir los proyectos que tiene.
Su sueño es tener su propia casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Karen, 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. She has operated a small grocery store for five years in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.

Karen sells all kinds of basic food items.  She is hardworking and enterprising and wants to succeed.  She has applied for a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, juices, doughnuts, softdrinks, meats, chicken, oil, milk products, cheese, etc.  With this loan, Karen will try to increase her income and inventory so that she can achieve higher profits, which will help her provide for her family and fund her projects. She dreams of owning a house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June, 2014.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, juices, doughnuts, softdrinks, meat, chicken, oil, milk, cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria Nena

texts.en:
Maria Nena is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental and has owned and operated a furniture-making business for more than four years. She earns a better income from this business and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying materials. She has had many competitors but she thanks God for giving her gifted workers resulting in competitive products to sell. Recently she took a new loan to purchase additional raw materials for manufacturing.

She has had her business for more than four years, from which she earns a better income. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for furniture manufacturing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rowena has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Farafina Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe FARAFINA LOLO sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles au  QUARTIER BABEMBA un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  ASSANATOU débout à la troisième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes FARAFINA LOLO, fait la vente des pagnes wax réal .
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 8 pièces de pagne wax réal au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail  au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Farafina Lolo group are married women who on average are 38 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in the Quartier Babemba, one of the populous neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their fifth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, to meet their customers' needs.

Mrs. Assanatou, who is standing in the third position from left to right in the photo of this Farafina Lolo group of women, sells pagnes real wax (colorful West-African fabric).

She intends to use the loan to buy eight lengths of pagne real wax at the main market where she is in high demand by her customers due to the quality of her products.

Retail sales are conducted at the market to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 28,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest, and the rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy pagnes real wax (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Jesus Reyes

texts.es: Jesús de 56 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y una nieta de 10 años de edad. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la venta de mariscos y su compañera de vida lo apoya con la venta de tamales para mantener la economía del hogar y dar a su nieta mejores condiciones de vida, dado que su madre murió hace unos años.  Jesús necesita hacer unas reparaciones en su vivienda como: el techo del corredor que esta deteriorado e instalará energía eléctrica en un cuarto para lo que  esta solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para  comprar madera, lámina galvanizada, clavos, tubos y alambres para  cambiar el techo del corredor y la instalación de energía eléctrica.
texts.en: Jesús is 56 years old and lives with his partner and one ten-year-old granddaughter. Jesús is a very hard-working man who makes a living selling seafood. His partner supports him by selling tamales to support the household economy and offer their granddaughter – whose mother died some years ago – better living conditions. Jesús needs to carry out some repairs in his home. The roof of the hall is in bad condition and needs replaced, and Jesús will install electricity in one room of the house. To do this work, Jesús is applying for a loan from “FUSAI”. He will use it to buy wood, metal sheeting, nails, tubes and wires in order to replace the hall roof and to install electricity.

loans.use: to buy wire and tubes for installing electricity, and to buy wood and metal sheeting for replacing the roof of his hall.

loans.name: Erick Alexander

texts.es: Erick de 40 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de comida y tortas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que el gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Erick está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pollo, arroz,  tortillas, aceite, pan, mayonesa, salsa, jamón, aguacate, queso craft, etc. Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Erick is 40 years old and lives with his partner and son. Erick makes a living selling meals and cakes. He runs the business out of his home and, with the money he earns, he is able to cover household costs. Erick is applying for a loan in order to buy chicken, rice, tortillas, oil, bread, mayonnaise, sauce, ham, avocados, Kraft cheese and more. With this loan, Erick wants to offer his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, tortillas, oil, bread, mayonnaise, sauce, ham, avocados, Kraft cheese and more.

loans.name: Katherine Patricia

texts.es: Katherine de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con su hijo y un sobrino ambos de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que se gana la vida de diferentes maneras tales como: lavando ropa ajena a domicilio, haciendo manicure y pedicure también a domicilio y vendiendo mango por temporadas. Katherine necesita construir el techo en el área del  baño, lavadero y pila, por lo que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava, polines, lámina galvanizada y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Katherine is 21 years old and a single mother. She lives with her son and a nephew, both four years old. Katherine is a very enterprising woman who earns a living doing different things: she washes clothes for people at their homes, she offers manicures and pedicures – also in people’s homes – and also sells mangoes when they are in season. Katherine needs to build a roof over the bathroom and washing area of her home. To do this work, she is applying for a loan from “FUSAI” in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, purlins, and metal sheeting, and to pay labourers.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, purlins, and metal sheeting, and to pay labourers to build a roof over her washing area.

loans.name: Keiry

texts.es:
La Joven Keiry de 28 años de edad es madre soltera,  tiene dos hijos   que depende de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras. 
Keiry se dedica desde hace 06  años  a la venta de ropa nueva y accesorios para cocina y ventiladores, también vende calzado y sandalias, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario visitan su negocio, es una mujer emprendedora que quiere salir adelante con sus hijos y su negocio.
Keiry está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra blusas, faldas pantalones, vestidos, camisetas, calzonetas, etc. ya que se aproxima  la feria de San Lorenzo y  quiere tener variedad de mercadería para aprovechar la venta y así tener mejores ganancias. Con el apoyo de este crédito espera salir  adelante y suplir su necesidad de financiamiento. Está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
 Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos estén bien de salud.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del 2014.
texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Keiry is a single mother to two children who depend on her. Keiry lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in the southern valley of Honduras.

For six years Keiry has made a living selling new clothes, kitchen accessories and fans. She also sells footwear – including sandals – and her customers are friends and others who come to visit her business. Keiry is an enterprising woman who wants to prosper with her children and the business.

Keiry is applying for a loan in order to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, trousers, shirts, swimming trunks and more. The San Lorenzo fair is approaching and Keiry wants to have a variety of merchandise on offer in order to make more sales and earn higher profits. With the support of this loan, Keiry hopes to prosper and fulfil her needs for capital. Keiry is very happy to continue working with “Prisma Honduras”

Keiry’s dream is to improve her business and for her children to remain in good health.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, June 2014

loans.use: in order to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, trousers, shirts, swimming trunks and more for her business.

loans.name: Maria Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora María  de  61  años de edad, vive con su esposo,  no tiene  hijos que dependan  de ella,  posee casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05  años al negocio de venta de  tortillas, tamales y venta de cuajada, es una mujer trabajadora que se levanta temprano a ordeñar sus bacas para luego hacer tortillas por la mañana y por la tarde horna pan, es un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación en su comunidad.
Doña María está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de tejas y bloques,  con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar un parte su casa y construir una pieza en su casa ya que desea dejarle un buen apartamento a una de sus hijas, su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener salud es una cliente muy honesta.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Julio del 2014
texts.en:
María is 61 years old and lives with her husband. She does not have children who depend on her and she owns her own house. For five years María has made a living selling tortillas, tamales, and cottage cheese. She is a hard-working woman who wakes up early to milk her cows. Later in the morning she makes tortillas and then bakes bread in the afternoons. María is an example of hard-work and dedication in her community.

María is applying for this loan in order to buy roof tiles and bricks. With the support of this loan she plans to make improvements to part of her house and build another room. María wants to leave a nice apartment to one of her daughters. María’s dream is to improve her house and to maintain her health. María is a very honest borrower.

San Lorenzo, July 2014

loans.use: to buy roof tiles and bricks for her house.

loans.name: Pintor Group

texts.es:
A una distancia de 4 horas rio arriba vive MARITZA en una comunidad CHACHI. ella tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 7 años. fue abandonada por su pareja cuando llevaba 6 meses de su segundo embarazo. desde entonces ha luchado mucho para poder conseguir la alimentación de sus hijos.
ella se dedico a cultivar cacao y aunque en pocas cantidades se solventaba para ofrecer un mejor día a sus hijos. 
en una comunidad cercana se enteró de FODEMI y con las autoridades de su pueblo se gestionó para llegar hasta este lugar y acceder a un crédito.
sus hijos asisten normalmente a clases. ella tiene pensado con este crédito poner una tienda de productos de primera necesidad ya que en la comunidad no la hay y para conseguir las compras hay que llegar hasta Borbón.
con esta cantidad de dinero ella comprará: arroz, aceite, panela, jabón, huevos, alka-seltzer , aspirina, y otros medicamentos básicos.
en un futuro no muy lejano espera haber surtido y ampliado su tienda llegando a vender toda clase de productos- incluidos los productos veterinarios. cree que FODEMI es la oportunidad que la gente del campo progrese a través de un crédito.

INFORMACION ADICIONAL
este grupo esta conformado por 16 personas- en la imagen saluda levantando su mano la lider del grupo. es su primer credito en FODEMI todos viven en la misma comunidad y la gran mayoria vive del cultivo de cacao y venta de madera. no cuentan con servicio de agua potable y ocupan agua del rio. no hay centros de salud pero cuentan con escuela de formacion basica para los niños. es una comunidad AUTOCTONA y hablan su idioma nativo.
texts.en:
At four hours from Río, Maritza lives in the Chachi community. Maritza has two children, aged 14 and 7 years old respectively. Maritza’s partner left her when she was six months pregnant with her second child and, since then, she has fought on her own to feed her children.

Martiza makes a living growing cacao and, although she grows it in small quantities, she makes enough to be able to offer her children a better life.
Maritza heard about the existence of the “FODEMI” organisation in a nearby community and, with the help of the local authorities, she was able to come and take out a loan.

Martiza’s children are in school. Maritza plans to use this loan in order to open a shop selling staple goods. There is no such shop in the community and residents must go to Borbón to buy goods.

With this loan, Maritza will buy rice, oil, brown sugar loaf, soap, eggs, Alka-Seltzer, aspirin, and a variety of other basic medicines.
In the not-too-distant future, Maritza hopes to have a stocked-up and big store where she sells all sorts of products, including for animals. Maritza believes that “FODEMI” is an opportunity for country folk to progress in life with the help of a loan.

Additional Information

This group has 16 members. In the photo, the group’s leader has her hand raised. This is the group’s first “FODEMI” loan. All of the group’s members live in the same community, and the majority make a living growing cacao and selling wood. The community does not have running water and so collects water from the river. There are no health centres here but there is a school to provide children with basic education. This is an autochthonous community where the inhabitants speak their native language.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, brown sugar loaf, soap, eggs, and a variety of medicines so that the community has a place to buy them.

loans.name: Maria Jacinta

texts.es:
La señora María Jacinta de 66 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas y pan, vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
Doña María Jacinta es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña María Jacinta está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, leña y cuajada que necesita para elaborar sus rosquillas y el pan con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio de 2014
texts.en:
María Jacinta is 66 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house that the family owns. For twelve years María has made a living selling “rosquillas” (a type of sweet pastry) and bread. She lives in a village in the south of Honduras.
María is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead. She fights every day in order to improve her quality of life.
María is applying for a loan in order to buy items such as corn, firewood and cottage cheese, which she needs for making the “rosquillas” and bread. With the support of this loan María plans to increase her income and improve her quality of life. María is a new borrower with a desire to work with “Prisma Honduras”.
María’s dream is to have a good business, increase her number of customers and, at the same time, have a better future with her family.
San Lorenzo, Honduras, June 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and cottage cheese for her business.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à BILASSO un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame AWA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  FOTEMOGOBAN 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  106 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Fotemogoban 1 group are married women who, on average, are 41 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Bilasso, a village in Loulouni, a region of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. The group is on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Awa, who is standing first from the right in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy three 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and three drums of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm a 3/4 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Awa hopes to earn an average profit of 106,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband with the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Fotemogoban 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à BILASSO un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali.

Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.

Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

They are on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Djeneba Oumar, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy three 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and three drums of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm a 3/4 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Djeneba Oumar hopes to earn an average profit of 106,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband with the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Fotemogoban 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 2 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 58 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à BILASSO un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame NAIMATOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  FOTEMOGOBAN 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  73 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
