The two members of the Fotemogoban 3 group are married women who, on average, are 58 years old and have four children. They live for the most part in traditional families in Bilasso, a village in Loulouni, in the Sikasso region, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Naimatou, who is standing on the right in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and one drum of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/2 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit. 

Naimatou hopes to earn an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband with their family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Yerekungnini Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe YEREKUNGNINI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à BOBOKIN un village dans la commune de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz  avec madame  CHITAN débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme YEREKUNGNINI. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir 0,75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  106 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Yerekungnini group are married women who, on average, are 49 years old and have four children. They live for the most part in traditional families in Bobokin, a village in Loulouni, in the Sikasso region, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Chitan, who is standing second from the right in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy three 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and three drums of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm a 3/4 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Chitan hopes to earn an average profit of 106,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband take care of the family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, rice, and cosmetics

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, los dos mayores le ayudan económicamente, la cliente posee una tienda en su domicilio, desde hace 3 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y la ayuda de sus hijos logra solventar los gatos que se le presentan en su  hogar,  Vilma solicita un crédito para la compra de: golosinas, granos básicos, refrescos azúcar, detergentes, jabón, etc.  y asi poder tener junto a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her three children. The two older ones help her out financially. Vilma has had a shop in her home for 3 years. With what she gets from her profits and the help of her children she is able to cover the household outlay.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy sweets, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, detergents, soap etc. so that she and her children can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, basic grains, soft drinks, sugar, detergents, soap etc.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 26 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida, un hijastro de 21 años y sus 2 hijos uno de 7 años y otro de 8 meses de edad. Ella es una mujer muy laboriosa que apoya económicamente a su familia vendiendo pescado y cangrejos tres días por semana. María necesita construir un cuarto para sus hijos lo antes posible para mayor seguridad, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder comprar lamina galvanizada, madera, clavos y pagar mano de obra para la construcción de dicho cuarto.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old and lives with her life partner, a 21-year-old stepson and her two children, one aged 7 years and the other 8 months. She is a very hard-working woman who supports her family financially by selling fish and crabs three days a week.

María needs to build a room for her children as soon as possible to improve safety, and so she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails and to pay for labour to build the room.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails and to pay for labour to build a room for her children.

loans.name: Katiere-Ton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KATIERE-TON 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à GNIRIWANI un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame SALI débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KATIERE-TON 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 61 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Katiere-Ton 1 group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have three children. They live for the most part in traditional families in Gniriwani, a village in Farakala, Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Sali, who is standing first from the left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy one 50-kilogram sac of fertilizer and one drum of herbicide. She will also pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/2 hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Sali hopes to earn an average profit of 61,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Giovanny Alfredo

texts.es: Geovanny  de34 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas desde hace varios años, con lo que vende logra solventar todas las necesidades de su hogar, Geovanny solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo y así poder comprar  maíz, frijol, quesillo, chicharrón,  etc. y continuar su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Geovanny is 34 years old and lives with his wife and their two children. For several years he has had a business selling pupusas [thick corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. With what he sells he is able to cover all of his household's needs.

Geovanny is asking for a loan in order to have working capital to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, pork rinds etc. so he can continue with his business to improve his income and give his family what they need with no limitations.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, fresh cheese, pork rinds etc.

loans.name: Irvin Orlando

texts.es: Irvin de 24 años de edad vive con su madre. Él es un joven emprendedor que trabaja como jornalero en siembras de maíz y pipían y sus estudios de bachillerato los realiza en horas nocturnas. Irvin desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que solicita un préstamo a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo de piso, arena, grava, cemento y pagar mano de obra para que cambien el ladrillo de piso de su vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en:
Irvin is 24 years old and lives with his mother. He is a young entrepreneur who works as a day worker cultivating corn and pipián [a type of squash]. He is studying for his high school diploma at night time.

Irvin wants to improve his family's living conditions and so he is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy floor bricks, sand, gravel and cement and pay for labour to change the brick floor in his home, since it is in a poor condition.

loans.use: to buy floor bricks, sand, gravel and cement and pay for labour to change the brick floor in his home.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 54 años de edad vive con su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, fresco y antojitos típicos desde hace tres años, también lava ropa a domicilio. Ella necesita reparar su vivienda ya que está completamente deteriorada como se observa en la fotografía, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina, clavos, alambre de amarre, costanera y pagar mano de obra para la mejora. Espera poder constar con este financiamiento y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54, lives with her husband.  She sells tortillas, softdrinks and typical snack foods and has been in business for three years.  She also runs a laundry service out of her home.  Rosa needs to make some repairs in her house which completely dilapidated as seen in the photograph.

She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, nails, wire, wood and to hire workers for the improvements.  She hopes to receive this financing and giver her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, nails, wire, wood, and hire workers to repair her house.

loans.name: Sandra Lucia

texts.es: Sandra Lucia, 37 años de edad casada con un hijo menor de edad, bajo su responsabilidad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a la compra venta de mercadería en general como: ropa de niños, adultos, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, short, faldas, ropa interior, venta de plata, oro, cosméticos, zapatos, sandalias,tintes, perfumenes de damas y caballeros, desodorantes, shampoo, bisutería,  cremas, acetonas, colas, prensa pelos entre otros mas, negocio el cual lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de esta localidad, sus compras son al contado la por mayor en mercados de mayoreos de otro departamento el cual viaja quincenal a traer nueva mercadería, y sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, hoy en día tiene mayor demanda de sus productos porque tambien entrega por pedidos de sus clientes, y sus ingresos son mayores, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su capital de trabajo y el de ampliar su negocio, ver a su hijo realizado en la vida, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de nueva y variedad de mercadería ya que tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes. Sandra Lucia agradece la ayuda que le brinda el inversionista kiva a los pequeños comerciantes para tener un medio de trabajo propio para poder sobrevivir con sus familias en un país que tiene tantas carencias y falta de recursos para nuestras futuras generaciones.
texts.en:
Sandra Lucia, 37, is married and has a minor child in her care.  She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the western part of the country.  She is known for being an enterprising, hard-working, responsible woman with a great desire for personal success.  She is a small business owner who sells merchandise in general such as children's clothing, adult pants, shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, underwear, and also silver, gold, cosmetics, shoes, sandals, hair color, women's and men's perfumes, deodorants, shampoo, jewlery, creams, nail polish remover, hair accessories, and other items.  The business is located in one of the markets in the town.  

She makes her purchases in cash at the wholesale market in another department she travels to every two weeks.  She sells in cash and on a credit basis to fixed and eventual customers.  Nowadays she has a higher demand for her products because she also delivers to them to her clients.  Her income has increased and one of her goals is to expand business to earn more income.  She also wants to see her son become successful in life.

This new loan is to buy a variety of new merchandise to fill orders she has from customers.  Sandra Lucia is grateful for the support Kiva lenders give to small merchants so they have work and can survive with their families in a country where things are scarce, with a lack of resources for future generations.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, children's clothing, shoes, creams, jewelry and other items.

loans.name: Katiere-Ton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  KATIERE-TON 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à GNIRIWANI un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame SITAN YAYA assise  à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KATIERE-TON 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Katiere-Ton 2 group are married women who on average are 38 years old with four children, living for the most part in traditional families in Gniriwani, a village in the Farakala commune, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Sitan Yaya, who is standing in the second position from right to left in the photo of this Katiere-Ton 2 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 74,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Sinignesigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SINIGNESIGUI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  NONTANSSO  un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame ALIMATOU débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  SINIGNESIGUI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Alimatou, who is standing in the second position from right to left in the photo of this Sinignesigui 1 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 74,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily household expenses.

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame INA assise  à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme KATIERE-TON 3.

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 61 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Katiere-Ton 3 group are married women who on average are 37 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Gniriwani, a village in the Farakala commune, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Ina, who is sitting in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Katiere-Ton 3 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 61,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.name: Tiormoula  A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe TIORMOULA  A  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à IFOLA un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ALIMATA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme TIORMOULA  A . 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Tiormoula A group are married women who on average are 44 years old with five children, living for the most part in traditional families in Ifola, a village in the Farakala commune, which is part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is groundnuts featuring Mrs. Alimata, who is standing in the second position from left to right in the photo of this Tiormoula A group of women.

She will use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, two containers of herbicide, and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.75 hectares (about 1.85 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 85,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and help her husband with daily household expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Jeri Antonia

texts.es: Jeri Antonia 21 años de edad acompañada con un hijo de dos años de edad bajo su responsabilidad de origen chinandegana, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y turística, Jeri es una microempresaria y administradora de dos triciclos comerciales con los que presta el servicio de transporte de carga a la población en general en esta localidad, tiene dos personas las cuales le trabajan en este negocio mientras Jeri se dedica a la comercialización de los derivados del pollo como: pollo entero, en piezas, menudos tambien vende hielo, popsicles, gelatinas entre otros, inicia estos negocios como un medio para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, al igual que aun sigue estudiando para ser una profesional y darle un mejor futuro a su hijo,  sus compras las realiza al contado y al crédito a distribuidores que les ofrecen el producto en su casa de habitación tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Jeri se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, de carácter fuerte y con muchos deseos de superación personal y laboral, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer mas su negocio y ampliarlo al igual que ser una profesional y darle un mejor futuro a su hijo, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para compra de activo fijo en la compra de una unidad mas de transporte y invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de pollo al por mayor,debido a que su demanda ha crecido y tiene que cubrir con los pedidos que se le han pedido.-
texts.en:
Jeri Antonia is 21 years old. She lives with a partner and has a two-year-old son she is responsible for. She is a native of Chinandega, which is in the west of the country and an area which is productive in commerce and tourism.

Jeri is a small business owner and has three commercial tricycles which she uses to provide freight services to the general population in her town. Two people work for her in this business, while Jeri is engaged in selling chicken products, like whole chicken, chicken parts, and sometimes she also sells ice, popsicles, jelly, and other things. She started this business in order to help with the household expenses. As that is, she is also studying to become a professional and to offer her son a better future.

She makes her purchases in cash and on credit from vendors who sell the goods in their homes. She has permanent and temporary customers. Jeri is a hard-working and responsible woman with a strong character and eager to get ahead personally and in her job. It is one of her dreams to be able to grow her business and to increase it, and also to be a professional and to offer a better future to her son.

She aims to invest this loan in fixed asset, which is to buy another transportation unit, and to invest it in the purchase of chicken in bulk, because the demand has risen and she needs to fulfill the orders which have been placed with her.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets (a tricycle), and to invest in working capital (to buy chicken in bulk).

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.pt:
O Sr. Alberto de 58 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos que estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ele è responsavel na empresa de produção de blocos, vigas e placas a mais de 3 anos,mas também tem trabalhado com sua esposa que é agricultora informal a mais de 10 anos, faz producão de milho, fejao-verde, batata-reno e mais diversos produtos, seus produtos vende a porta da sua machamba e em diversos mercados de Boane.
O presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar insumos agricolas (vitaminas, sementes de milho, feijão verde, cebola) para  dinamizar actividade agricola de forma melhorar as condições a dieta almentar e garantir a sua reforma.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto is 58 years old, married and the father of 2 children who are attending primary school. At the company where he works, he has been responsible for the production of bricks, beams and slabs for more than 3 years, but he has also been helping his wife with her informal farming for the last 10. They grow corn, runner beans, Reno potatoes and other products which they sell at the door of their small farm and at various markets in Boane.

The current loan will be used to buy raw materials for farming (vitamins, seeds for corn, runner beans and onions) so as to boost their agricultural activities, improve their diets and guarantee his retirement.

loans.use: buy raw materials for farming (vitamins, seeds for corn, runner beans and onions) so as to boost their agricultural activities, improve their diets and guarantee his retirement.

loans.name: G.s. El Arca De Noe Ii Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario El Arca de Noe II, esta conformado por tres integrantes Petrona García, Maribel García y Jesús Roque todas casadas con cinco hijos  de los cuales todos están bajo su responsabilidad originarios de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, estos integrantes de este grupo se conocen muy bien porque son de la misma zona por lo tanto decidieron optar un financiamiento bajo la modalidad de Grupo Solidario para brindarse apoyo económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocio Petrona quien es la coordinadora del grupo la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad y cumplimiento de pagos en tiempo y forma, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la compra venta de granos básicos como:semillas de jicaros, maní, frijoles, sorgo, entre otros, al igual tambien administra una disco móvil que ofrece sus servicios a la población en cual quier evento que se presente como: quinceaños, bodas, cumpleaños, fiestas locales entre otros mas, inicia su negocio cuando se caso buscando un medio digno de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos familiares ya que no podía aspirar a un empleo puesto que no termino de estudiar ya que lamentablemente venia de una familia de escasos recursos económicos, y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para aporta a los gastos del hogar, Por tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos, negocio el cual tiene ya 20 años de dedicarse a este tipo de comercio y servicio, y de esa forma ha podido mantener estudiando a sus hijos, uno de sus sueños es poder seguir brindando a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudios profesionales que no tuvo con sus padres. sus compras son al contado y sus ventas son al contado y al crédito la mayor parte de sus productos se mantiene en cuentas por cobrar y pocas veces mantiene `productos en sus casa ya que es un producto que entrega cada dos días, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de productos de granos básicos como: maíz, frijoles, sordo, semillas de jicaros y darle mantenimiento a la disco móvil entre otros, ya que su demanda ha incrementado y así poder ofrecerles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. EL G.S El Arca de Noe II agradece a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que les brindan a los comerciantes pequeños de países pobres como es Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de vida
texts.en: The El Arca de Noe II support group is made up of three members: Petrona García, Maribel García and Jesús Roque. All of them are married and they have five children under their care. They are from one of the towns in northern Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. The members of this group know each other very well because they are from the same area. That is why they decided to opt for a loan under the Support Group modality so they could offer each other financial support and invest in their different businesses. Petrona, who is the coordinator of the group and in charge of responsibility and punctuality of payments, is a micro-businesswoman who buys and sells basic grains such as jicaro seeds, peanuts, beans, sorghum, and more. She also manages a mobile DJ service and offers the service in her town at any event, such as quincieneras, weddings, birthdays, local festivals and more. She started her business when she married, seeking dignified work to help with the family expenses. She couldn't get a job because she didn't finish her education because unfortunately she came from a low income family and she had to work since she was very young to contribute the household budget. Therefore, she fights day to day to offer a better future to her children. She has 20 years' experience in this type of business and service and this is how she has been able to keep her children in school. One of her dreams is to be able to keep offering her children the chance to go to college that their parents never had. She pays for her purchases up front and is paid up front and on credit. Most of her products are sold on credit and she she doesn't keep products in her house very often because they are delivered every two days. The purpose of this new loan is to invest in buying basic grain products such as corn, beans, sorghum, and jicaro seeds, as well as to do maintenance on her mobile DJ equipment, among other things. Demand is increasing and this way she can offer her customers a better service. The El Arca de Noe II support group thanks the Kiva investors for the help they offer small business people from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy basic grain products such as beans, sorghum, corn, and jicaro seeds, as well as do maintenance on her mobile DJ equipment.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro Antonio, mayor de edad casado con siete hijos, todos menores de edad y bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, pedro se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario y administrador el cual posee en su casa de habitación una pequeña pulperia donde oferta productos de consumo diario del hogar como: arroz, golosinas, huevos, pan, salsas de tomates, papel higiénicos, bolsitas de tan, azúcar, detergentes, jabón,bolsitas de shampoo, tomates, cebollas entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de la localidad y sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su negocio con ahorros que pudo juntar con servicio de transporte con triciclos debido a que viene de una familia de escasos recursos económicos y tuvo la oportunidad de aprender a leer y escribir a parte de eso tiene siete hijos a los que no les ha podido dar los estudios por la situación económica en la que viven todos trabajan a excepción de dos menores de edad los demás trabajan para poder llevar el sustento al hogar, actualmente esta solicitando por primera vez un financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas entre otros, uno de sus mayores sueños es crecer en su negocio para mejorar la situación económica que viven y que todos sus hijos dejen de trabajar y pueda realizar una carrera profesional.
texts.en: Pedro Antonio is an adult who is married and has seven children. All of them are minors and under his care. He is from one of the towns in northern  Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. Pedro is described as a hardworking man who is honest, responsible and very eager to get ahead personally. He is a micro-businessman and manager of a small store he has in his home. He offers different products for daily household consumption such as rice, snacks, eggs, bread, tomato sauce, toilet paper, tea bags, sugar, detergent, soap, shampoo, tomatoes, onions and more. He pays for his purchases up front in the local markets and sells to regular and new customers who pay him upfront. He started his business with savings that he was able to amass from his tricycle transportation service. He comes from a low income family and was able to learn to read and write. He has seven children whom he hasn't been able to give an education due to the financial situation they are in. All of them work except for the two youngest and contribute to the household. Now, for the first time, he is asking for a loan to invest in working capital to buy household consumption products such as rice, sugar, oil, snacks and more. One of his biggest dreams is to grow his business to improve their financial situation and for all of his children to stop working and learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy home consumption products such as rice, sugar, oil, snacks and more.

loans.name: Veronica Francisca

texts.es: Verónica Francisca, 38 años de edad madre soltera de dos hijas las cuales solo una esta aun bajo su responsabilidad, de origen Chinandegana, ubicada en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal; en sus ratos libre le gustar pasar tiempo de calidad con su hija y le prepara un plato típico de la región como es Indio Viejo lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera, por lo que se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, Verónica es una microempresaria y administradora de una pulperia el cual ofrece productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobres de café, sobres de shampoo, cigarros por unidad, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, leche, gaseosas, jugos, detergentes, jabón, pollo, huevos, toallas sanitarias,papel higiénicos, sardinas, sobres de sopa maggi, sopas maruchan, productos congelados entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras y distribuidores que le dejan la mercadería en las puertas de su negocio sus ventas son al contado y en algunas ocasiones al crédito a clientes fijos, inicia este negocio con capital y fondos propios porque son productos que todos consumen en cualquier época del año, empieza con una pequeña truchita((negocio muy pequeño) y así ha venido poco a poco incrementando su inventario, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio y tener una mejor rentabilidad económica, construir un cuarto, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de granos básicos en general como: golosinas, gaseosas, aceite, productos congelados, de esa forma crecer la magnitud de su negocio para comprar a mejores precios, surtiendo con los productos mas demandantes y así obtener mayor volumen de ingresos y ofertarles mejores precios a sus clientes.
texts.en: Verónica Francisca is 38 years old. She is the single mother of two daughters, of whom only one is still under her care. She is from Chinandegana, located in the western part of the country. She is described as a hardworking, responsible woman who really wants to get ahead. In her free time, she likes to spend quality time with her daughter and make the area's traditional dish, called Indio Viejo. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, she wasn't able to go to college because she had to work from an early age to help with the household expenses. Verónica is a micro businesswoman and manager of a small store where she offers daily consumption products in small quantities such as coffee envelopes, shampoo envelopes, loose cigarettes, rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, milk, sodas, juices, detergent, soap, chicken, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, sardines, Maggi soup envelopes, Maruchan soups, frozen food and more. She pays for her purchases up front from distributors who deliver the merchandise to her door and she is paid up front or sometimes on credit with regular customers. She started this business with her own capital and funds because they are products that are consumed all year round. She started with a little "truchita" (a very small business). Little by little she has increased her inventory. One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business more and have more financial stability and build a room. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business and buy basic grains and snacks, sodas, oil, and frozen food. This way, she can expand her business to buy at better products and stock a wider variety of products more in demand, earning more income and offering better prices to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products such as basic grains, detergents, firewood, frozen food, snacks, and more.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 50 years old and married with two children. Salome works very hard to provide for them.

Salome runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like rice, biscuits, canned goods, chocolate drinks, milk, coffee, soft drinks, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for two years, and sells a variety of items such as rice, biscuits, canned goods, chocolate drinks, milk, coffee, soft drinks, sanitary pads, etc. 

Salome would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like rice, biscuits, canned goods, chocolate drinks, milk, coffee, soft drinks, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: La's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Battambang province, La is 32 years old and a married mother blessed with four children; three are in school and one is too young for schooling. The main sources of income for her family are from rice cropping on a three hectares area and her husband's job as a taxi driver. 

This is the second micro loan for La’s group, consisting of two borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her loan, which enables her to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood in a gradual pace. 

Now, in a group of two, she is a leader.  She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop. 

She highly hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en:
Sarvinoz is a young and smart woman. She is 18 years old. Sarvinoz is not married, and she lives with her parents. 

She is going to start her own sewing business and use it to get ahead; she will service her clients from her house. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead’, with a woman's organization and got a certificate. 

Sarvinoz needs to buy a sewing machine now. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson has been helping his parents working on their own farm for a living. He also works in a private institution as an account officer, and he earns a better income from this. 

His income is not enough to finance their farm, and because of this, Nelson borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer and for maintenance costs. 

In the future, he wants to cultivate the whole farm to ensure a better income for his family's better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for maintenance costs

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is 62 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with no dependent. 

She earns a living from farming, specifically coconut production and hog raising. Andresa earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing construction materials for house renovation. 

Andresa has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Andresa hopes to acquire more agricultural lands to increase her agricultural activities and possible income.

loans.use: To be used for purchasing construction materials for house renovation

loans.name: G.s. Fe Y Esperanza I Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Fe y Esperanza I, esta conformado por tres integrantes: Carla Cristina, Maria Lizeth y Juana Francisca, todos solteros con nueve hijos menores de edad residentes de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, por sus hermosas playas y venta de mariscos, plátanos, entre otros,estos integrantes se conocen muy bien porque son de la misma zona motivo por el cual deciden formar un grupo solidario para apoyarse uno a otro económicamente e invertir en sus negocios que consisten en el destace de cerdo, tortillas, frijoles cosidos, leña, prendas entre otros, Carla quien es la coordinadora del grupos y encargada del cumplimiento de los pagos en tiempo y forma de cada uno de ellos, se dedica al destace de cerdos y sus derivados como: frito rojo, frito blanco, nacatamales, moronga, charrasca, entre otros al igual que un taller de tortillas, sus compras son al contado a comerciantes aledaños a su localidad y en mercados y distribuidoras, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Carla inicia su negocio hace mas de 10 años el cual lo aprende desde muy niña debido a que su mama trabajada en este ramo del destace de cerdos y se independiza con su capital propio los que realiza dos veces por semana al igual que elabora las tortillas todos los días en tres tiempos de comidas desde muy temprano y los frijoles cosidos que no pueden fallar para su clientela, uno de sus sueños es poder incrementar si negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de maíz, cal, leña, cerdos, hojas, frijoles, achote, papas, sal, pasas, hierbabuena, entre otros para la realización de sus deliciosos nacatamales, tortillas y frijoles cosidos, y en un futuro no muy lejano poder incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Fe y Esperanza I Solidarity Group is made up of three members: Carla Cristina, María Lizeth, and Juana Francisca.  They're all single and live in one of the towns in Chinandega, in the western part of the country, with nine minor children.  The area is known for being commercially productive, for tourism, for its beautiful beaches, and for selling shellfish, bananas, and other products.

These members know each other very well because they're from the same area.  They decided to form a solidarity group to support each other financially and invest in their businesses: butchering pigs, tortillas, cooked beans, firewood, garments, and others.

Carla coordinates the group and is responsible for each member making her payment on time.  She earns a living butchering pigs and by-products, including fried cheese, fried fish, nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales], moronga [morcilla] sausage, and grilled meat.  She also has a tortilla shop.  She purchases in cash from merchants near her town and in wholesale markets.  She makes her sales in cash to regular and occasional customers.

Carla started her business more than 10 years ago, having learned it at a young age from her mother, who worked in the field of pig butchering.  She became independent with her own capital.  She butchers twice a week and also makes tortillas three times every day from an early hour as well as cooked beans for her customers without fail.  One of her dreams is to be able to expand her business and satisfy her customers' needs.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital to stock her business with corn, lime, firewood, pigs, leaves, beans, achiote, potatoes, salt, raisins, mint, and other ingredients to make her delicious nacatamales, tortillas, and fried beans and increase her profits in the near future.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, salt, pigs, and condiments

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora, 48, is a married woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dioscora has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dioscora has been in this business for 10 years.

Dioscora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business. Dioscora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her fishing business.

loans.name: Punnagai Shg - Keelanatham Group

texts.en:
Deivanai is the leader of the Punnagai Self-Help Group, which is managed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. Deivanai lives in Keelanatham village, Ariyalur district.

Deivanai and her family live in their own house. Her husband is a clerk. 

Deivanai and other members of the group have taken loans from PAT before for improving their livelihood. They all are seeking a loan to purchase  smokeless stoves, which are efficient, sustainable, durable and designed for daily use.

The traditional mud stove is very inefficient and emits a lot of smoke and soot, which creates many health problems.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to replenish her business with fabrics.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 58 years old, married, and has five children.

Avelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from food vending. 

She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Avelina has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Avelina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta, 47, has a live-in partner and eight children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Vicenta has a handicraft business in the Philippines. Vicenta has been in this business for six years.

Vicenta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials like wire, shells, etc. for her business.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials like wire, shells, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jessica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Jessica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Nermin

texts.en:
Nermin is a married mother of three children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and her youngest is 7. For six years she has been selling her handmade baby clothes and accessories (blankets, cardigans, vests, etc.). She began by selling to her relatives and neighbors. When sales took off she began to expand her customer base. 

With the loan she will buy wholesale supplies. She’s thinking of doing a series. She believes that if she has more ready-made supplies available she will be able to complete more orders. Economically contributing to her family and meeting her children’s needs gives her pleasure and spiritual fulfillment.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nermin Hanım evli en büyüğü on sekiz en küçüğü yedi yaşında üç çocuk annesi.  Altı senedir bebek malzemeleri (battaniye,hırka,yelek vs.)yapıp satıyor.  İlk başladığında akrabalarına ve komşularına satış yapmış.  Yaptığı işler tutulunda siperişleri artıyor ve dışarılarada yapıp satıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile toplu malzeme alacak.  Seri çalışmayı düşünüyor.  Elinde fazladan yapılmış ürünler olursa siparişlere daha çok yetişeceğini düşünüyor.  Ailesine ekonomik olarak katkı sağlamak,çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak hoşuna gidiyor ve ona manevi bir doyum sağlıyor.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea works hard to support her family. Irenea is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Irenea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her fishing business.

Irenea has been in this business for 15 years now.

Irenea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 22 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennifer has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria works hard to support her family. Gregoria is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gregoria requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Gregoria has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Gregoria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, for her food production business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married and has one infant. She has a hog-raising business (two sows) and has also had a vegetable garden for almost one year. Her daily profits are usually spent on daily needs, maintenance to the vegetable farming, on buying gas daily, and for her infant's needs.

Marivic would like to keep her hog-raising business growing; that's the reason why she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She will use this amount in buying hog feed and vitamins, and some amount will be used for her vegetable garden. She believes that someday, she could raise more hogs in order to secure her family and send her only child to school.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins and support the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Mariam, in her 40s, is a hardworking woman and a mother of four children. (One is schooling and the rest are grown.) She is divorced and since she has been taking care of her family. She manages a mama lishe (local restaurant or cafe) and soft drinks selling business that she has been running since 1996. Mariam cooks soup, tea with chapati, rice snacks, lunch food such as ugali, rice with meat, vegetables, fruits. She serves people from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, making a good profit.

She is now requesting a loan via Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous first loan to repair her house by putting up a nice and strong wall in a place that was allowing robbers to pass through. She is so happy now because she no longer faces such a problem of having items stolen. Now she lives a peaceful life. 

Mariam dreams of being a successful mother. She will use this loan to buy drinks and cooking ingredients for her mama lishe.

She will share this loan with her loan group,"Nia Njema," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks and cooking ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is single and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and beauty products for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and beauty products for her business

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and beans for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, wheat flour and beans for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hamdiye

texts.en:
Hamdiye has three children and lost her husband. She was pregnant with her third child when her husband died. She is now sending her youngest to school, while her other two children have finished college. She used to sell knitting yarn and cleaning products. Now she has shifted her business and makes baklava, which she sells by the kilo. She has made arrangements to sell her products at markets. With the loan, she will buy a commercial oven, which will make her job easier.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Hamdiye Hanım, 3 çocuklu,eşini kaybetmiş.  3.çocuğuna hamileyken eşi ölüyor. 3 kızınıda okutuyor. 2 kızı ünversiteyi bitirdi.  Bir kızı devam ediyor.  Önceleri,örgü ipi satışı ve temizlik ürünleri satıyordu.  Şimdi iş değişikliği yaparak,baklava üretimine başladı.  1 kg lık tepsilerle baklava yapıyor.  Marketlerle anlaşma yapmış buralarda satışa sunuyor.  Bu krediyle,sanayi tipi fırın alarak,işini kolaylaştıracak.

loans.use: to buy a commercial oven

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en:
Varsenik is self-employed and from Tsaghkut village of Shirak region. She lives there with her husband. Varsenik's 19-year-old son serves in the army. Jointly with her husband, she has been engaged in animal husbandry for a long time. Particularly, they breed cattle, sheep and hens. 

Varsenik is planning to make some investments into her family's agribusiness. She has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her agribusiness, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. 

Varsenik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. The requested amount will be used to purchase 1,000 liters of fuel, buy 200 tons of grass and organize grass transportation. This loan will be a huge support for Varsenik and her family. Let's help them implement their plans.

loans.use: to purchase fuel (1,000 liters), animal feed (200 tons of grass) and organize grass transportation

loans.name: El Reencuentro  (Tosagua) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito  El Reencuentro se reúne cada quince días en el cantón Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
Este es un grupo formado por 8 mujeres y 2 varones que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo De Crédito  que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos han  podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, ganadería y la agricultura.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Silvia, tiene 64 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación  tiene cuatro  hijos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven aun en su casa. 
Doña Silvia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para no depender de nadie, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien,  lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que son muy buenos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
La foto pequeña esde tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en: The Credit Group El Reencuentro meets every fifteen days in the Tosagua Canton. This place is known for being very dynamic, where most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raise animals, because it is an area of great vegetation. This group is formed by 8 women and 2 men, who decided to join some time ago and form this Credit Group, that has been very helpful, because with the loans they have been able to improve their small businesses. They work in different activities such as commerce, animal husbandry and agriculture. One of the group members is Silvia. She is 64 years old, separated and has four older children, three of whom still live with her. Silvia is a very hardworking woman who likes to earn her own money so she does not depend on anyone. She works selling clothes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). Her way of selling is door to door. She works three days a week from two to three hours per day. She leaves her products on a loan basis and is paid eight days later. She has been working for more than four years in this activity and is doing very well. What she sells most are perfumes and cosmetics because they are very good. She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes. This is her first loan cycle with this Credit Group, and she likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to have a boutique. The small photo shows the three member, who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 48 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Elvira has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

Elvira has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is 44 years old and married with five children.

Felina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Felina has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for fifteen years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and electronic mobile load retailing.

Felina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Godofreda

texts.en:
Godofreda is 46 years old and married.  

Godofreda is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

She has been raising cattle for fifteen years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Godofreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and other supplies for her cattle.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is 44 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amor runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Amor has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Amor would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: 24 De Diciembre Del Florón  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socias  del Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre del Florón. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellos hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito el cual les ha ayudado mucho en sus negocios y su vida familiar.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Carolina, tiene 29 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 6 años y  de 5 meses el menor, el mayor  estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja para el estado.
Doña Carolina es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, en horas de la mañana ella aprovecha que su hijo está en la escuela y solo tiene que llevar al más pequeño, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the area known as El Florón in the city of Portoviejo, the members of the Grupo de Crédito 24 De Diciembre del Florón meet every two weeks. They work in various businesses such as general trade, service delivery and more. A while ago, they decided to unite and form this credit group, which has helped them a lot in their businesses and family lives.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Carolina. She is 29 years old and is married with two children who are 6 years old and 5 months old. Her oldest child is in school. Her husband works for the state.

Doña Carolina is a housewife who makes her own income to help her husband with household expenses by selling clothes, shoes and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances and accessories for women). She works three days a week, in the morning she enjoys that her child is in school and she only has to carry the younger one. She sells her goods on credit and collects payment every week. She has worked more than 10 years in this business, which helps to raise their children.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, lotions and cosmetics. She has been in the Grupo de Crédito from the start and likes it because the loans finance her business. Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Varuzhan

texts.en:
Varuzhan is 56 years old and he lives with his nice family in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. He graduated from Yerevan State University in the department of Physics. With his 25 years of pedagogical experience, he works at the college of Vanadzor State University as a teacher of physics. He is a very clever and patient pedagogue. At the rented flat Varuzhan, he also gives paid private courses in physics and he has 30 pupils who attend these courses to get prepared for the entrance examinations.   
Varuzhan says it has been a long period that he hasn't managed to renew and enlarge his professional literature, so he wants this loan in order both to buy literature connected with physics and he also wants to buy a computer, without which, nowadays, it is just impossible for the teacher to work.

loans.use: to buy literature connected with physics and also to buy a computer.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia trabaja en una empresa como auxiliar administrativo, vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive con sus padres y hermanos.
Sus metas futuras son la de tener algún departamento a su cargo en su trabajo, seguir estudiando y obtener mejor ingreso para ayudar a su familia, y que sus seres queridos tengan un futuro mejor.
Natalia está estudiando la carrera de Licenciatura en Economía, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar libros para seguir estudiando y luchando por sus metas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Natalia lives in the city of San Lorenzo with her parents and siblings, and works as an administrative assistant in a business. Her goals for the future are to become the head of a department at work, to keep studying, and to earn more income to help her family, so that her loved ones will have a better future.

Natalia is working towards a college degree in economics, and she is asking for this loan to buy textbooks so that she can continue her studies and work towards her goals as she has been up until now.

loans.use: buy textbooks for college.

loans.name: Ibadatkan

texts.ru: Ибадаткан 48 лет, замужем, есть дочь. У Ибадаткан  среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, на данный момент у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 1 теленок и 10 овец, а также на собственном участке Ибадаткан выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 15,000 сом  (KGS). Ибадаткан известна как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. Все накопленные от бизнеса денежные средства, Ибадаткан старается вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства. Однако, в этом году Ибадаткан решила сделать дома ремонт, утеплить его гипсокартоном, поставить пластиковые окна, а также обновить внутреннюю отделку дома, постелив ламинат и поклеив обои. Поэтому Ибадаткан и обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на ремонт, улучшив тем самым благосостояние семьи. В будущем Ибадаткан планирует развивать свое хозяйство, она хочет закупить еще скот.
texts.en: Ibadatkan is 48, married, and has a daughter. She has a secondary education and has been a farmer for many years. She currently has two cows, one calf, 10 sheep, and a plot of land where she grows corn to later sell. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). Ibadatkan is known to be a principled, honest, decent, trustworthy person. She tries to use her revenue to invest in the expansion of her business. This year, however, she is planning to make repairs on her house, insulate it with drywall, put in plastic windows, and update the interior with laminate flooring and wallpaper. Ibadatkan applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to repair her house and improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand her farm and buy more cattle.

loans.use: To repair and insulate her house

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is married and has only one son. She raises pigs in their backyard and sometimes she sells vegetables in their community as an additional source of income. Catalina wants to expand her livelihood and income so she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used in buying necessary hog supplies such as feed, vitamins and vaccines. She believes that through her requested loan amount she could improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary hog supplies such as feed, vitamins and vaccines for raising hogs.

loans.name: Clearejoy

texts.en: Clearejoy has big dreams for her family. She wants to establish a career after finishing college. This drives her to be serious in her studies. Paying in full for her tuition and other school fees would keep her not worried during her examinations for the semester. Her aid from a Student Education Assistance Loan from Paglaum would be of great help in realizing her goals in life, that is, to get her college diploma.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and other school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita, 35-years-old, is married and has four children, she’s been running her hog-raising business for one year and has had vegetables in her backyard for three years. Her income in selling vegetable is not enough to support them and their daily necessities, so Lolita is patiently doing her best in order to raise her hogs healthier. Now she would like to take out for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase stock of hog feed, vitamins and vaccines.She knows that, through this amount of loaned funds, she could further improve the growth of her hogs. Her perseverance in her livelihood made her more productive and helps her to uplift their daily conditions. She is looking forward to lenders helping her to become more profitable in her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of hog feed, vitamins and vaccines to improve the growth of her hogs.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family thanks to her hard work.
Besides the fruit- and vegetable-selling business, she sells fish.

She is asking for a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Ana

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Ana is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Ma. Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Tiormoula  B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe TIORMOULA  B  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à IFOLA un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame NATOGOMA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme TIORMOULA  B. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the TIORMOULA B group are married women and they are, on average, 35 years old with three children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Ifola, a village located in the commune of Farakala, Cercle of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth farming loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Natogoma, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the right.  She is planning to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and to cover the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crops in her village and in Sikasso.  Her customers are both men and women and they pay her in cash or on credit.  She is expecting to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per planting season. Natogoma will use her profit to repay her loan and the interest and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover plowing costs.

loans.name: Vicente Elias

texts.es: Vicente Elias 39 años de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad originario de Chinandega zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y turística, es un microempresario y administrador de un taller de tapicería en el cual realiza todo tipo de trabajos de tapizados como: juegos de salas, vehículos, triciclos, carpas y otros, tambien tiene el alquiler de toldos para toda ocasión, negocio el cual aprende gracias a su hermano mayor y hoy en día tiene ya quince años de dedicarse a este negocio propio, sus compras son al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Vicente se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, poco a poco ha ido incrementando su clientela gracias a la calidad y el buen servicio  que presta a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su calidad de vida aumentando su capital de trabajo y el de ver a sus hijos todos unos profesionales, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materiales y poder armar toldos los que debido a la demanda ha incrementado por el alquiler de los toldos como: tubos, cuerina para tapizar, hilos, pezas entre otros.
texts.en:
Vicente Elias , 39 years old, is married and has two children. He is from Chinandega, a commercial and tourist area. He is a small business owner and manager of an upholstery workshop in which he does all kinds of upholstery work such as living room sets, vehicles, tricycles, canopies, etc. He also rents canopies for all occasions. He learned this business from his older brother, and now he has had his own business for fifteen years. He makes all of his purchases in cash and he has both regular and occasional customers. 
Vicente is known for being hardworking, responsible, and eager to self improvement. He has slowly been growing his clientele through the quality and good service he provides his customers. One of his dreams is to improve his quality of life by increasing his working capital and to see his children become professionals. Because the demand for canopy rentals has increased, the goal of this loan is to invest in working capital by purchasing  materials to build canopies, such as tubes, faux leather upholstery, thread, glues, etc.

loans.use: to buy materials to build canopies, such as tubes, faux leather upholstery, thread, glues, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Margarita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Margarita has been farming sugarcane for five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Nesa

texts.en:
Maria Nesa is 42 years old and has three children who are all in school. Maria Nesa is married.

Maria Nesa is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Maria Nesa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. Maria Nesa has been farming rice for 22 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Nesa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es ingeniero agropecuario, actualmente está estudiando didáctica universitaria con el objetivo de desempeñarse como docente universitario.
Quiere crecer y salir adelante para poder aumentar sus ingresos y así poder mejorar su nivel de vida. Es una persona joven del interior, que lucha por salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y así poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
