Luis is an agricultural engineer, currently studying university teaching with the goal of becoming a college professor.

He wants to grow and thrive so he can increase his income and thereby improve his standard of living. He is a young person at heart who fights to get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to pay his tuition fees, so that he can continue his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: pay college tutition.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es comisionista en una Radio de esa ciudad, vive con su mama y uno de sus tíos. Comenta que está en su primer año de la carrera de administración de empresas, a través de la cual quiere convertirse en un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Comenta que le gustaría poder ser un profesional y por medio de su carrera poder ayudar a su familia. Está pidiendo este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con su meta.
texts.en:
Mario is from the city of San Ignacio, and is a commissioner at a radio station of that city. He lives with his mother and an uncle. He is in his first year of studying business administration, through which he wants to become a professional and be useful to society.
He would like to be a professional and to help his family through his career. He is requesting this loan to invest in paying the fees for the degree, to be able so he can continue with his goal.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Tiormoula  C Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe TIORMOULA  C  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à IFOLA un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame MARIAM ZIE débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme TIORMOULA  C. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the TIORMOULA C group are married women and they are, on average, 37 years old with four children each. Most of them live in traditional families in Ifola, a village located in the commune of Farakala, Cercle of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth farming loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

Mariam Zie, a member of the group, grows groundnut. In the photo, she is the woman in the middle of the standing row.  She is planning to use her loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of fertilizers, one can of herbicide, and to cover the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her crops in her village and in Sikasso. Her customers are both men and women and they pay her in cash or on credit. She is expecting to make an average profit of 73,000 CFA francs per planting season. Mariam Zie will use her profit to repay her loan and the interest and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover plowing costs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Dilijan city with her husband, son and mother-in-law. Susan has a pedagogical education. For many years she worked at the school as a librarian. Now she works in an entirely different field; she has a small café near to the center of city. In her cute café she offers fast-food, juice, fresh drinks and beer. As she says in this summer period, thanks to her city’s magnificent nature and healing fresh air coming from forests and mountains, she has no lack of customers; these are tourists and also citizens of Dilijan, who like to enjoy their time in the evenings in an open air café.
Susan’s husband works as a taxi driver and her son regularly goes to the Russian Federation for work abroad. 
Susan asks for this loan in order to renew the interior of her café ant to make it more attractive and comfortable for her customers.

loans.use: to renew the interior of her café.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 51 years old and she lives in Dilijan city. She is married and she has three children; a son and two daughters. Susan’a husband is a driver. Her son is constructor. This charming lady has a very nice profession; she is a musician and she is a pianist. She graduated Vanadzor Musical College as a pianist. From1984 until now, she has worked at the Dilijan State Art College as a pianist; here she is very respected and beloved pedagogue. 
Susan asks a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to start some repairing work on their house. Susan says that she managed to have some savings together with her husband and they hope that this loan amount, along with their saved money, will be enough to make their house nicer and more comfortable.

loans.use: to start some repairing work on their house.

loans.name: Aleksandra

texts.en: Aleksandra is from the Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She is 29 years old, married and lives with her family; her husband and parents. The only income for the family is from her father's small monthly salary, as he works in a plastic factory. Aleksandra has requested a loan from a local financial institution several times for a business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. Her loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-ups and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the requested loan, Aleksandra will start up a dental clinic locally. She will purchase dental equipment and operative supplies to satisfy the professional needs of the dentists that will be working at her clinic. Aleksandra hopes her business will be profitable because of the price range and well-qualified dentists. This will increase her income and the family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open a dental clinic.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and the mother of two daughters and a son. She works for a gas company. To increase her income, she also sells underwear to her friends and relatives. She buys her products from different cities. With the extra income she earns, she is able to meet her children’s needs easily. She’ll use the loan to buy clothing. When she retires, she would like to open her own shop afterwards.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Emine Hanım evli iki kız ,bir erkek çocuk annesi.  Bir gaz firmasında çalışıyor.  Aynı zamanda daha çok gelir elde etmek için evinde çevresine iç çamaşırı satışı yapıyor.  Ürünlerini çeşitli bölgelerden alıyor.  Kazandığı ek gelir ile çocuklarının ihtiyaçlarını daha rahat karşıladığını belirtiyor.  Aldığı kredi ile çamaşır alacak.  Emekli olduktan sonra kendine dükkan açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married and the mother of six adult children. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor plumbing. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past six years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables to neighbors and passersby. She says that price fluctuations are her biggest challenge, and dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With this loan, she plans to buy bananas, oranges, mangoes, and vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu because it is a source of financial support.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, mangoes, and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Venera

texts.en: Venera lives in Jajur village with her husband and two daughters. She also has a son who is an army officer and works in the Russian Federation. Her family has been engaged in agriculture for many years. They breed cattle and sheep, and also own a vegetable garden where they cultivate corn, barley, potatoes and beets. In order to improve the quality of their agricultural activities and make her land more profitable, Venera wants to buy a new UAZ vehicle. To make this possible, she has applied for a $3,000 loan. Venera's family tries really hard to make ends meet, and thanks Kiva lenders for helping them sustain their agribusiness and grow it further.

loans.use: to buy agricultural machinery (a UAZ vehicle).

loans.name: Maria Animieta

texts.en:
Maria Animieta works hard to support her family. Maria Animieta is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Maria Animieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools and gasoline for her business.

Maria Animieta has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Maria Animieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 21 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of one child. She earns a living by running a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Marilyn has been in her current line of work for one year and also earns additional income from her general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more candies, biscuits, milk, and sugar for a grocery store

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 46 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She has managed a printing shop in her village for the last five years. As a mother, she wants her child to finish college. With that goal in mind, she is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from KIVA and ASKI to pay for tuition for her daughter Emerald Faye. Her daughter is studying for a BS in Accountancy and wants to become a certified public accountant. Gina is hoping for her child's success, and that is why she's working so hard to earn enough income to pay for her education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for her daughter Emerald Faye.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Merlita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina busies herself doing business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing. Supported by her loan, she applied to pay for the labor cost on her house renovation. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record, a matter that she has given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she was thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost on her house renovation

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman is 23 years old and lives in the village Goravan of Ararat region. He is a student of Yerevan State Economical Institute in the school of Accounting and Auditing. He is in his fourth year of studying. He lives with his parents. Arman’s father from time to time goes to Russian Federation and from there supports his family financially. 

Arman, besides his education, has another occupation in which he is engaged very seriously and with great pleasure. With the help of his mother he is busy with grape cultivation. He has a nice vineyard on his own plot of land. He has different sorts of grapes but the world-known grape named kishmish here is the best. As Arman says, the care of his vineyard demands much time and patience: like you take care of a child, grape cultivation demands the same carefulness. You must manage to protect all the harvest from the hail, frostbite, and also from harmful insects. He has a lot of regular customers (re-sellers), who from his house buy a great portion of grapes.

So this loan will be of great use for Arman if he gets it. He plans to use the loan amount for the work of cultivating his beautiful vineyard for the coming season.

loans.use: to work on cultivating his beautiful vineyard

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Michelle requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net and gasoline for her business. Michelle has been in this business for 11 years now.

Michelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is studying his maritime course at Misamis Institute of Technology taking Marine Engineering. 

His parents earn from farming and their income is quite insufficient to cover all the school expenses, for they have a big family of five siblings. His father is a farmer and, to add to their income, his mother decided to work in a private institution. 

He joined GDMPC and has borrowed a loan to help him pay for his uniform. He is hopeful to have have a better education that will help him improve his way of life in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for his school uniform and other needs

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 51-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, son, and parents-in-law in the Gori district. 

Her parents-in-law are provided with a retirement pension. The family has a flat which is rented out, and they get  200 GEL monthly. Nino is unemployed, but she has a great desire to be involved in the trading business. Nino couldn’t request a loan from financial institutions, until the startup program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. She requested a loan of 2,000 USD to begin trading with clothing and bedclothes. 

She plans to go to Turkey and purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and villagers. This will give her a chance to earn income. Nino will provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to begin to sell clothes

loans.name: Dano

texts.en:
Dano makes a living through his retailing business in Oroquieta and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up his membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain access to capital. He wants to increase his inventory. 

Now, Dano has availed himself of a loan to purchase more whole nuts to sell. Dano hopes to sustain his business and dreams to send all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more whole nuts to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe TIESSIRI  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  BOUGOULA -VILLE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  AWA  débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes TIESSIRI, fait la vente de   savon kabakourouni .
Elle achète des matières première au grand marché plus des bois achetés aux environnants de la ville de SIKASSO.
Après cette incorporation des matières premières pour donner un produit fini (KABAKOUROUNI) qui sera livré à la clientèle pour la revendre en détail  à  BOUGOULA -VILLE  à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Tiessiri group are married women and they are, on average, 46 years old with four children each.  Most of them live in traditional families in Bougoula-Ville, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  In order to meet their customers' needs, they are taking their thirteenth solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro-Yiriwaso.

Awa, a member of the group, sells a type of soap called "kabakourouni".  In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the left.  She buys her soap-making supplies at the Grand Market, and also buys wood in the vicinity of Sikasso.

She uses her supplies to make the finished product, "kabakourouni" soap, which is then delivered to her customers and sold on a retail-basis in Bougoula-Ville.  Awa's customers are men and women and they pay her in cash or on credit.  She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, while the rest of the money will be put into savings.

loans.use: to buy soap-making supplies and wood for the fabrication of soap.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene una familia de 5 integrantes, sus padres y 3 hermanos, sus padres son quienes lo ayudan a poder estudiar, ya que él aún no está trabajando.
Está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, ya que por medio de su profesión quiere ser alguien en la vida, para poder ayudar a su familia.
Oscar pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo bien haciendo.
texts.en:
Oscar is from a family of five: his parents and three siblings. His parents help him to be able to study, since he isn't working anymore.
He is studying law, because he wants to be someone in life through his profession, in order to help his family.
Oscar is requesting this loan to invest in paying his tuition in order to be able to continue with his studies. He is doing well.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es estudiante de la carrera de Administración Agropecuaria, actualmente está viviendo en un alquiler, está trabajando, y de esa forma está luchando por poder crecer y mejorar.
Miguel pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de estudios, como ser libros y demás materiales. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Miguel is studying agriculture administration. He is currently renting his home and working. He is working hard to grow and improve.
Miguel is requesting this loan in order to invest it in his study costs, such as books and other materials. He is grateful for this opportunity to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to cover his study costs.

loans.name: 12 De Junio Group

texts.es:
12 de junio es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, una ciudad bastante alejada de la capital del país, que está esforzándose por crecer, ya que es una ciudad eminentemente rural.
La Sra. Nicolasa es una de las integrantes, ella tiene un pequeño negocio de Despensa y también de copetín, ella quiere seguir trabajando y luchando para poder dar a su familia un futuro mejor.
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos ya que le faltan para ampliar su despensa con mayor variedad y para su copetín, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio. Ella quiere comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas, lácteos y demás.
texts.en:
The 12 de Junio group is located in the city of Curuguaty, which is fairly far away from the capital of the country. The city is working hard to grow, as it is a very rural place. 
Nicolasa is one of the group members. She has a small food and drink store. She wants to keep working and fighting to be able to give her family a better future.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of the supplies that she needs to expand her business with a greater variety of products. This way, she will be able to continue expanding her business. She wants to buy fruits, drinks, dairy products, and other items.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, drinks, dairy products and more.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira vive en concubinato y no tiene hijos, ella esta acompañada por sus padres Toda la familia vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Grande Elvira es agricultora y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera. Entre las duras condiciones de vida de Elvira esta que no tiene alcantarillado en su casa y su pareja no pasa mucho tiempo con ella pues se dedica a chofer de transporte de pasajeros, lo cual lo mantiene alejado del hogar Por eso, para fortalecer la independencia de Elvira, es necesario otorgarle este credito que le dará mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en: Elvira has a boyfriend and no children. She lives with her parents. The whole family lives in the community of Chijipina Grande. Elvira is a farmer and needs a loan for the parchase of a dairy cow. Among other elements of her difficult living conditions, she does not have piping leading to a sewage system in her home, and her boyfriend doesn't spend much time with her because he is a public transportation worker, which keeps him away from home. For this reason, in order to strengthen her independence, she needs this loan in order to have better work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama María Auxiliadora están en el 4to. Ciclo, es un grupo emprendedor que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias por medio de su trabajo unido. Es un grupo de la zona rural de Santaní, donde cada una quiere mejorar la ciudad donde están.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Luisa, quien se dedica a la venta de minutas, golosinas y bebidas en su pequeño Kiosko, es muy amable y tiene muchos clientes. Agradece por formar parte del programa de comité, ya que de esa forma podrán ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo ya que a través de él quiere comprar golosinas, bebidas varias, como así también insumos para hacer comestibles para la venta, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called María Auxiliadora and is in its fourth loan cycle. It is an enterprising group of people who want to improve their living conditions and their families' living conditions through working together. This group is located in the rural zone of Santaní,and each of the group members wants to improve their city.
One of the group members is Luisa. She sells cell phone credit, candy, and drinks in her little kiosk. She is very kind and has many clients. She is grateful to be part of this group, since this is how they are able to improve their living conditions.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of candy, varied drinks, and supplies for making food to sell. This way, she will keep doing her work as she has been, working hard to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy candy, varied drinks, and items for making food to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia Monica se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza  y tambien la socia sigue siendo profesora del nivel primario, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Monica continues to manage her business of selling beauty products. She also continues with her job as an elementary school teacher. Monica sells lipsticks, crèmes, and perfumes. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Monica has been in this business for several years. She dreams of having a shop where she can sell beauty products.

Monica is requesting a loan in order to buy crèmes, lipsticks, and perfumes. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Saraswathy Shg - Puthupalayam Group

texts.en:
Thamilselvi is the leader of a Saraswathy Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO, “People’s Action for Transformation” (PAT). 

Thamilselvi is married and is living in Puthupalayam, a small village in Ariyalur District. She is 35 years old and has five children. Her husband is a farmer.

Thamilselvi has recently learned about Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 70%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of poisonous gas.

 Thamilselvi and the other fourteen members are requesting a loan to buy this stove to give a healthier life to their families. They are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 59-year-old widow and blessed with four children who look to her for their daily upkeep and basic needs. She has been running a M-Pesa Agent or local transfer business, and also sells animal feed as a secondary business. She has been doing this for a period of eleven years, earning an income of KSh 35,000 at the end of every month.

Ruth was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and has applied for her first loan of KSh 100,000 and plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase more stock of animal feed to sell to her customers.
 
Ruth plans to use the anticipated income to pay for the school fees for her children, and hopes to become a successful businesswoman in the community.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married and has children who attended school and completed their studies. She raises hogs, which she has been doing for almost 10 years. Her husband is her partner in managing their business. 

Leticia requested a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy piglets and feed for maintenance. Through her earnings from her hogs, she was able to provide for her children's needs. Now that they have finished their studies, her priority is to have savings for the future needs of her and her husband. Leticia hope to expand her business and earn a larger income.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Ma. Desie

texts.en:
Ma. Desie is 60 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She operates a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 30 years.

Ma. Desie requested a loan from NWTF for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nangilmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Nangilmaa, 52 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She began working as packer at a clean water company after retiring from work. Their daughter will graduate from university this year. Her family has a plan of living outside of the city, in the countryside. So she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a traditional Mongolian ger (yurt) and one cow. This will help her family to live in a clean environment with clean air and water. Her husband's health has been deteriorating recently and if they move out to the countryside, it will surely help her husband to get healthy.Her husband is pictured with her.

loans.use: to buy a traditional Mongolian ger and one cow

loans.name: Isabel Reina

texts.es: Doña Isabel tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa, Bárbara. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace tres años vende ropa, camisas, pantalones, blusas etc. y también agrego la venta de plásticos como tinas, panas, vasos, platos, todo en platico. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. Doña Isabel a solicitado varios prestamos para mantener su negocio como la fuente de sus ingresos, actualmente solicita otro por 12,000 Lempiras para surtir de productos plásticos como cubetas, panas, vasos para la venta y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Su propósito es hacer crecer el negocio para poder darles mejor calidad de vida a su familia y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Isabel has always worked in the retail sector. She has been selling clothes such as shirts, trousers, blouses, and other items for three years. Isabel also sells plastic goods such as wash basins, bowls, drinking glasses, plates, and all other types of products. She conducts her business as a street vendor and by taking orders.

Doña Isabel has requested several loans in order to maintain her business since it is her source of income. She is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that she can restock her business with plastic goods such as pails, bowls, and drinking glasses to sell. She will also buy clothing for women, men, and children. Her goal is to grow her business so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family and be able to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy plastic pails, bowls, and drinking glasses to sell, as well as clothing of all types.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Reba

texts.en:
Reba is a 58-year-old widow from Maynaguri. She lost her husband, Prasanta, a few years back. She studied up to grade six. She lives in a small village, Petkati, in Jalpaiguri district with her only son. She could not provide higher education to her son due to their poverty, so now he is engaged in a small business.

Reba's husband used to run a grocery shop. After her husband's death, Reba has been operating the shop. It is adjacent to their house. So, Reba has to work hard to maintain her household work as well as the shop simultaneously. It is the main source of income for the family because Reba's son has no fixed income. 

So, Reba wishes to offer her customers a better variety of products by stocking up her business with grocery items such as rice, edible oil, biscuits, flour, salt, sugar, etc. in order to generate better income for the family. She is very simple and polite, so her customers like her very much. This is the reason she is asking for the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). It will allow her to continue her business and satisfy her customers. 

She is a very hardworking woman and a dreamer; she wishes to grow her business for a secured life. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to expand their business.

loans.name: Sri-Lakshmi Shg - Puthupalayam Group

texts.en:
Vasuki is the featured borrower of a Sri Lakshmi Self-Help Group (SHG). She lives in a small hamlet in a rural area, Puthupalayam, in Ariyalur District. She is married to Mr. Thanabal, and they have two children. They live in a house with a thatched roof. Her husband is a farmer by profession.

They have taken loans from PAT previously to improve their livelihood and repaid the loans on time. The NGO conducts trainings for the members of the group and helps them become independent.

Vasuki and the other nineteen diligent women are also seeking a loan to buy a smokeless stove for their kitchens. This will help Vasuki to have good fresh air in her house in place of the smoke that is emitted from the mud stove they are using. With this stove, they will lead a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Walter Ernesto

texts.es: Walter de 27 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar constituido por 7 personas. Él es un joven emprendedor que gracias a su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y apoya a su familia en lo que puede. Walter desea terminar de construir su vivienda  ya que el piso aun es de tierra por lo que esta solicitando a FUSAI un crédito  para comprar ladrillo de piso, cemento, y arena para terminar de construir el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Walter is 27 years old. He lives with his family group made up of seven persons. He is a young, enterprising man who, thanks to his efforts, is getting ahead, and he supports his family as best as he can.

Walter wants to finish constructing his home since the floor is still dirt, he therefore is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy floor bricks, cement, and sand to finish building the floor of his dwelling as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy floor bricks, cement, and sand to finish building the floor of his dwelling.

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: El grupo “EL RENACER DE CHACRASANA” se encuentra conformada por socias trabajadoras y empeñosas en mejorar su economía familiar. Elba tiene 60 años de edad es casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su mini Marquet en donde ofrece toda variedad de abarrotes bebidas útiles escolares alimentos para animales. El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes bebidas y alimentos para animales. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Elba es la cuarta persona parada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
"El Renacer de Chacrasana" group is made up of members who are hard-working and diligent about improving their household economies.

Elba is 60 years old. She is married with 3 dependent children. She implemented her mini-market where she offers a whole variety of groceries, drinks, school supplies, and food for animals. She invested the loan in the purchase of groceries, drinks, and food for animals.

The  group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan provided. Elba is the person standing fourth from the left side.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, drinks, and animal feed.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine, 64 years old, lives in Yerevan. She has already repaid her Kiva loan successfully according to schedule, and she has a great desire to have a second deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon. Karine is a widow who now lives with her younger daughter. Her elder daughter got married and lives with her lovely family. 

Karine has an advanced degree and now works at the Language Teaching Center as chief accountant; she simultaneously runs the accountancy of several private companies. She says she would provide her small family with the best living conditions, if there would not be her younger daughter’s health problems; she has some visual problems, which need permanent medical examinations and treatments. So Karine’s expenses are many and she is not able to put aside some savings. 

Karine will be grateful to get this loan, in order finally to solve her dental problems and to have some course of treatment connected with it. She has had this problem for a long time, but has postponed treating it each time because of lack of money.

loans.use: to solve her dental problems and to have some course of treatment connected with it

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet's goal is to earn a higher income than usual in order to meet all of her children's needs in school. She just wishes to maintain her good health to obtain her goal. Juliet, 33 years old, is married and has three children in school. She is engaged in a hog raising business in her village. Juliet shares that she didn’t give enough feed to maintain her hogs due to financial constraints. In this regard, Juliet is asking for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. Juliet believes that this loan will give her enough feed for her hogs to help them grow faster and be sold for a higher amount.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant coffee

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in the village of Amasia with her husband and 18-year-old daughter. Karine works in a statistical organization. Because of the scarcity of financial resources Karine has always been forced to look for other revenue sources. 

Jointly with her family members, she has been engaged in animal husbandry and farming for many years. In particular, they keep cattle and hens and also own an orchard. Karine has decided to expand her family's agribusiness by buying two cows and animal feed. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of USD 2,200. Karine and her family really need support to realize their goals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (two cows) and animal feed

loans.name: Barize

texts.en:
Barize has been photographed with her two cows. 

Barize is the mother of a 25-year-old child who is working currently for cash; he lives with his parents just like many grownups still do in rural families. Barize has always been doing agriculture/livestock to earn a living. She has cows, calves and a mule for transportation and she sells the raw milk to some nearby dairy farms;almost every household in the region of Korca keeps a mule or horse for transportation. Barize also plants seasonal veggies and crops mostly, and at the moment she needs some pesticides for them. Although planting is practiced here, livestock (goats, sheep and cows) is more.

Barize’s village dates back to the 1920's and is characterized with cobblestone streets and five Greek Orthodox churches.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her plants

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia está trabajando y estudiando, trata siempre de poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de día a día. Comenta que su mayor sueño es poder ser un profesional y el día de mañana ser alguien útil para su familia y la sociedad.
Está estudiando la carrera de Administración agropecuaria, y comenta que le apasiona mucho su carrera y que por eso la está estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir los gastos de la universidad y seguir con su meta.
texts.en:
Patricia both works and studies, and she tries to be able to help her parents with everyday expenses. She says that her dream is to have a profession and to become someone who will be useful both to her family and society.

She is studying agriculture and livestock management in college and she says she is passionate about her major, which is why she chose it. She is asking for this loan in order to pay her tuition, which will allow her to cover the costs of her education and continue working towards her goals.

loans.use: pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Victoria Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Victoria Bertha se dedica al negocio de  hospedaje, la socia por medio  de este negocio quieren salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de hospedaje. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar camas y sabanas para el hospedaje.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria Bertha continues to manage her lodging business. Through this business, she wants to be able to get ahead. Her dream is to expand her lodging business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy beds and linens for the lodge.

Victoria Bertha is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy beds and linens for her lodge.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 27 years old, is married and has two children. She has been farming sugarcane in the Philippines for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ruth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Njira

texts.en: Njira is a married woman with three children who are still underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Njira has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge. Njira wants to use this loan to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, 42 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, Janet has operated a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more spare parts for her tricycle. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en: Ma. Isabel, 29 years old, spends her time retailing grocery items near her town. She is married and has two children. Ma. Isabel sells drinks, powdered coffee, detergents, bar soap and powdered soap. Her regular customers are employees of their local government unit. Ma. Isabel needs additional capital to have more grocery stock to sell. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more grocery items such as condiments, spices, noodles, shampoo and toothpaste. Ma. Isabel hope to meet her customers’ needs so that she will retain and encourage more customers.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items such as condiments, spices, noodles, shampoo and toothpaste.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en: Camilo learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. As a farmer in Pines, Oroquieta, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump-start his farming activities. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Camilo feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. He wishes to sustain his business and be able to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Merry Ann

texts.en: Merry Ann is widow who runs an entertainment business in order to make a living. Over the past five years, she has increased her income and improved her services. Merry Ann recently joined GDMPC and has borrowed her first loan to cover the maintenance costs for her video-k unit. She plans to raise livestock such as goats to have another source of income in the future.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs for her video-k unit

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 36 years. Veronica has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. Veronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is 48, an energetic, enthusiastic and optimistic woman. She is from the remote village of Shahidgarh in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Mrityunjoy, who is 53 years old and has an education up to ninth standard. Sabita studied until grade five. She, together with her husband, is raising one son. They could not give proper education to their son because of their poor economic resources. He received only elementary education.

Sabita's son and her husband both are drivers. Their income is inconsistent. Their earnings are unable to cover the basic needs of the family. So, to give wellbeing to her family, Sabita has decided to do a business with consistent income. She is an enterprising woman who wants to do a business of selling Ayurveda medicine (medicine made from medicinal plants and herbs). She thinks it is a profitable business. She learned about Ayurveda medicine from her father, who also dealt in Ayurvedic medicines.

She is requesting the loan from BJS to purchase medicines from the medicine wholesalers, to start the business initially from her house. With the development of the business, she hopes to rent a shop in the local market. She hopes the loan will enable her to fulfill her dream. 

Her dream is to expand her business in order to overcome the financial hurdles that they are now facing.

She is really grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase Ayurveda medicines (medicine made from different medicinal herbs) to start a business.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes' husband is a seaman. She receives a monthly remittance from him as a support for her and her two children's daily needs. In her desire to help her husband even in a simple way, Mercedes runs a snack foods business. She serves noodles, burgers, french fries and shanghai and sizzling noodles. Her customers like her snack foods because she cooks them deliciously. Mercedes wants to have a better stock of raw ingredients for her business so that she always has the food to serve when she gets orders. Mercedes is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy buns, hot dogs, noodles, meat and other ingredients for her business. Mercedes wishes to expand the business and have another business for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy buns, hot dogs, noodles, meat and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Elpidio

texts.en: Elpidio is from Oroquieta. He is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. He hopes to live comfortably. He has applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for a decent house. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that Elpidio has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what he is thankful for, that all his financing needs of his retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for his house.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino, 41 years old, lives with her husband and 3 daughters (3, 9 and 10 years old) in a small village in the Gurjaani district, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. Nino's only source of income is the money from agricultural activities. Nino and her husband work hard on family-owned agricultural land, where they grow vegetables and sell the harvest seasonally. Nino looks after her daughters and stays home, but she has a great desire to be involved in a sales business.

Until the Start Up program, a joint product of Kiva and Credo, Nino couldn’t receive a loan from local financial institutions because of their requirements for business experience or stable revenue. The program allows rural impoverished people like Nino to get a chance to start or re-start a business. Nino requested a loan of 1,000 GEL to begin selling clothing and bed clothing. She plans to purchase at wholesale prices, then resell among her friends and villagers at higher prices. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Thanks to the Start Up program, Nino will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her 3 daughters.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant coffee

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood to sell to furniture makers and house builders.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. She is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia  con su esposa, el cliente posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, adicional a eso también tiene  un taller de estructuras metálicas, tiene mucha clientela y con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar,  Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, jugos, café, pan, detergente, embutidos, etc.  y surtir mas su negocio y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Pedro is 64 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. He has a small store that is located in his house. In addition, Pedro manages a metal shop and has many customers. With the income he generates from his work, he is able to cover some of the household necessities.

Pedro is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, oil, juices, coffee, bread, detergents, cured meats, and other products so that he can restock his business. This will enable him to provide a better quality of life for his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, juices, coffee, bread, detergents, cured meats, and other products.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in the village of Khashtarak with her husband, mother and three children (2 sons and 1 daughter). She is self-employed. The family has been running a farm for many years. They cultivate corn and wheat, and own an orchard where they grow plums, apples, pears, figs, and persimmons. The family is also engaged in animal husbandry. They keep cattle, pigs and hens. 

In order to sustain her family's agribusiness and expand it, Narine wants to make some investments. She has taken a loan from a financial institution before but, because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to repay it. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her agribusiness, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Narine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. The requested amount will be used to to purchase 1 pig, 40 liters of fuel, and 20 bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase one pig, 40 liters of fuel and 20 bags of animal feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 46 years old, is married to Peter and they are blessed with five children. Beatrice has been a farmer for a period of ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Peter provides an additional income for their family.
 
Beatrice is now servicing her third loan of KES 60,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use this amount to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and to buy more land for farming. Beatrice hopes to become a successful businesswoman in her community.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.name: Rosta

texts.pt:
A dona Rosta é comerciante, tem 49 anos de casada mãe de 8 filhos destes 2 ja maiores de idade e 5 estudam, 1 ainda menor. Além dos filhos sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela.
Com o valor deste credito irá comprar alguidares, loiça diversa, e produtos de 1 necessidade para revender
Tem como plano para o futuro fazer aviários para criação de pintos na sua e fazer dependências para arrendar como forma de reforçar a renda par o sustento familiar uma vez que tem o seu esposo doente .
Diz que gosta do tratamento que a Hluvuku oferece pela flexibilidade na concessão de crédito e uma vez que ela depende de negócio permite ter emprestimo com urgência.
texts.en:
Ms Rosta is a trader, 49 years old, married and the mother of 8 children. 2 are already of age and 5 are studying, 1 is still a minor. Aside from her children she also supports 2 grandchildren who live with her.

With this loan she plans to buy basins, various dishes and essential products for resale.

In future, she plans to build aviaries to raise chickens and also to build houses for renting out as a way to reinforce her income to support her family, given that her husband is ill.

She says that she likes the treatment Hluvuku has offered her because of the flexibility of the loan and as she depends entirely on her business, this allows her to obtain the loan quickly.

loans.use: buy basins, various dishes and essential products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (sand, bricks, beams, sheets of zinc, cement and to pay for labour) so that he can continue the building works on his home.

loans.name: Diosa Eliceth

texts.es: Diosa, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de San Antonio de Cortes. Ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería desde hace 10 años,  donde vende granos básicos, manteca, azúcar, pastas, condimentos, churros, refrescos, dulces, pan, verduras, carnes etc. Ha solicitado un tercer ciclo de préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para surtir con más productos, va comprar azúcar, arroz, carenes, manteca, frijoles, refrescos, churros, harina, productos de aseo etc. Su plan es mantener surtido para satisfacer al cliente y con las ganancias mejorar el local del negocio.
texts.en: Diosa is 45 years old and is married. She has two sons and lives in the town of San Antonio de Cortes. She has had her own grocery store for 10 years, where she sells grains, butter, sugar, pasta, condiments, churros, soft drinks, candy, bread, vegetables, meat, etc. She has requested a third loan for 15,000 Honduran Lempiras to supply her store with more products. She will buy sugar, rice, meat, butter, beans, soft drinks, churros, flour, cleaning products, etc. Her plan is to maintain her store well stocked to satisfy her customers and to improve the store with her profits.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, meat, butter, beans, soft drinks, churros, flour, cleaning products, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora es viuda desde hace 10 años y tiene 3 hijos Ella viva en la comunidad de Copajira en una casa de adobe  que tiene luz y agua pero no alcantarillado. Isidora se gana la vida como agricultora y necesita un credito para comprar una vaca lechera que le ayude a aumentar su  producción. Isidora es el unico sustento de su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Isidora has been widowed for 10 years and has 3 children. She lives in the community of Copajira in an adobe house that has running water and electricity, but no sewage services.

Isidora earns her living as a farmer and needs a loan in order to buy a dairy cow, which will help to increase her production. She is the only one who is sustaining her household, so Isidora is need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es un hombre trabajador, tiene 38 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a la agricultura, el principal producto cultivado es el pallar. Le va muy bien porque es una persona trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable y sobre todo porque tiene mucha experiencia con el cultivo de pallar y por lo tanto ofrece productos de excelente calidad a un precio acorde a las necesidades de los clientes
Edgar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá cubrir los costos de riego, abonamiento de sus cultivos, y mantenimiento en general. De esta manera ofrecerá productos de mejor calidad y así obtendrá mayores ingresos con los que remodelará su vivienda y podrá brindar a su hijo una buena educación y un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Edgar is a hardworking 38-year old man who lives with his family in Ica.  He has been a farmer for more than 5 years.  His main product is lima beans.  His business is doing very well because he is a hardworking, enterprising, and responsible person who, most importantly, has a lot of experience in cultivation lima beans.  As a result, he is able to offer excellent quality products at a price that meets the needs of his customers.

Edgar is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they are providing, he will be able to cover the cost to irrigate and fertilize his crops, and to do general maintenance work in the fields.  In this way, he will be able to offer better quality products and increase his income, so that he can remodel his home and provide his son with a good education and a better future.

loans.use: to pay to irrigate, fertilize, and maintain his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 38 years of age, married to a bus driver assistant, and they're blessed with four children. 

Aside from being a mother to her four children, Mylene also has been managing a food vending business for almost six months and earning a net income of PHP 150 daily. 

Due to insufficient income from her business, she wanted to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to pay for the tuition fees and for the allowances of Christel Joy, her daughter, who is taking up BS Information Technology, because she would like to become a successful employee in a big company.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees and for the allowances of Christel Joy.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: Don Luis, tiene 52 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos con su esposa, con quien vive en una aldea de la comunidad de Gualala, Santa Bárbara, cerca a Peña Blanca. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando granos básicos, últimamente ha cultivado café donde obtiene mejores ingresos, esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 3,300 lempiras para comprar insumos como fertilizantes para darle asistencia a su finca de café. Su plan es aumentar la cosecha y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis is 52 years old; he is married and has 3 children with his spouse. He lives in a house in the community of Gualala, Santa Bárbara, close to Peña Blanca. He has always been involved in farming, cultivating basic grains. Recently he has grown coffee where he is making better income. He sells his product in the area’s local market.

The loan he is requesting is the third cycle and it is for 3,300 lempiras (Honduras’s currency) to buy consumables like fertilizers to help his coffee field. His plan is to increase his harvest and to move his family forward in life.

loans.use: to buy consumables like fertilizers to help his coffee field

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 33 years old and married, with two children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, and detergent soap.

Nenita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and electronic mobile load retailing.

Nenita aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, noodles, and detergent soap.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes. Hace 15 años esta cultivando cacao de donde saca sus propios ingresos. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 23,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su finca de cacao y mejorar la cosecha. Su plan es seguir trabajando para darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Julio is 30 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner with whom he has 3 children. He resides in the town of Omoa, Cortes. He has been growing cacao for 15 years, which is how he earns an income. He has decided to ask for a loan of 23,000 lempiras to buy manure and fertilizers to help maintain his cacao farm and to improve the harvest. His plan is to keep working to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to help maintain his cacao farm and to improve the harvest.

loans.name: Butter Fly1 Group

texts.en:
Jennifer is the featured borrower of Butter fly1 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from KIva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines seeking a business with better income to support their families.

Jennifer is a 39-year-old married mother of one who works as a housekeeper in order to financially support her family back in the Philippines. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for necessary expenses for her family members in the Philippines. 

She is the first lady standing at the far right side of the picture. As for the other members, Mylene is the lady at the center of the picture, while Nancy  is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for necessary expenses for her family members in the Philippines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to her corn crop.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en:
Dionicia is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Her spouse gains income through a farming business, while she operates a store selling grocery items to the people in her village. Together they raise their children to be responsible and thrifty. 

Now, she is sending Rodesa, her child, into college. Rodesa is taking up Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. In order to pay her tuition fees, Dionicia is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. With the help of this loan, she will send and provide a good education for her child so she will earn a degree. Dionicia will be happy to see all her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her child

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy printers and cartridges

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame CHATA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 98 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 1 are married women who average 43 years of age and 4 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in KOUOROBARAGE, a village located in the commune of the KOUORO in the SIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 4th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. CHATA grows rice. She is the member standing in the center in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two jugs of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Chata expects to earn an average profit of 98,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and its interest, and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Josy Group

texts.en:
Belen is the featured borrower of Josy Group. She joined along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines seeking a better income business to support their families. Belen is a 50-year-old, widowed mother of four, who works as a housekeeper in order to financially support her children back in the Philippines since her beloved husband passed away.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy special Brazilian silver and gold to trade with to support her beloved family members back in the Philippines, and will send part of the loan to her children to cover some necessary needs. Belen is the first lady standing at the far left side of the picture. As for the other members, Josie is the second from the left, Odette is the second from the right and Lorna is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy special Brazilian silver and gold to trade with to support her beloved family members back in Philippines.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame DJATOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 98 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women who average 50 years of age and 6 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in KOUOROBARAGE, a village located in the commune of the KOUORO in the SIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 4th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. DJATOU grows rice. She is the member standing second from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two jugs of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Djatou expects to earn an average profit of 98,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and its interest, and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona is 39 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with four children, aged between 20 years and 8 years.

Lona operates a retail shop, a business she has done for the past eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase a retail stock of household items to sell to her customers.

With the profits from the loan, Lona will be able to boost her business. Her desire is to uplift her family.

loans.use: to add stock to her retail shop

loans.name: Maridel

texts.en:
Maridel is 39 years old, married, and has eight children. Her spouse is a carpenter. Despite having many children, the couple still wants to send them to school to finish a degree course. 

Maridel is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay the tuition fees and allowance of her son. This loan will help provide a good education to her son, Christian, a first year college student taking the Bachelor of Science in Chemistry. Her son wants to finish his education and gain good employment someday to help his parents in return.

loans.use: to pay thetuition fees and allowance of her child

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en: Nasira is a 44-year-old married woman. For the past 12 years she has been running a business selling crockery. She purchases crockery wholesale and sells it in her shop. The crockery business has provided her with enough income to lead a decent life. She is very dedicated to her family and wants to provide them with a beautiful life. She is in her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more dinner sets, tea sets and bowls. She wants to grow her business which will eventually help her to afford a better life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more dinner sets, tea sets and bowls.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'TORLA un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame SAFOURA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 1 are married women who average 38 years of age and 5 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in N’TORLA, a village located in the commune of the Kolokoba in the SIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 7th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.
  
Mrs. SAFOURA grows groundnuts. She is the member standing second from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and three jugs of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.75 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Safoura expects to earn an average profit of 105,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and its interest, and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Dúo Roca Eterna Group

texts.es:
Duo Roca Eterna 
Sonia es casada, tiene 4 hijos de edades ( 3, 5, 11, 8) de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela cerca de su comunidad ubicada en Barcenas Villa Nueva, inicio su negocio hace 12 años el cual es venta de articulos de belleza por catalogo(cosmeticos) y trastes, se siente muy bendecida y agradecida por que gracias a este trabajo puede ocuparse de su familia, y asi no descuidar a sus hijos, solicita el credito para poder comprar su mercaderia al contado ya que su proveedor le da credito pero las ganancias disminuyen, y es por eso que ella quiere trabajar con el producto al contado para obtener mejores ingresos y asi seguir apoyando a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar, ahnela tener un local para no seguir vendiendo ambulante,de antemano gracias por su ayuda.
texts.en:
Duo Roca Eterna 
Sonia is married, has four children (ages 3,5,11, 8) of whom two attend school close to their community located in Barcenas Villa Nueva. She began her business 12 years ago, which is selling beauty products from cosmetics catalogs and kitchen utensils. She feels very blessed and thankful because, thanks to this job, she can care for her family and not neglect her children. She is requesting the loan to be able to buy her merchandise with cash since her supplier gave her credit but the earnings have decreased and that is why she wants to work with product to obtain better cash income and thus keep supporting her husband with the home income. She dreams of having a shop so she doesn't have to keep selling on foot. She is thankful for your support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements to improve his family's quality of life and security

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 31 years and married to James. Together they have been blessed with two children, both younger than 8 years old. James helps provide additional income for his family.

Caroline operates a retail shop where she sells cereal as well as soft drinks to her customers.She has  been in business for the past 14 years.

Caroline has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to buy bags of maize and crates of soda for resale.This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous one.

Caroline's desire is to be self reliant financially and to educate her children for life.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and crates of soda to sell.

loans.name: Rwengwara Farmers' Group

texts.en:
Pascal lives in Fort Portal, Uganda and is a member of Rwengwara Farmers' Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan. He is an active farmer growing food crops like beans, cassava, sweet potatoes and matooke. He is facing challenges of weather changes, pests, and diseases. However, he has a vision of expanding his gardens to increase on his yields and sales, plus becoming a model farmer. Pascal needs a loan to pay workers, and to buy bean seeds for planting.

The photo has more than 10 members, who are all group members and have guaranteed each other, but only 10 have taken the loan.

loans.use: to pay workers, and buy bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 41-year-old married mother of four. For the past 10 years, she has been providing tailoring services in her locality. Her skill of stitching neatly is in high demand among the women of her area. She and her husband play an equally important role in providing for the family. She is on her fifth loan and has requested an amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to purchase thread, needles, measuring scales etc. to meet the increasing customer demand. She is a hard-working woman and hopes to expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, measuring scales etc.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 43-year-old happily married woman with four children to take care of. To meet the expenses of her household, she opened a beauty parlor a few years ago. The parlor business has worked out well for her and has paid for her children’s education expenses. To meet the increasing demand of clients she needs to buy hair care products, gels, hair styling products, bleaching products, facial products etc. She is on her fifth loan and has requested an amount of 40,000 PKR. She believes that this loan will enable her to cater to more customers in future.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, gels, hair styling products, bleaching products, facial products etc.

loans.name: Kikweete Mixed Farmers Group

texts.en:
Julius is a married man with three children who lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. 

He is a peasant growing traditional crops like millet, sorghum, rice, and groundnuts in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He is also operating a retail shop, selling beer, sugar, and salt, which he started with capital from the proceeds of his crops. Julius needs the loan to buy beer, soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

He has been a member of a village group where members save and guarantee one another to get a loan facility. He experiences low capital to buy his products accompanied by price changes and his vision is to be economically well off with proceeds from his business and farming.

loans.use: to buy beer, soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single man who has been working as a cashier in a restaurant since 2007. He is a hard worker who puts much effort toward developing himself in a well-managed way to reach a better level in his domain.
Mahmoud is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to register his house legally to settle every issue related to it.
He hopes that one day he can open his own business and develop it for a better future.

loans.use: To register his house legally to settle every issue related to it

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'TORLA un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
