Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame  ABY KASSOULY débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women who average 38 years of age and 4 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in N’TORLA, a village located in the commune of the Kolokoba in the SIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 7th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. ABY KASSOULY grows groundnuts. She is the member standing second from the right in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Aby Kassouly expects to earn an average profit of 74,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and its interest, and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 42 years old and married to Virginia who earns income. They are blessed with two children. Paul has been running a capsicum (peppers) and vegetables business for a period of 10 years earning an income of KES.8,000 every month.

Paul has applied for his fourth loan of KES.50,000 from VisionFund Kenya and plans to use the entire amount to build a permanent grocery stall and add more stock.

Paul plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and buy land and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To build a permanent grocery stall in the town market.

loans.name: Leidy Catalina

texts.es:
Al hablar de Leidy no podemos obviar que es una mujer formada con los hermosos valores que caracterizan a las mujeres pujantes y emprendedoras de Colombia. 
Leidy no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como empleada en tiendas de barrio, decide montar su propio negocio que consistirá en una tienda de abarrotes en el municipio de La Dorada, es una oportunidad para salir adelante y tener un futuro más prospero y aunque es soltera sueña con tener una familia y brindarles lo mejor.
Leidy solicita un crédito para la compra de una vitrina, estanterías, una nevera y surtido de productos de la canasta familiar para su tienda, básicamente grano y abarrotes, snacks y dulces, con estos elementos podrá iniciar con su proyecto y montara la tienda en un espacio que tiene en su casa.
Sueña con tener un negocio muy reconocido en el sector y tener muchos clientes.
texts.en:
When speaking about Leidy, one cannot ignore that she is a woman of the beautiful values that characterize the thriving and enterprising women of Colombia. Leidy is not satisfied with the income she earns as a clerk in a neighborhood store so she decided to start her own grocery store business in the town of La Dorada. It is an opportunity to get ahead and have a more prosperous future. Although she is single, she dreams of having a family and giving them the best.

Leidy is requesting a loan to purchase a cabinet, shelves, refrigerator, and a product range to stock her store with staple goods and groceries, snacks, and sweets, to make a store in the space she has in her home. 

She dreams of having a recognized business in the area and to have many customers.

loans.use: to purchase a cabinet, shelves, a refrigerator, and stock to start her own store

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 33-year-old mother of six children. She is very hard working. To provide for her family, she and her husband opened a general store. With the income from this store, Kalsoom has been able to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. With this loan she wants to buy thread, beauty products, and grocery items such as oil, grains and spices to meet the increasing demand in her store. She has high hopes of rising income which she wants to spend for the health and education of her children.

loans.use: to buy thread, beauty products, and grocery items such as oil, grains and spices.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en: Samreen is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a very dedicated mother who wants to provide all sorts of comforts for her children. Samreen has been buying and selling cattle for the past 10 years. This business has enabled her to bear the expenses of her family. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR, her second loan from Kiva. With this loan amount she intends to purchase more cattle for resale. She believes that this loan will help her expand her trade and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Miriam Beatriz Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Miriam Beatriz, originaria del Municipio de  San Juan Sacatepéquez, de 33 años de edad,  casada y madre dos niños en edades de 7 y 5 años. Doña Miriam se dedica a la  elaboración de perfumes, cremas, y talcos,  como también en la venta de herméticos de cocina, desde ya hace 5 años. Doña Miriam aprendió este oficio con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabajo varios años  en una  fábrica de perfumes, ahora esto ha sido su actividad de ingreso con el cual también se ha dado a conocer a varias personas que visitan su casa en busca de estos artículos que ella proporciona. Ahora requiere de capital para la compra de esencia pura, entre otros componentes para la perfumería. El deseo de doña Miriam es seguir atendiendo a sus hijos y seguir manteniendo su clientela y seguir teniendo un beneficio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Miriam Beatriz, originally from the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez is 33 years old, married and mother to a 7 and a 5 year old. 

For 5 years Mrs. Miriam has been making perfumes, creams, powders, and also selling food storage containers. Mrs. Miriam learned this trade with the help of her husband who worked for a perfume factory for various years.

Currently, this is her main source of income and she has become known to various people who visit her house looking for the articles that she provides. 

She needs a loan to buy pure essence amongst other perfume components. Mrs. Miriam’s dream is to continue attending to her children and continue maintaining her clientele while still having a profit.

loans.use: to buy materials to make perfumes  to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame LEGUERE assise à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 98 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 3 are married women who average 40 years of age and 4 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in KOUOROBARAGE, a village located in the commune of KOUORO in the SIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 4th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. LEGUERE grows rice. She is the member sitting at the far left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two jugs of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Leguere expects to earn an average profit of 98,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and its interest, and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Njara Blessed Group

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking lady with five children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She used the previous loan to buy chicks for rearing. Still with poultry, rental houses, banana plantations and zero grazing businesses, she has managed to look after her family and provide them with the basic needs. She faces a challenge of high cost of feeds, but is determined to fulfill her dream of expanding her poultry project. Mary intends to use this loan to buy more chicks for rearing. She is a member of the above-mentioned group, where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

The photo has more people who are all group members, and have guaranteed each other whether taking a loan or not.

loans.use: to buy chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She is on her third loan. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, grains, sugar, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, grains, sugar, biscuits and beverages .

loans.name: Luciano Alfredo

texts.es:
Luciano, luego de trabajar mucho tiempo en el campo realizando trabajos de agricultura, decidió desplazarse hasta la ciudad de Medellín hace 12 años para buscar oportunidades de salir adelante. Fue así como inicio con un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en un puesto ubicado en la calle.
Es una actividad que viene realizando de manera ambulante y todos los días de la semana. Este oficio se lo enseño un amigo y desde ese momento esta actividad se convirtió en su principal fuente de ingresos.
El sueña con poder dejar de trabajar de manera ambulante y tener un local donde pueda exhibir y vender sus productos.
Solicita un auxilio económico para comprar un amplio surtido de frutas y verduras que le permitirán tener un nivel más elevado de ventas.
Con el crédito podrá crecer su negocio y darle un impulso importante para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Luciano, after working for a long time in the countryside performing farming work, decided to move to the city of Medellin 12 years ago to look for opportunities to get ahead. It was this way that he started his business selling fruits and vegetables from a stall located on the street. It is work he does on foot, every day of the week. A friend taught him this work and, from that moment, this work has become his main source of income.

He dreams of being able to stop working on foot and have a shop where he can display and sell his products. He is requesting economic assistance to buy a big stock of fruit and vegetables that will allow him to have a higher level of sales. With the loan, he will be able to grow his business and give him a major boost to keep working.

loans.use: to buy stock for his business like fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en: Hina is 25 years old, married and has two children. With her husband's meager salary it was difficult for Hina to pay the food, health and clothing expenses of her family. As a result, a few years ago she started a cloth trading business. She bought good quality cloth from wholesale markets and sold it in her own town. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers.  She is on her fourth loan and needs to borrow 40,000 PKR to purchase cloth in various varieties for resale. She is hopeful that this loan will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth in various varieties .

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 55-year-old, hardworking woman who has five children. For the last two years, she has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Safia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. In her sixth loan cycle, Safia has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces. Safia is very thankful for her previous loans, and hopes that this loan will further support her financially.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and blankets.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for nine years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.  She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, trays of eggs and beef. She works at the market six days every week, and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and   transportation.  She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler, and also to own a fully stocked restaurant. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted to acquire additional capital. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, cooking oil, beef, and trays of eggs.

loans.name: Jetrida

texts.en: Jetrida is a 26-year-old, married woman, with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. For fourteen years Jetrida has been making sweaters, from which she makes profits and earns a living. She is a hardworking woman who dreams of expanding her business and creating jobs for others. She is faced with a challenge of competition and seasonal customers, because her sales are high during the school terms.  She tries her best to make good quality products to fit the available market. Jetrida needs a loan to buy threads to make sweaters to sell.

loans.use: to buy threads to make sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'TORLA un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame NAMARY débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 2 are married women who average 39 years of age and 4 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in N’TORLA, a village located in the commune of KOLOKOBA in the SIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 7th loan cycle with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. NAMARY grows groundnuts. She is the member standing second from the right in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and one jug of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.5 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Namary expects to earn an average profit of 74,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and its interest, and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is 29 years old.  She is married and has two children, ages 10 and 4. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Meena plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
 
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her store.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 47-year-old married father of two children who has been a hair dresser since 1987. He is well known in his region for his good reputation and the customer care he provides.

Robert is an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner borrower and his previous loans supported him in improving his social and financial situation. That is why he is requesting another loan, this time to pay for his children's school expenses. His business is going just fine, but unfortunately it does not cover urgent issues that come up suddenly and he has to cover them through this loan.

Robert is a good-standing borrower and a hard worker. He hopes to expand his business through diversifying his beauty care options and adding other requested services.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is a 35-year-old single lady who has been blessed with three children.  She has been operating a tailoring and dress-making business for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Florah is now servicing her third loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use it to buy more different designs of material to stock to her shop. Florah plans to use the anticipated income as a result of this loan to educate her children and buy another sewing machine. She hopes to start a fashion and design college to empower the young people in her community in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more different designs of material to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Venesio

texts.en: Venesio is a 35-year-old, married man with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a transport business using a motor vehicle since 2000, and he supplements his business with farming to get additional income. Venesio dreams of buying land to build a good house for his children. He is a hardworking man, who faces challenges of high costs of fuel and accidents on the road. He intends to use the loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Xecotache Group

texts.en:
The ten entrepreneurial women of the Xecotache goup live in the small community of Chuisanto Tomas in the Suchitepéquez Department of Guatemala. They name of their group is the local K’iche word for “under the trees”, a word often used to describe their area.  All of the women in the group work in the production and sales of Mayan blouses and skirts. They are looking forward eagerly to working with Namaste where they will receive financial literacy training, and also a business adviser who will help each of them write a business plan and then work with them monthly to follow the plan and grow their business.
One member of this group is Juana (second from left) who is 26 years old and has gone to school through the third grade.  She is married with four children (ages 9, 6, 4 and 1).  The two older children attend school.  Her husband works at the community health center and helps her support the family economically. Her business is sewing and selling the traditional skirts and blouses that are worn by the women in her area.  Some of her customers order specific items and she sells the rest door to door.  Her first language is K’iche but she also speaks Spanish. She very much enjoys being a businesswoman and speaking the two languages is an advantage to her in her business.  Her goal is to learn as much as she can during her time working with Namaste so that she can improve her business. She dreams of increasing her profits enough so that all of her children can stay in school and get an education. And she herself would like to go back to primary school and take up her education where she had to leave it years ago.
Juana will be using her loan money to buy more fabric so she can produce more clothing to meet her clients’ demands.  Her current monthly profit is 400 Guatemalan Quetzales and she is projecting a 65% increase by the end of the nine-month loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy more fabric so she can produce more clothing to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a 29-year-old woman, who is married and has four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Salima operates a retail shop selling general merchandise. She also does farming as an additional source of income. Salima is a hardworking woman who fights hard to see continuity in her business, despite the challenges of high government taxes and limited capital.

Salima is requesting a loan to buy soap, sugar, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Narmila

texts.en:
Narmila is 35 years-old.  She is married and has two children, ages 14 and 9.  Many years ago, Narmila established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

Narmila has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and she used her most recent loan to buy grocery good for her business.  In the future, she plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to stock her store

loans.name: Rachana

texts.en: Rachana is 23 years old.  She is married and has no children.  Many years ago, she established her goat raising business.  Working seven days a week, and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy baby goats.  In the future, Rachana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats for her business.

loans.name: Belise

texts.en: Belise is 22 years old. She is a single fourth-year student. With this loan, Belise would like to pay for her tuition fees to complete her studies without any other setbacks. She is very visionary young lady with an aim of scoring a first-class grade upon her graduation.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Fahmeeda

texts.en: Fahmeeda is a 33-year-old, vigorous married lady, who has four children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, and packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 49-year-old married woman. She has three children and her husband used to be the only earner in the family. In order to assist her husband in taking care of their family, Nasreen began her business of cloth selling. She purchased cloth from wholesalers and sold it in her town. Now she is playing a vital role in providing for her family. 

Nasreen is currently in her eighth loan cycle and has requested a new loan of 45,000 PKR. With this loan she intends to buy more cloth in greater variety. She is hopeful that her business will prosper and generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cloth in greater variety.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à N'TORLA un village dans la commune de KOLOKOBA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame DIARA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The ten members of the BENKADI 4 group are married women, who are on average 33 years old and have on average 3 children, and who live for the most part in traditional families in N'TORLA, a village in the KOLOKOBA commune in the SIKASSO circle, the third administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans were properly repaid. The crops grown are peanuts with Mrs. DIARA, standing second from the left in the photo in this women’s group BENKADI 4. With this loan, she plans to buy 2 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 1 container of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 74,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic goods

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, age 20, is married and has two children, one of whom is attending school. Janet lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is a food vendor dealing in fresh foods. Janet began her business so as to have a source of income after dropping out of school due to early pregnancy. She dreams of expanding her business, though she faces the challenges of limited capital and competition. Janet is hard working and intends to use this loan to buy tomatoes, avocados, and other fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, avocados, and other fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Yesayi

texts.en:
This young man is 22 years old and his name is Yesayi. He lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. Yesayi lives with his father who is a driver. Yesayi has no higher education nor any work experience, but he is already a skilled farmer thanks to his father’s farming experience and advice to him. Yesayi now has a cute farm and a plot of land. He cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, and greens. On his farm he has two cows, a calf, a piglet, and 20 chickens. Yesayi feels happy with his occupation and his father is very proud of his son, who despite his young age is clever and already a successful farmer. Yesayi sells his farm products, including milk, meat, eggs and vegetables, at the city wholesale market, and, for their small family, the income is rather good.

Yesayi requests this loan in order to buy animal fodder for his cattle. As he likes to say, his farm must be clean and cute, the vegetables watered, and, most importantly, the cattle must always be fed.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Joza

texts.en: Joza is aged 34 years, married with six children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She sells mainly cassava flour, a business she started after realizing that her husband had neglected his role of looking after the family and children. She is a hardworking woman looking forward to educating her children; however, she is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Joza has asked for a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials to build an outbuilding and buy 100 chicks to raise.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame NENE assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 98 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the BENKADI 4 group are married women, who are on average 36 years old and have on average 4 children, and who live for the most part in traditional families in KOUOROBARAGE, a village in the KOUORO commune in the SIKASSO circle, the third administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans were properly repaid. The crops grown are rice with Mrs. NENE, seated in the center of the photo in this women’s group BENKADI 4. With this loan, she plans to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 98,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Luis Alberto se dedica al negocio de venta de productos naturales,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar productos naturales como plantas y hierbas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto manages his business of selling natural products. He works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Luis already has four years of experience in this business and is doing very well. His dream is to expand his business of selling natural products.

Luis Alberto is requesting a loan in order to buy natural products, such as plants and herbs. He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy natural products, such as plants and herbs.

loans.name: Abdel Khalek

texts.en:
Abdel Khalek is a 46-year-old married Sudanese citizen who has been working as a concierge in Lebanon for three years to improve his family's living situation. He is well known in his region because of his hard work and good reputation. Abdel Khalek is trusted by his employers and they can rely on him for everything they need.

Abdel Khalek's income is enough to cover his needs, but he needs additional external support to cover unexpected expenses. For this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his wife's passport and visa to bring her to live with him in Lebanon in order to settle and make their own happy family together. He hopes to improve his living in the future and remain capable of providing his family with all the necessities.

loans.use: To pay for his wife's passport and visa to bring her to live with him in Lebanon

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en:
Sanu Maiya is 36 years old.  She is married and has no children.  Many years ago, she established her meat shop.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. 

Sanu Maiya has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and she used her most recent loan to buy chickens and goats for her business.  In the future, she plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh.  In small stalls along busy roads, open air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo.  The stalls are piled high with products and sales are brisk.  With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices.  This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrowers.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 2 Group

texts.es:
Don Natividad tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos en el municipio de Intibucá. El siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura y tiene más de 30 años de tener sus propios cultivos. Cosecha maíz, frijoles, papas y tomate. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Solicita otro préstamo por 12,000 lempiras para comprar insecticidas, abonos, cal, y semilla de papas para su cultivo y darle buena asistencia. Su idea es aumentar el área de producción para incrementar ingresos familiares.
Don natividad pertenece al grupo llamado Nuevo Renacer 2, que está formado por 6 miembros, todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de papa y granos básicos. El préstamo grupal es por 59,000 Lempiras que los invertirán en la compra de abonos, semillas e insecticidas para el cultivo de papas. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda al frente esta María, don Natividad y Eusebio a la derecha, atrás a la izquierda esta Ángel, Celso y Eugenio a la derecha.
texts.en:
Don Natividad is 59 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their six children in the municipality of Intibucá. He has always worked in agriculture and has grown his own crops for more than 30 years. He grows corn, beans, potatoes and tomatoes. He sells this produce in the local market.

He is asking for another loan of 12,000 lempiras to buy insecticides, manure, lime and seed potatoes so he can grow them and look after them well. His intention is to increase his production area in order to increase the family's income.

Natividad is in the Nuevo Renacer 2 communal bank, which is made up of 6 members. They all live in the same community and earn a living growing potatoes and basic grains.

The group loan is for 59,000 lempiras which they will use to buy manure, seed and insecticides for growing potatoes.

In the photo María is on the front left, with Natividad and Eusebio to the right, and at the back from left to right are Ángel, Celso and Eugenio.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes, manure and insecticides for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 49-year-old married mother of eight children. She works hard with her husband, who works as a taxi driver, to provide them with the necessary living needs and education through working in the clothes-selling business for the past nine years.
Layla is a hard worker who puts forth so much effort to meet her customers needs and requests and to keep them happy with what they buy.
Today, Layla is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business' merchandise with new-released special-offer summer  collection clothes especially for the Holy month of Ramadan celebrations.
She hopes that, in the future, she can move to a wider shop in order to diversify her products and attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase her business' merchandise with a new-released special-offered summer collection clothes especially for the Holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora de 52  años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de Tortillas,  sus clientes son personas de la zona que tienen muchos años de ser sus clientes. 
Doña Isidora vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras, es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Isidora está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como: Maíz, Leña y cal para poder seguir elaborando sus tortillas, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende comprar los productos por mayor y conseguir mejores precios, al mismo tiempo  espera mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es crecer su negocio tener más clientela para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio de 2014
texts.en:
Sra. Isidora is 52 years old and lives in her own home along with her children. She has been in the business of selling tortillas for 10 years. Her customers are people from the area who have known her for many years.

Doña Isidora lives in a neighborhood in southern Honduras. She is an enterprising woman who has the will to get ahead and press forward each day so that she can improve her quality of life.

Doña Isidora is requesting a loan in order to buy products such as corn, firewood, and lime powder so that she can continue making tortillas. With the help of this loan, she intends to buy these products in bulk so that she can get the best prices. At the same time, she hopes to improve her earnings and also her quality of life. Isidora is a new client who has wanted to work with Prisma.

Her dreams include growing her business, having more customers, and being able to help her children get ahead.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime powder for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame SETOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 98 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the BENKADI 5 group are married women, who are on average 36 years old and have on average 4 children, and who live for the most part in traditional families in KOUOROBARAGE, a village in the KOUORO commune in the SIKASSO circle, the third administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth group loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans were properly repaid. The crops grown are rice with Mrs. SETOU, standing on the right in the photo in this women’s group BENKADI 5. With this loan, she plans to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 98,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila is 38 years old. She is married and has two children aged 21 and 17. Many years ago, she established her vegetable business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supoorts her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy chickens and goats for her business.  In the future, Lila plans to raise the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 
 Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fetilizers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married Ugandan man with two children aged between nine and three and both attend school.
For the last five years, he has been operating a retail shop stocked with general merchandise which he has further supplemented with farming to get additional income. He needs a loan to add more stock of sugar, salt and soap to sell. He dreams of constructing a better residential house for his family. Limited capital is the challenge affecting his operations.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with five children who lives in Kyenjojo Uganda. She sells sodas, cooking oil, salt, soap and other merchandise. She obtains additional income from a motorcycle (boda boda) business. Her vision is to look after her children and build a house even though she experiences hardships of low customer demand and bad debts. She hopes to become economically okay using the proceeds from her business.

Rosemary needs the loan to buy to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy spirits, soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
Al hablar de John podemos evidenciar que es un hombre muy trabajador y servicial que todo lo que hace es en bien de su familia y bienestar de la misma.
El vive en una humilde casa a las afueras del municipio de Medellín, Antioquia donde convive con su esposa y sus hijos por los cuales ha luchado para darles una vida digna y una educación de calidad.
El se gana la vida con la producción agropecuaria de café y la cría de pollos, actividad que le ha permitido sobrevivir todo este tiempo, es por eso que tiene plena fe en su negocio.
Es un individuo trabajador, constante y muy amante de sus hijos.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos agropecuarios que le permita mantener sus cultivos en perfectas condiciones, adicional a esto requiere capitalizar su negocio para garantizar su permanencia.
El tiene la esperanza de poder encontrar ayuda en las personas de corazón solidario.
texts.en:
From speaking with John, we can see that he is a hardworking and helpful man and that everything he does is for the good and wellbeing of his family. He lives in a modest house on the outskirts of the town of Medellin, Antioquia. He lives there with his wife and children, for whom they have fought to give a decent life and a quality education.

He makes a living by coffee farming and raising chickens. This business has allowed him to survive all this time, which is why he has full faith in his business. He is a solitary worker, steady and very loving of his children.

He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural fertilizer that allows him to keep his crops in perfect condition. This requires additional capital for his business to ensure its permanence. He hopes of finding help from people with caring hearts.

loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy agricultural inputs to assist her crops of corn and beans.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a widow with five children. She earns her living by selling charcoal seven days per week. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. Her major challenges include seasonality and thieves. She generates additional income from rental houses.

Resty lives with her children in a house without electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy bags of charcoal to offer for sale.    

Her goal is to become a wholesaler, as well as to build more rental rooms to offer for rent.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.ru:
Мамурчон  очень доброжелательный мужчина в возрасте 34 лет.  Он женат, но пока не имеет детей.  Он с женой живет в сельской местности. Мамурчон и его супруга не имеют высшего образования и жена является  домохозяйкой.
Сам Мамурчон уже не в первом поколении дехканин.  Он работает на поле. Точно также как и его предки,  Мамурчон выращивает  сельскохозяйственные продукты.

Он очень любит свое дело и получает от этого дела хороший доход.  Жена его помогает ему во всем. У них очень крепкий супружеский союз. В данный момент Мамурчон хочет приобрести для дома холодильник, чтоб хранить там продукты питания. Но у него на данный момент не имеется достаточной суммы для покупки. Поэтому  он обратился в Арванд с надеждой на финансовую поддержку.  Мамурчон хочет получить кредит на покупку холодильника. Он заранее благодарит Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Mamurjon is a very friendly 34-year-old man. He is married, but does not yet have children. He and his wife live in the countryside. Mamurjon and his wife do not have a higher education, and his wife is a homemaker. Mamurjon is not a first-generation farmer. He works in the field just as his ancestors did. Mamurjon farms. 

He loves his job and makes a good income. His wife helps him in everything. They have a very strong marriage. Currently Mamurjon wants to buy a refrigerator to store food in his house. However, he does not have enough money. He therefore approached Arvand with the hope of receiving financial support. Mamurjon wants a loan to buy a refrigerator. He thanks Arvand in advance and is hoping for positive results.

loans.use: buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Lucy Vanessa

texts.es:
Lucy es una joven emprendedora, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Palpa junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera y siempre ha tenido que luchar para poder sacar a su pequeño hijo adelante, ya que no sus padres son de escasos recursos y no alcanzaba el dinero para apoyarla.
Desde hace más de 2 años trabaja en una ferretería, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y porque poco a poco se ha ganado el respeto y admiración de los clientes.
Lucy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá empezar a construir su vivienda para que de esta manera pueda brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y puedan vivir en un ambiente más cómodo y seguro. Así seguirá luchando para más adelante poder cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Lucy is an enterprising young woman. She is 33 years old and single, and she lives in Palpa with her family. As a single mother, she has always had to struggle to provide for her little son; her parents have scarce resources and they can't afford to support her financially.

For more than two years, Lucy has worked in a hardware store. It is going very well for her because she is a very responsible, hardworking, honest person, and because little by little, she has earned the respect and admiration of the customers.

Lucy is grateful to the Kiva lenders; with the support they have provided, she will be able to begin construction of her house. This will enable her to provide her family with a better quality of life and allow them to live in a more comfortable and safe environment. Then, in the future, she will be able to continue striving to fulfill her greatest dream: to have her own business.

loans.use: to construct her house

loans.name: Fuente De Bendicion Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Fuente de Bendición,” or “Fountain of Blessing” was formed some time ago by seven women in the town of Cantel, Quetzaltenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. This is an an area rich with dense vegetation where the vast majority of indigenous Maya work on small-scale farms. 

The ladies of the Trust Bank are enthusiastic and motivated to work hard and improve their quality of life. María is a member of the group who has a food business. She sells “Garnachas,” a traditional Guatemalan appetizer made of meat or beans, chiles, sauce and cheese, as well as French fries. This 25-year-old hard-working lady joined the group to acquire capital for her small business and to purchase necessary supplies including corn, lime, meat and potatoes. She learned to cook from her mother, and after getting married, decided to open her own food business. She sells her delicious food in front of her house on weekends. María is an example of a successful woman, who along with her husband, supports her small three-year-old daughter. The couple is determined to focus on their goal of maintaining their new household and seeing their daughter complete her education.

María is happy to be a member of the Trust Bank and has been elected treasurer. She has the trust and support of the other ladies in the group. She is very enthusiastic, along with everyone in the Trust Bank, to acquire knowledge about how to improve her standard of living, take care of her family, and ensure the success of her small food business. Each month, a Friendship Bridge loan officer shares useful information with all of the women on how to effectively manage their loans, improve the health of their families and understand their rights as women. “Microcredit Plus” is the name that Friendship Bridge gives to this valuable combination of education and small loans.

It is nearly impossible for an indigenous woman to walk into a bank in Guatemala and request a loan. Non-governmental organizations like Friendship Bridge offer a valuable opportunity for impoverished women to empower themselves and move themselves, their families and their communities forward. Kiva lenders are most appreciated for their willingness and generosity in providing capital for loans. Thank you, Kiva lenders, from the seven women of the “Fuente de Bendición” Trust Bank!

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies including corn, lime, meat and potatoes for her food business.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  BENKADI 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame KADIA KASSIM débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  BENKADI 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 61 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The five members of the BENKADI 6 group are married women, who are on average 34 years old and have on average 3 children, and who live for the most part in traditional families in KOUOROBARAGE, a village in the KOUORO commune in the SIKASSO circle, the third administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth seasonal loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans were properly repaid. The crops grown are rice with Mrs. KADIA KASSIM, standing in the center in the photo in this women’s group BENKADI 6. With this loan, she plans to buy one 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and one container of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.25 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 61,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jekawili 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKAWILI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame  BINTA assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JEKAWILI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 98 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to build up their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth seasonal loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans were properly repaid. The crops grown are rice with Mrs. BINTA, sitting at the far right in the photo in this women’s group JEKAWILI 1. With this loan, she plans to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 98,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Hilala

texts.en:
Hilala is a 58-year-old widowed Palestinian refugee and mother of two who has spent most of her life working hard to provide her children with necessities. Her husband passed away, leaving her responsible for their living.

Hilala started her own vegetable selling business 19 years ago in the Palestinian camp where she lives.In addition to vegetables, Hilala sells special seasonal Mouneh needs, in addition to oven spare parts and accessories to make sure that she can benefit from several sources of income in one place. 

Hilala is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special Mouneh needs, in addition to oven accessories. This will be her tenth loan cycle at Al Majmoua. Her previous loans helped her a lot in diversifying her products and improving her family's living.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special Mouneh needs, in addition to oven accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru:
Дилшод жизнерадостный  и трудолюбивый  мужчина в возрасте 37 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. У него и его жены нет высшего образования из-за отсутствия финансовых возможностей. Дилшод со своей семьей живет в районе Рудаки. Жена его домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей.

У Дилшода имеются большие навыки по присмотру за мелким и крупным скотом. Он занимается животноводством вот уже несколько лет и имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. А его жена помогает ему в этом. Она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас  Дилшод хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес.  Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за финансовой помощью. Дилшод хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Dilshod is a cheerful and hardworking 37-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He and his wife do not have a higher education due to lack of financial opportunities. Dilshod and his family live in Rudaki. His wife is a housewife who is bringing up children. 

Dilshod is extremely skilled in caring for sheep and cattle. He has been working in the livestock business for several years and has extensive experience. His wife helps him. He sells milk. Dilshod wants to increase his cattle and expand his business. He therefore approached Arvand for financial aid. Dilshod wants to get a loan to buy cattle. He thanks Arvand in advance and is hoping for positive results.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Jekawili 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKAWILI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 33-year-old married mother of two. She supports her husband in providing for their family's needs through her business that she established two years ago.

She used to work in a clothing factory, until she decided to increase her income and develop her own business. She opened her shop where she sells bed covers and sheets. She has been managing it well ever since she opened it. Faten is well known in her region. She is very talented in her business and makes sure to buy low-priced products of an excellent quality. This helps her keep her customers happy and encourages them to stay loyal.

Today, Faten is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase the amount of merchandise by purchasing a special collection that will attract more customers and increase her sales. She is working hard to move her shop to another place next to the main road so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase a special collection for inventory

loans.name: Jekawili 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKAWILI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.

The crops grown are rice with Mrs. ASSATA, sitting on the far right in the photo in this women’s group JEKAWILI 3. With this loan, she plans to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 98,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Maalimkan

texts.ru: Маалимкан 56 лет, замужем, 5 детей, все взрослые, семейные, проживают в России. У Маалимкан - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав более 30 лет назад, с покупки скота. Благодаря упорному труду Маалимкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров, 6 овец, 1 лошадь и земельный надел, мерою 2,00 ГА. На  0,90 ГА Маалимкан с супругом выращивают кукурузу, которая служит кормом для скота, на 0,70 ГА посадили арбузы, а на остальной территории - болгарский перец. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Маалимкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы, что повлияет на объемы собираемого урожая осенью, и повлечет за собой увеличение прибыли. Хороший урожай важен для Маалимкан и ее семьи, экологически чистые продукты пользуются большим спросом среди покупателей. Доходы от кредита Маалимкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своей деятельности и хочет накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Maalimkan is 56 years old and married with five children. They are all adults with their own families living in Russia. Maalimkan has a secondary education. As an additional source of income for her family, she works in animal husbandry. She started more than thirty years ago when she bought some cattle. Because of Maalimkan's hard work, her farm now has six dairy cows, six sheep, one horse and a 2 hectare plot of land. Maalimkan and her spouse grow corn, which serves as food for cattle. On .7 hectares they have planted watermelons, and on the rest of the land they grow peppers. Their monthly income is about 7,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her farm, Maalimkan approached the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy fertilizer for the soil to increase her crop yield in the fall and increase profits. A good harvest is important for Maalimkan and her family, and eco-friendly products are in great demand among buyers. Maalimkan plans to invest profits from the loan in the further expansion of her business, and she wants to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for growing environment friendly vegetables

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, age 25, is a Zoona agent, operating her own mobile money transfer business. This business allows customers without bank accounts to send money to rural areas. It is easy, quick, and safe. People in Esther’s community, Chilanga, come to her to send and receive money, so the outlet plays an integral part in the community. 

This inspiring young woman loves being an entrepreneur. Running her own business has given Esther the opportunity to be flexible while she continues her schooling. She is able to earn an income while working to obtain a diploma. In addition to running her own operation, she also works part-time at another Zoona booth as a teller. Esther currently employs two ladies who work in her booth. One of them is her twin sister. They live together in Chilanga. Their goal is to build a strong, supportive business for the future. 

The responsibilities of running her own outlet have allowed Esther to be independent and disciplined in her decisions. In Zambia, working capital is difficult to obtain, so Esther appreciates the opportunity to be connected with Kiva. She currently faces a challenge in that she does not have enough electronic money or cash for some transactions, so she has to turn customers away, which she dislikes having to do. She is therefore requesting a loan in order to increase and boost her cash flow. This will mean more customers, more transactions, and a greater profit. This Kiva loan will therefore help Esther to build a more lucrative business. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her business by adding another outlet in Chilanga.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to serve more customers by allowing them to send and receive money at her shop

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Chanthorn makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work selling household supplies from home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thoeun's Group

texts.en: Thoeun’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thoeun makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Angel Alfredo

texts.en:
Angel Alfredo is a 23-year-old farmer who lives alone in an isolated house in one of the 808 non-electrified Oaxaca villages (Mexico). To mitigate his solitude he listens to the radio many hours per day, and the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house to plug a radio in makes easier its life. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house

loans.name: Humberto

texts.en:
Humberto is a farmer who lives with his wife and 4 children (a 12-year-old girl is the eldest) in a rural community of the State of Oaxaca. The lack of electricity in their house made him go on 12-km journeys to charge the batteries of their small electrical appliances (radio). A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house gives power to those appliances, as well as additional hours of lighting, and prevents Hugo displacements. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en:
Catarino is an old man who lives with his son, daughter-in-law and grandson, all together in a poor 15-sqm house located in an Oaxaca village that is not planned to be electrified by means of grid extension. But now Catarino has the chance of using a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house to have 4 hours of electrical lighting and connect a radio or charge a mobile phone. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this old man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, in the picture surrounded with some neighbors from Rincon Tagolaba (a remote village in Mexico), is a farmer who thinks necessary that his family have a basic electrical lighting at home. He decided thus to install a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in order to use the generated electricity for illuminating his house by night. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Clemente

texts.en:
Clemente is a 55-year-old Mexican farmer who lives in an isolated location without traditional electricity service. Before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house, he used candles by night and went to his relatives’ house when he needed to charge his mobile phone. Now, with the electricity generated by the SSHS, he has three lamps for lighting for 4 hours and can charge his mobile phone at home. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en: Yin’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yin makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a farmer who lives with his wife and two little children in a small and isolated house in a remote village of the State of Oaxaca (Mexico). The children, a 5-year-old girl and a 2-year-old boy, have to stay at home because their school is closed due to the lack of students. A Small Solar Home System, SSHS, installed in their house facilitates a basic education for these children thanks to the provision of 4 hours of electrical lighting and the possibility of connecting little appliances. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for PV system installation in his house.

loans.name: Jekawili 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JEKAWILI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOUOROBARAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame AMI débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme JEKAWILI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 98 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the JEKAWILI 4 group are married women, who are on average 35 years old and have on average 4 children, and who live for the most part in traditional families in KOUOROBARAGE, a village in the KOUORO commune in the SIKASSO circle, the third administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to build up their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth seasonal loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and the previous loans were properly repaid. The crops grown are rice with Mrs. AMI, standing on the far right in the photo in this women’s group JEKAWILI 4. With this loan, she plans to buy three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and two containers of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After harvest, the goods are sold at the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 98,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor
