loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo lives with his wife and 7 children in Rincon Tagolaba, a small village without traditional electrification and out of grid extension plans. In the picture, Guillermo is showing the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house, as well as the certificate of having been trained in its use. With that SSHS they have 4 hours of electrical lighting and the chance of charging the mobile phone and connecting a radio that they listen very frequently, being their main link to the world. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this head of family pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en: An’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. An makes a living cultivating rice and  she also does extra work buying and selling snacks to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
This smiling man is Esteban, a Mexican farmer who lives in a remote community of the State of Oaxaca. He is very happy now because he has achieved to have light at home for the first time in his life. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which he was gathering when this picture was taken, gives him and his wife a basic electricity service that provides 4 hours of electrical lighting and the connection of a radio or the charge of a mobile phone. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en: Samath’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Samath makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work selling snacks and candy at a local school to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a housewife who lives with her family in a 20-sqm house, in a remote village called Rincon Tagolaba (Mexico). Her house did not have minimum living conditions because the lack of the traditional electricity service among others. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, improves the habitability with 4 hours of electrical lighting and the possibility of connecting other little devices that they could not use before. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this housewife pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in her house.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is an Oaxaca farmer who supports his large family of 6 members. They live in a very small house, which is located in a remote village that has not access to electrification through power lines. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which he is taking in the picture, overcomes the lack of traditional electrification, by providing this family a basic lighting service which can be used for having dinner or extending their daily tasks such as cutting off the corn kernels. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Here's Andres proudly showing his certificate of having been trained to use a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, whose installation has changed the everyday life of this old farmer and his wife. Now they have 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so they can cook or have dinner without the risks of fire that candles and oil lamps may provoke. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a young housewife living with his husband and 4 children in a little community of the State of Oaxaca, one of the poorest of Mexico. She was worried about her children's future, when they did not have light at home because the power lines do not arrive. Nowadays there is a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in their house that provides 4 additional hours of lighting which will allow her children to do their homework when they have: at present the eldest is 6 years old and the youngest is a baby (still inside his mother in the picture). 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this woman pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in her house.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is a 22-year-old farmer who lives alone in a remote community in the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He did not have light at home before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that includes 3 lamps which provide daily 4 hours of light each for reading for instance and the possibility of connecting a radio, mitigating so his isolation. Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.
